loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods, egg, chips, etc.

Pacita has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Pacita would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods, egg, chips, etc.

loans.name: Salustiana

texts.en:
Salustiana is a 73-year-old widow with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. Salustiana requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains for resale.

Salustiana has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking woman who sells beer and sodas in Masindi, Uganda. She has also built houses for lodging in order to earn additional income.

She started her business with the intention of supporting her family's well being. She has a dream of growing her bar into a modern one and being able to overcome competition and inadequate capital, which are major setbacks to her business.

Betty is in need of a loan to buy beer and sodas for for sale during this festive season.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas for sale during this festive season.

loans.name: José David

texts.es: José David, tiene la edad  de 26  años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa, la cual es mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas para hacer la reparación de su vehículo el cual es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados en los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo y poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jose David is 26 years old and lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority. With the loan he plans to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle which is of great importance to be able to transport the materials that he uses in his farm and hence for his crops to get timely attention.
This is the first loan received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with much lower interest rates and better facilities.

loans.use: to repair his work vehicle.

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul is 21 years old and already runs his own zoona mobile money transfer business in a town called Choma, in the southern province of Zambia. Saul’s main objective is to make easy, quick and safe money transfer facilities accessible to people in Choma.

Being able to run his own business has allowed Saul to provide basic needs for himself. Saul is looking to improve his life by growing his business and progressively have his outlet become more lucrative and sustainable. This would ensure his long-term comfort and peace of mind.

Saul has requested a loan so that he can have a good working capital float needed to serve his customers better. This will increase his transaction volume as he will be able to serve his customers faster.

Saul would like to thank the Kiva lenders for helping him improve his life.

loans.use: to generate enough capital to grow his business so that he can serve more customers.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 43-year-old married father of three children. He has been employed as a driver at a company for 15 years.

His limited salary is not enough to cover his family's increasing needs and expenses. Thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay his three boys' school tuition fees. Jamal is a sacrificing father who deprives himself for the sake of his children. He believes that education is the only way to guarantee his three boys' future.

Jamal hopes to open his own business in the future to increase his income and stay capable of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his three boys' school tuition fees.

loans.name: Toshmat

texts.en:
Toshmat was born in 1962 year. He is hardworking and industrious man, with a higher education. He is a teacher and he has worked in a local school for 6 years, where he is one of the best teachers. His pupils like his lessons and his colleagues respond to him.

Toshmat tries hard for the well-being of his 2 children and he wants to see them as highly educated people. Now, his son is a student of the first semester, that’s why Toshmat must pay for his university tuition. He is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition of his son. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of his son.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina was born in 1959 year. She is widowed and has a son. Amina is a very clever and smart woman. She has been busy with sewing the national mattress “Kurpacha”. She has been working in this field more than 20 years, so has great experience. She manages with business alone and thanks to her hard work she has regular clients.

Amina now needs to financial support. She is ill and she must go to doctor for treatment. Amina is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her treatment .

loans.name: Friendship Group

texts.en:
Hậu is 50 years old and she is married with two children.

She has had a manufacturing business, sewing curtains for more than ten years. Hậu lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her business has created jobs for many workers in the region, but the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hậu faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bedding for resale.

In 2014, Hậu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hậu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of the Friendship group, which consists of three members.

With her business profits, Hậu hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase bedding for resale.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Muslima was born in 1994. She is married and has two children.

Muslima and her husband are workers. They work for a private organization. Muslima has worked in this organization for some years. She is a very hardworking woman and does her job well. She has a small salary, and her salary is not enough to buy medicine as she is ill.

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy medicine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Marites dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 37 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mae has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. Mae requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen food to sell.

Mae has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Ruzzel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a rice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like manicure business.

Ruzzel dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure business.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is 63 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell at her store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

Pacencia has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Pacencia would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is 31 years old. He owns a Zoona mobile money transfers shop in Livingstone, the tourist city of Zambia. He comes from a large extended family. Harold describes his business as the service of sending and receiving money. He is very proud of the fact that he has been able to start his business from scratch.

Before Harold started his own business, he was a teller at one of the Zoona mobile money transfer outlets performing duties of helping customers to send and receive money. This gave Harold confidence in himself and helped him to push through with his dream of opening his own business. Harold learned how the mobile money business works and how to provide good customer service.

He enjoys running his business because he sees the impact it has on the community. People do not have to use transport money to go into the central business area to access financial services. Harold also likes that it is a decent way to earn a living.

Harold is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase the kiosk that he currently uses to operate his business and increase his working capital (the money that he uses to serve his customers) to enable him serve customers well. Right now, Harold’s float is not enough because his shop is located in the area of Livingstone, where the demand is so high that he cannot satisfy all the customers. This loan will enable Harold to serve more customers and earn more profits. He will use the profit from his loan to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona trading kiosk and have the money needed to serve people who need access to financial services.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Riza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Riza successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

In the future, Riza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Nirinasoa Madeleine Aimée

texts.fr:
58 ans, Madeleine est mariée et son mari est déjà retraité (pensionnaire). Le couple est parent de cinq enfants qui sont tous déjà mariés.
Elle exerce une activité de vente ambulante de différents articles, elle ne se contente par sur un type de produit. Elle fait aussi des crochets (sur commandes). Elle fait des portes à portes ou se déplace de bureau en bureau et ne vend que des produits commandés par ses clients.
Pour la sécurité de sa vieillesse et son avenir, elle s'efforce de travailler encore tant qu'elle a la force, malgré son âge. Elle voudrait être autonome et indépendante surtout vis à vis de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a 58-year-old married woman whose husband has already retired. The couple has five children who are all already married. 

She is involved in the door-to-door sale of different items; she does not sell just one type of product. She also crochets to order. She goes door to door or office to office and only sells products that have been ordered by her clients. 

For the security of her old age and future, she strives to work while she still has the strength, despite her age. She would like to be autonomous and independent, especially with regard to her children.

loans.use: to buy three mobile phones, 20 pairs of sandals, 20 pairs of shoes, 20 nail polishes, six ladies bags and 20 lipsticks.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking 40-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 23 while the youngest is 3 . She earns a living by engaging in a ready-to wear business selling items such as footwear and clothing apparel. Jose, her husband, has an income that helps cover the family's daily expenses.

Jennifer wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to acquire additional capital to purchase more supplies of ready-to wear clothes like shirts, pants and sandals in order to continue improving her business. In that way, she could be able to set aside some of her profit for future use.

Jennifer was able to pay back her previous loan successfully and now she is requesting a new loan to continue expand her business.

loans.use: to  purchase more supplies of ready-to-wear clothes like shirts, pants and sandals.

loans.name: Erjel

texts.en:
Erjel is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Erjel has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

In the future, Erjel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestocl to raise.

loans.name: Lorraine

texts.en:
Lorraine is 22 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lorraine has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Lorraine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bevien

texts.en:
Bevien is 51 years old and married with one child. With one child in school, Bevien works very hard to provide for them.

Bevien runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, eggs, spices, chips, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years

In the future Bevien would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, eggs, spices, chips, etc.

loans.name: Fénix Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Veracruz es común encontrar diversas fábricas donde se procesa la caña de azúcar las cuales son conocidas como ingenios. A la temporada en que los jornaleros realizan la cosecha de este producto se le denomina zafra; es por ello que la zona es una de las más importantes productoras del endulzante a nivel nacional. 
   De allí es originario el grupo Fénix cuyos miembros decidieron el nombre por el misticismo y la manera de renacer de dicha ave mitológica. Los integrantes y sus actividades son: Miriam quien invertirá en costuras; Reyna, ropa y calzado; Claudia, ropa y bisutería; Zenaida, un club nutricional; Irma y Arizbhet; cosméticos; María Leticia, María G. y Lizbeth; calzado por catalogo; María J., y Victoria, una estética; Minerva, refaccionaria y Juan, en accesorios para autos.
   Doña Zenaida es una mujer trabajadora quien diariamente se esfuerza por brindarle lo mejor a su familia integrada por su esposo José y sus cuatro hijos los cuales ahora son todos mayores de edad. Para lograr su objetivo se dedica desde hace más de 22 años a la elaboración de un platillo tradicional de la región: la barbacoa. Este alimento es preparando carne, especialmente de oveja, al vapor con algunas especias y envueltas en pencas de maguey lo que le da un sabor único en todo el mundo.  
   Las ganancias obtenidas les permitieron brindar estudios a sus hijos, remodelar su casa y comenzar con una actividad secundaria;  la elaboración de uniformes escolares. De igual forma decidió vender productos naturistas ya que es un negocio saludable y que puede representar un ingreso muy favorable.
   El préstamo solicitado le permitirá invertir en la compra de  áloe, energizante, malteadas, te y café ya que su propósito es remodelar y ampliar el local en donde atiende a los clientes. Finalmente expresa, "la vida me ha sonreído y Dios me ha brindado la oportunidad de continuar". 
*La fotografía fue tomada frente a su club naturista, Doña Zenaida viste blusa rosa.
texts.en:
Various sugar cane processing factories known as ingenios [sugar-mills], are commonly found in the state of Veracruz, and the season in which the laborers harvest this product is called zafra [sugar cane harvest]. That is why this zone is one is one of the most important for the production of sweetener on a national level.

The Fénix [Phoenix] Group originates there. Its members decided upon this name because of the mysticism and manner of this mythological bird's rebirth. The members and their occupations are: Miriam, who will invest in dressmaking; Reyna, clothing and footwear; Claudia, clothing and costume jewelry; Zenaida, a nutritional club; Irma and Arizbhet, cosmetics; María Leticia, María G., and Lizbeth, catalog footwear; María J. and Victoria, a salon; Minerva, a repair shop; and Juan, accessories for autos.

Zenaida is a hardworking woman, who everyday, strives to provide the best for her family, which is composed of her husband, José, and their four children, who are now grown. In order to achieve her objective, she has worked more than 22 years. She prepares a traditional regional dish called la barbacoa. This food is prepared by steaming meat, primarily lamb, with some spices, and wrapping it in pencas de maguey [thick, succulent, agave leaves]. This gives it a flavor that is unique in all the world.

The earnings they obtained allowed them to provide their children with an education, remodel their home, and begin a second occupation, making school uniforms. In the same manner, she decided to sell natural products, as it is a healthy business, and can provide a very good income. The requested loan will allow her to invest in the purchase of aloe, energy drinks, shakes, tea, and coffee, as her goal is to remodel and expand the shop where serves her customers.

Lastly, she says: "Life has smiled upon me, and God has given me the opportunity to continue."

*The photograph was taken in front of her natural products club. Zenaida is wearing a pink blouse.

loans.use: to purchase aloe, energy drinks, shakes, tea, and coffee.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.fr:
Ferdinand a 56 ans actuellement, il est professeur de mathématique et pour améliorer le revenu il s'est accédé dans le secteur agricole en exploitant un petit élevage de porc il y a maintenant trois ans. Pour lui, les bénéfices tirés de l'élevage constituent son épargne. 
Il est marié et sa femme aussi est professeur de langue. Le couple a quatre enfants dont les deux premiers sont déjà mariés (24 et 19 ans) et les deux derniers sont encore à sa charge et scolarisés (16 et 14 ans)
Il voudrait voudrait développer et étendre l'activité d'élevage car plus tard quand il sera retraité de sa profession, il projette de continuer l'exploitation d'élevage.
texts.en:
Ferdinand is currently 56 years old. He is a maths teacher. Three years ago, he went into the agricultural sector, running a small pig farm to increase his income. 

For him, the income from this farm forms his savings. He is married and his wife too is a teacher of languages. The couple has four children: the two eldest are already married (24 and 19 years old) and the two youngest are still in their care and attend school (16 and 14 years old).

He would like to develop and extend his farming activity because, later, when he retires from his profession, he plans to continue running this livestock farm.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and repair the pigsty.

loans.name: Mbene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré en juin 2011. Il regroupe des femmes qui ont de bonnes relations et très solidaires qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce.Elles habitent le même village.
FATOU debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle s'active dans le commerce, elle tient une boutique dans sa localité.
Avec le prêt, elle compte achète 3 barils de mil de 100 kilogrammes chacun, 2 barils de niébé de 50 kilogrammes chacun, 1 baril d'arachide de 100 kilogrammes, 12 yards de tissus et enfin 2 sacs de sucre. Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne au niveau du banc villageois mais aussi développer son activité.
texts.en:
This group is composed of seven members and belongs to a banc villageois launched in June 2011. Its members are women who maintain ties of friendship and solidarity, mainly working as vendors. They live in the same village. Fatou, the one one standing on the right raising her left hand in the photo, is the star borrower. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children. She works as a vendor, keeping a store in her village. 

With her loan, Fatou plans to buy three 100-kg [220 lbs] barrels of millet, two 50-kg [110 lbs] of "niebe" [a type of black bean], one 100-kg barrel of peanuts, 12 yards of clothing and two bags of sugar. The rest of the loan will be her working capital. Thanks to her revenues, she plans to bolster her savings with the banc villageois and also develop her business.

loans.use: to buy 3 barrels of millet, 2 barrels of black beans, 1 barrel of peanuts, 12 yards of cloth, and two bags of sugar.

loans.name: Chadia

texts.en:
Chadia is a 31 year old Lebanese married woman and mother of two young children living with her husband. Her husband is the main source of income source providing the necessities of life. She is a housewife dedicated to her family.

Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register them for the coming school year. This makes her very optimistic and willing to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa lives in Jagna, Bohol with her husband and two children aged 12 and 14. She works hard so that she can provide help as a partner in raising their children.

Elisa sells items from Personal Collection such as detergent powder, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, body talc and lotion. She also offers hairstyling services, hair rebonding and even does laundry services for other families. Elisa also sells bags made from recycled products and rugs. She is asking for a loan to buy chemicals that she can use to curl hair for her customers. This way she can serve more and earn better.

Elisa hope to make her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for hair treatments.

loans.name: Agelica

texts.en:
Agelica is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of theft and seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen used his previous loan to buy cement, iron sheets, and bricks for completion of his house.

Stephen owns a motorcycle transport, which he has been operating for over 9 years. He started it with the ambition of raising more income for his family. He started the business using little savings from his salary working in a tea factory. He is not only in transport but does farming some days growing bananas both for subsistence and commercial purposes. Still the challenges of price fluctuations and limited capital affect the business' growth.

Stephen underestimated the construction job and the funds he took were not enough to complete the job. He has asked for another loan to enable him to pay for labour to paint his house.

loans.use: to pay for labour to paint his house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Peter. He is married and a father of two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in 2015 and has undergone thorough training on enterprise development and financial management. He has benefited a lot and was able to start a greengrocer's.

Peter is a farmer who grows vegetables such as kale and spinach for commercial purposes. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy seeds and fertilizer to boost his business. This will enable him to earn more income that will help him provide better food for his family and pay school fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to boost his business allowing him to earn more income.

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
Lucilla is 65 years old, widowed, and has seven children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucilla requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vitamins and feed.

Lucilla has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jane has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Violeta is 51 years old now.

Violeta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sona Group

texts.en:
Bader is the featured borrower for Sona Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Bader is a 47-year-old divorced woman of two. She is planning to become an independent lady and relies on herself after her divorce. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start her own business of selling clothes. She believes that running her own business will give her a chance to make a good income, as she will benefit from her own hard work. This loan will help her work in a field that she really enjoys, and gain personal satisfaction from working directly with customers and watching her own business succeed.

Bader is the lady sitting in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Ensaf is the lady on the right, and Wafaa is the lady on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to start her own business of selling clothes.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en: Marwa is a 29 year old single woman from Lebanon living with her parents and siblings. Her father is the main income source in the family and works very hard to always be able to fulfill the family needs and to live in a good lifestyle. Marwa is focusing only on her university. Today, in order to pay her university fees, she is requesting a loan from KIVA partner, Vitas s.a.l.  She said that her target is to achieve higher positions and be able to support her family members financially.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 29 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. Her father is an employee in a company and works tirelessly in order to fulfill their daily needs and represents the main income source. Fadia is still studying and focusing only on her school. Today, with the aim to pay her Technical registration fees, she is applying for a loan from KIVA partner, Vitas s.a.l.  In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to continue her education.

loans.use: o pay her Technical registration fees

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
A positive outlook in life, unwavering faith, and patience are Estrella’s virtues that keep her going in life. Her husband got a serious illness and subsequently died. Her son has gone missing while working abroad. He cannot be found as of now, but Estrella is hoping that he’s still alive. Despite all these circumstances, she remains strong. She continuously performs her daily tasks in her business in order to sustain her usual needs.

She grills barbecue beside her house located in Polomolok, South Cotabato. This is a favorite street food of many Filipinos. She has regular customers from the local community, her neighbors, students, and working people. She pays one helper to assist her in her business. Profits derived from her business sustain her and her helper’s daily expenditures.

Estrella is planning to cook more barbecue to take advantage of the opening of the second semester in college. More students are expected to buy from her, and it will boost her income. This is why she prays for PHP 20,000 in additional capital that she will use to buy more ingredients for her barbecue stall. She humbly asks for your kind support that will serve as a great blessing to her.

Aside from her wish to enhance her business, Estrella has one primary dream -- that is to know exactly what happened to her son, to see and to be with him again if he’s still alive, or to give him justice if he’s already dead.

She gets inspiration from her co-fellowship* members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect on God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her barbecue stall.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. Ruth is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nails, wood, paints, etc. Ruth has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nail, wood, paints, etc

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a hardworking woman who runs a retail shop that sells plastics, soap, sodas and sugar, among other items. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. Harriet started the business so as to  earn a living. She has houses for rent as her additional income. Harriet used the previous loan to buy general merchandise, like soap, sodas, sugar and juice to sell and is grateful to Kiva for the support that enabled her to make good profits and prepay the loan. She hopes to grow her business and open up a second one but inadequate capital is still a challenge. As we approach the Christmas season, Harriet is intending to fully stock her business and make as big sales as she can. She needs a loan to buy  plastics, soap, sodas and sugar for selling.

loans.use: to buy  plastics, soap, sodas and sugar for selling.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une veuve femme  avec cinq enfants à charge. Akouvi est âgée de 33 ans et vit à Tokoin où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice  de la pâte bandée « kom » faite à base du maïs. Akouvi s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Akouvi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs et le panier de tomates fraîches afin de bien revendre puis gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à ses enfants en améliorant leurs conditions de vie quotidiennes et à avoir une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a widow with five dependent children. Akouvi is 33 years old and lives in Tokoin where she works preparing a mash called “kom” made from a base of corn. 

Akouvi procures the necessary ingredients once a month from the market and resells the “kom” in front of her home. Akouvi is requesting this loan to order some bags of corn and a basket of fresh tomatoes to increase her resales. 

The increase in her income will go towards helping her children by improving their daily living conditions and allowing them to gain a good education.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn and one basket of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 55 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling cakes, sweets, milk, soft drinks,.. and general things for two years.

Hương lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, this job is unstable. The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, milk, soft drinks,... to resell. Although this is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members in Solidarity group agreed to vote Hương to be group leader.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, milk, soft drinks,... to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person in the photo is called Mary. She is married and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013 and has undergone thorough training in enterprise development and financial management. She has benefited a lot and was able to start a green grocer.

Mary is a farmer who grows vegetables such as kale and spinach for commercial purposes. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy seeds and fertilizer to boost her farming business. This will enable her to earn more income that will help provide better food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to boost her farming business.

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan is 51 years old and she is married.

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles for 5 years. Loan lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Loan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more noodles and tools to cook noodles for sale.

In 2014, Loan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Loan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more noodles and tools to cook noodles for sale.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Ran’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.  Ran makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 33-year-old Lebanese married woman and mother of two children, both of them still attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life.

Despite the bad financial situation, she is requesting today a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s registration fees for the coming school year. This makes her very happy and optimistic.

loans.use: to pay her children’s registration fees for the coming school year.

loans.name: Vân's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vân is 42 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.

Vân lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Vân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools for fishing.

In 2013, Vân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She always repays on time.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her family will be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase tools for fishing

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Em’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Em makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yorn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en: Hun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Hun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Ran’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ran makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Savaen's Group

texts.en: Savaen’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savaen makes a living cultivating rice  to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lam's Group

texts.en:
Narin’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Narin makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saovan's Group

texts.en:
Saovan’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saovan makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Maripositas Group

texts.es:
En una de las comunidades pertenecientes al barrio viejo dentro de “La novia del sol” en Veracruz, está ubicado el grupo llamado Maripositas. Dicho nombre hace referencia a la belleza y la libertad que tienen estos bellos insectos y que los integrantes anhelan cada uno con su propia actividad. Ellos son: Luz, Julia y Selene quienes invertirán en comida; Karina, repostería; María De Jesús, repostería y hielos; Dulce, repostería y productos naturistas; Erika y Alicia, un club de nutrición; María del Carmen, ropa e Ismari, calzado por catálogo. 
   Doña Luz María es conocida por todos como Luz y está casada con Antonio, actualmente esta pareja se hace cargo de dos nietos a quienes consideran como sus hijos. Para emplear sus ratos libres y además generar ingresos extras decidió vender comida típica todos los fines de semana en la comodidad de su casa. Tiene nueve años de experiencia con esta actividad y su jornada laborar consiste en preparar los platillos justo al momento en que los comensales comienzan a llegar. Mientras tanto entre sus nietos y su hija toman las ordenes con la mejor de las atenciones. 
   Por otro lado, cada uno de los préstamos ha sido en beneficio de su actividad ya que reinvierte en ingredientes, además de utensilios para cocinar. Para continuar con su actividad planea invertir en la compra de carne, crema, queso, chiles, verdura, aceite, azúcar, arroz, canela, agua purificada y gas para aumentar sus ventas. "Gracias por creer en nosotros, por el apoyo que nos han brindado y sobre todo por motivarnos para continuar" son las palabras que expresan las integrantes del grupo.
* La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Maricela, doña Luz está detrás de María de Jesús quien viste  blusa gris y al lado de Selene porta un suéter color rojo.
texts.en:
In one of the communities within the old neighborhood of "The bride of the sun" in Veracruz, meets a group called "Maripositas" (The Little Butterflies). This name refers to the beauty and freedom that these beautiful insects have and that the group members all long to achieve through their activities.  They are: Luz, Julia, and Selene, who will invest in food; Karina, in sweets; Maria de Jesus, in sweets and frozen treats; Dulce, in sweets and natural products; Erika and Alicia, a nutrition club; Maria del Carmen, clothing, and Ismari, shoes from a catalog.

Doña Luz María is known by everyone as Luz and is married to Antonia.  Currently, this couple cares for two of their grandchildren whom they consider their children.  To make use of her free time and, moreover, to generate extra income, she decided to sell typical food on the weekends within the comfort of her home.  She has nine years of experience with this and her labor consists of preparing meals at the moment the diners begin to arrive.  Meanwhile, her grandchildren and her daughter take the orders with the greatest of attention.  

In addition, each one of the loans has been beneficial to her job since she reinvests in ingredients as well as cooking utensils.  To continue with her job, she plans to invest in the purchase of meat, cream, cheese, peppers, vegetables, oil, sugar, rice, cinnamon, purified water, and gas to increase her sales. 

"Thank you for believing in us, for the support that you have offered us and above all, for motivating us to continue" are the words that the group members would like to express.

The photograph was taken in the house of Maricela.  Luz is behind Maria de Jesus who is wearing a gray blouse and to the side of Selene who is wearing a red sweater.

loans.use: to purchase beef and pork, cream, cheese, peppers, vegetables,oil, sugar, rice, cinnamon, purified water and gas.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 36-year-old father of five children. He used the previous loan to increase his stock by buying more animal drugs.

He is a veterinary doctor who operates a veterinary drug shop in Kagadi, Uganda. He also earns from house rentals he built using savings from his government job. This has enabled him to make ends meet and also take care of his family.

He is challenged by lack of capital. He feels that with increased funding, his business can perform better. Wilson wants a loan to buy more animal drugs.

loans.use: to buy more animal drugs.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Ephantus, forty-nine years old and a father to five children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from enterprise and financial management in order to run and manage his business well.

He operates a shop selling household items. He wants to expand his business. However, he is financially constrained, making him borrow a loan from Kiva to buy stock of rice, washing powder, cooking flour, and sugar. He hopes for more income, which will enable him to provide school fees for his children with ease.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, washing powder, cooking flour, and sugar. He hopes for more income that will enable him to provide school fees for his children with ease.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy is 21 years old, a single freshman who is from the Kandal Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Information Technology at a university in the city. His father is a construction worker, and his mother earns a main income as a rice farmer, which make it hard to pay his tuition fees.

Suy has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help him in earning a bachelor’s degree successfully.

After graduation, Suy dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary. He will be able to save money to build his own house, and if he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the town of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has ten children: two adult and eight school-aged children. Her husband raised them through farming, while Delia sells accessories.

She and her husband work hard together to earn a living to provide for the needs of their big family. She is also determined to improve their livelihood to have enough money for their children’s education. In the future, Delia dreams for her children to finish their studies.

As for now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy accessory items such as belts, hair clips, headbands, and combs; she will also buy fashion accessories like earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.use: to buy accessory items such as belts, hair clips, headbands, and combs; she will also buy fashion accessories like earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.name: Volasoa Faralalaina

texts.fr:
Faralalaina est une femme débrouillarde et dynamique de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et le couple a deux enfants. Ces enfants sont âgés de 4 et 6 ans et sont tous scolarisés.
Elle exerce à la fois deux activités sources de revenu: elle exploite une petite gargote et vend des téléphones portables sur facebook. Ça fait quatre ans qu'elle pratique ces deux activités. Elle voudrait développer ses activités, car elle loue les matériels qu'elle utilise dans le gargote, et en ce qui concerne la vente en ligne des téléphones portables, elle voudrait proposer plusieurs articles. 
C'est une femme très active, ayant une bonne attitude commerciale, elle envisage de construire une petite maison et elle s'efforce d'épargner davantage maintenant.
texts.en:
Faralalaina is a resourceful and dynamic 24-year-old woman. She is married and has two children with her husband. The kids are four and six years old; they both go to school.

She runs two businesses simultaneously: she manages a small food stall and sells cellphones on Facebook. She has been running these two businesses for four years. She would like to develop them, since she rents the tools she uses for the food stall; as far as the cellphone sales are concerned, she would like to offer several articles.

She is a hard-working woman with a good commercial attitude. She is considering building a small house, and is currently trying to save more.

loans.use: buy one bag of white rice, meat, vegetables, four pots, and mobile phones.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad  de 29  años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y con alta germinación y fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 29 years old, lives with his common-law partner and children who are his main priority. With the loan he plans to purchase good quality and high germination bean seeds, fertilizers and other products for the plantation. He will also pay manual labor to apply the products and for help with the plantation once it grows to ensure he does a good job.

He plans to take advantage of the good climate and soil of the eastern zone for this crop and to put into practice the various years of experience he has dealing with basic grains. In addition of being able to purchase the best quality products so that his plantation grows well, he will have a healthy and an appropriate harvest and have, in a short time, an important production.

With the revenue that he expects to get from the harvest, he wants to invest in the well-being and education of his family. He wants to reach some family goals and continue to invest in crops.

This is the first loan from FUNDECOR. He has not had any other loans from state banks, but FUNDECOR offered him the loan with better terms and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase beans to plant.

loans.name: Harilalao Honorette

texts.fr:
Harilalao a 55 ans, c'est une femme travailleuse et dynamique. Elle est mariée et son mari travaille en tant que chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants dont trois sont déjà mariés, seulement le dernier est à leur charge et il est scolarisé.
Elle exerce une activité de vente de friperie depuis 2008. Presque sa famille en générale exerce cette activité, ses parents et ses sœurs. Elle est très passionnée de cette activité, elle  pense que  c'est l'activité qui lui convient car par rapport aux autres activités de petit commerce qu'elle exerçait auparavant, c'est celle-ci qui marche très bien et plus bénéfique. De ce fait, elle est très motivée à continuer à développer ce commerce.
texts.en:
Harilalao is fifty-five years old. She is an energetic, hard-working woman. She is married; her husband works as a driver. Together they have four children, three of which are already married. Only the last one is still in their care; he goes to school.

She has been selling second-hand clothes since 2008. Almost everyone in her family, broadly speaking, is in this business, including her parents and sisters. She is very passionate about this business; she thinks it suits her best compared to other retail activities she tried before, because it is well successful and more profitable. Therefore, she is very motivated to keep on and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes (pants, dresses, camis...) and clothes mannequins.

loans.name: Régala

texts.fr: Régala est âgée de 43 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a trois enfants. Elle est dans la revente de chaussures et des vêtements usagés. Cela fait six ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Régala is 46 years old. She lives in an open union with has three children. She earns a living selling second-hand shoes and clothing. She has been doing this for six years. Régala needs this loan to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré en juin 2011. Il regroupe des femmes qui ont de bonnes relations et très solidaires qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l'embouche.
AWA debout à droite la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 garçons et 3 filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce de poissons dans sa localité.
Avec le prêt, elle achète 10 caisses de poissons l'unité à 30 000 FCFA et pour le transport elle paye 5 000 FCFA. Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement. La caisse de poissons est revendue à 35 000 FCFA. Les achats se font mensuellement.
les bénéfices serviront à réinvestir dans d'autres activités comme l'embouche et le commerce de mil, à rembourser son prêt et enfin à participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This seven-member group belongs to the village finance association inaugurated in June 2011. It brings together women who get along well; they are very supportive of one another. Their main businesses are retail, agriculture, and animal farming.

Awa is standing on the right in the photo with her left hand raised. She is the group's featured borrowed. She is fifty-seven years old, married, and mother to four boys and three girls. She works by retailing fish in her town.

With the loan, she will purchase ten boxes of fish costing 30,000 XOF each; she pays 5,000 XOF for transportation. The remainder of the loan will make up her working capital. One box of fish retails for 35,000 XOF. Purchases are monthly.

Profits will be used to invest in other activities such as animal farming and millet trading, to pay back her loan, and finally to participate to daily expenses.

loans.use: buy ten boxes of fish.

loans.name: Marie Suze

texts.fr: Suze a 59 ans et elle est divorcée. Elle vit dans la ville de Bon Repos avec ses deux enfants et elle gère une boutique de produits alimentaires. Elle demande un microcrédit afin d’augmenter son stock mais également de le diversifier.
texts.en:
Suze is fifty-nine years old and divorced. She lives in the city of Bon Repos with her two children.

She manages a grocery store. She is requesting a microloan in order to increase and diversify her stock.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and bags of rice.

loans.name: Mimose

texts.fr: Mimose, 43 ans, est veuve. Elle a trois enfants. Ces derniers sont entièrement sous sa responsabilité. Pour arriver à couvrir les besoins de la famille, elle a mis sur pied une petite activité de revente de chaussures depuis tantôt sept ans. Elle a déjà obtenu des prêts qu’elle a bien utilisés pour faire avancer son commerce. Elle demande ce nouveau prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Mimose is forty-three years old and a widow. She has three children. The kids depend on her entirely.

To be able to pay for her family's needs, she put together a small business reselling shoes almost seven years ago. She has already been granted loans, which she used to grow her business.

She is requesting this new loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: stock up on shoes.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a woman with determination. Three years ago, she started a hog-raising business to help her husband increase their financial stability. She is 35 years old and a mother of two children, 13 and 12 years old. Her husband supports the family by driving a “pedicab” (a cycle rickshaw), a vehicle with three wheels that is moved by foot pedals.

Marites is requesting a loan to buy feeds for her pigs as well as additional piglets. She will also buy food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar, as she is planning to start a food-selling business that can help her increase their earnings.

In the future, Marites wants her business to be profitable enough to support all of their family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets plus food ingredients such as flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.es:
Atanacio con 61 años de edad,de estado civil soltero, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Atanacio se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cuál brinda servicio de transporte,con una experiencia en el rubro de 11 años, por lo que cuenta con clientela de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a realizar labores de panadería. Solicita préstamo para invertir en arreglos y en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil y gastos personales.

Atanacio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,este es su segundo crédito con Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Atanacio is 61 years old, single, and lives in the Pomahuaca district, province of Jaén, Cajamarca department, country of Perú. He has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. Most of the residents of this area make a living in farming, commerce and livestock.

Atanacio makes a living offering public transportation services. He owns a motorcycle taxi that he uses to offer public transportation, he has 11 years of experience in this trade and has customers in the region. In addition, he does some bakery work.

He is requesting the loan to invest in repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle taxi and for personal expenses.

Atanacio is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa and this is his second loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in repairs and maintenance of his transportation vehicle and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro con 52 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Aramango,provincia de Bagua,departamento de Amazonas,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor. Solicita préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. De esta manera le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias y así mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Mauro es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Mauro, 52 years old, is married and lives in his own house made of rustic material, with his wife and two children, in the district of Aramango, Bagua province, Amazonas department, in the country of Peru. He has very good work and personal references on the part of the people in the zone. The inhabitants of this place work primarily in agriculture, commerce, and raising animals.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee of Catimor variety. He asks for the loan to invest in maintaining his coffee crop. In this way, it will allow him to get more earnings and, so, improve his economic condition and, in the end, it will turn into a better life condition.

Mauro is a new borrower with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his coffee crop.

loans.name: Glenda Lisseth

texts.es:
Glenda, de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en construcción porque es albañil; juntos tienen cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estudian y los otros dos se quedan en casa porque están pequeños. 

Glenda, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero quiere dedicarse a la crianza de ganado bovino, hace un tiempo atrás ella tenía ganado, pero por dificultades económicas tuvo que venderlos; actualmente su abuelo es dueño de unas propiedades pastadas y se las va a prestar a ella para que empiece mantenga ahí a su ganado y pueda mejorar sus condiciones económicas.

Glenda, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos terneras para repasto, esto será el inicio de su negocio, porque a corto plazo seguirá invirtiendo más.

Glenda, sueña con tener más vacas para repasto y en el futuro incluso tener vacas lecheras para tener un negocio más fuerte.
texts.en:
Glenda, who is 28 years old, studied until the third grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works in construction, as he is a bricklayer. Together they have four children, two of whom are studying and the other two stay at home because they are small.

Glenda takes care of the household work, but wants to engage in raising cattle. A while back she had cattle, but had to sell them due to financial difficulties. Now her grandfather is the owner of a pasture and he will lend it out to her so she can shepherd her cattle there, so she can improve her economic conditions.

Glenda needs this loan to buy two calves to pasture. This will only be the beginning of her business, because in a short time she will continue to invest more.

Glenda dreams of having more cows to pasture, and in the future she dreams to have dairy cows in order to have a stronger business.

loans.use: to buy two calves to pasture.

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en: Shatha is 24 years old. She is single and she is working in the graphic design area. Shatha is living in a village called Al-Samou, near Hebron city. Her family has little income, so she wants to find a small business for her father. She is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to help her father find his own business. Shatha hopes to have a better standard of living for her life and her family.

loans.use: to help her father to find a small business in order to have an income even it is little.

loans.name: Mudansir

texts.en:
Mudansir is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mudansir has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Mudansir would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mudansir can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Mudansir will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mudansir is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bertilio

texts.es: Bertilio, tiene la edad  de 72  años, está divorciado,  vive solo, su trabajo es para su superación personal. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y con alta germinación y fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en su bienestar y cumplir con algunas metas personales y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Bertilio is 72 years old, divorced, lives alone, and his work is for his personal improvement. With the loan, he plans to purchase good quality bean seeds with high germination and fertilizers and other products to apply to the planted seeds. In addition, he will pay labor costs to apply the products and assistance with the plants once they are developing, and in this way, he will assure himself of doing a good job. What he plans is to take advantage of the good climatic and soil conditions that this zone has for this crop and also to put into practice the years of experience he has growing basic grains. In addition, he plans to be able to purchase the best products of the best quality so that his crop has good development and health as well as a good harvest, and to have, in the short term, a significant production. With the income from the harvest that he expects to get, he wants to use it for his well-being and achieve some personal goals and continue investing more in the crops. This is the first loan that he he has gotten from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en: Saba was concerned about the lack of education opportunities in her area. She suffered growing up in a poor, overcrowded urban area because her school did not have enough resources for the students, and learning was made much more difficult. A year ago she decided to open a school and use the skills she had learned at her previous jobs to provide the children with a better education. Since opening, her school has had 153 enrol and this number will be increasing in the near future. Now, she has borrowed 200,000 PKR in order to construct more rooms and provide the children with resources such as chairs, tables, pencils, paper, and chalk, etc., to make learning easier for the children and encourage the parents to keep their children in school. She is also creating a plan to extend her school building to accommodate more students.

loans.use: to construct more rooms and provide the children with resources such as chairs, tables, pencils, paper, and chalk, etc.

loans.name: Hassani

texts.en:
Hassani, who is in his early 30's, is single with 2 kids who are still in school. For 4 years now, he has been making his living and supporting his family by running 2 businesses: selling wood and lending CDs. He works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hassani's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to increase his inventory of wood and CDs and has managed to successfully repay all of his loans. He is doing great with the loan. He used his profits to repay loans, reinvest in his business, pay school fees for his kids, renovate his house, and cover his household expenses.

Hassani will use this loan to increase his inventory of wood and CDs in order to meet customer demand. He dreams of owning a big business selling wood. Hassani will be responsible for repaying this loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of wood and CDs.

loans.name: Gloria Audelina

texts.es: Gloria es una mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos, pero los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, lo que le permite tener mejores ingresos económicos. Ella vive con su compañero de vida desde hace 1 año, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar. Gloria desea invertir en mayor variedad de frutas y verduras, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en frutas y verduras por temporada, lo cual espera le permita contar con más clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is a working woman and she is 25 years old. She makes a living providing domestic services and during the weekends she sells fruits and vegetables. This allows her to have a better income. She has been living with her life partner for a year and is very happy to be able to help with the household expenses.

Gloria would like to invest in a larger variety of fruits and vegetables and is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in seasonal fruits and vegetables. She hopes this will allow her to get more customers.

loans.use: to invest in seasonal fruits and vegetables, to gain more customers.

loans.name: Joselyn De Los Angeles

texts.es: Joselyn de Los Ángeles, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltera,  vive con sus hermanos y padres, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y con alta germinación y fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Joselyn, from Los Ángeles, is 18 years old, single, and lives with her siblings and parents, who are her greatest priority. With the loan, she plans to purchase high quality bean seeds with high germination and fertilizers and other products to apply to the crop, in addition she will pay labor costs to apply the products and assistance to the crop once it is developed, and in this way assure herself of doing good work. What she plans to do is to take advantage of the good climatic and soil conditions that this zone has for this crop, and also to put into practice her years of experience growing basic grains. In addition to being able to purchase better products of better quality so that her crop develops well and healthily, she plans as well to have a good harvest and to have, in the short term, a significant production. With the income from the harvest that she expects to get, she wants to use it for her family's well-being and education and to meet some family goals and continue investing more in her crops. This is the first loan she has gotten from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son  su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Oscar is 45 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children, who are his greatest priority. With the loan, he plans to purchase fertilizers and other products to apply to his coffee crop so that it develops well, in addition he will pay labor costs to apply the products and assistance with the crop once it has developed to the harvest and, in this way, to assure himself of doing good work. What he plans to do is take advantage of the good climatic and soil condition that the zone has for this crop and also to put into practice his years of experience growing coffee. In addition to being able to purchase better products of better quality so that his crops develop well and healthily, and also to have a good harvest and, in the short term, he plans to have a significant production. With the income from the harvest that he expects to get, he wants to use it for his family's well-being and to meet come family goals and continue investing more in the crops. It is the first loan he has gotten from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to pay for assistance for the coffee.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en: Gaudiosa is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two children; they are nine and one year old. Her husband works hard as a driver while Gaudiosa runs her computer shop in the city in an area where a computer shop would most likely be in demand. She has been operating this business for five years and wishes to be successful for more years. She is asking for a loan to buy a new set of computers to help her augment their income. She is doing this for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy new set of computers

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
ROBINA is a 33-year old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore. Her husband works at a business where he sells various colors of thread, laces, spools, paper cotton, packs of zippers, sequins, studs etc. He buys from wholesalers at low prices and sells in Lahore city. His shop is situated in the market among many tailors. The women in the town purchase sewing materials from his shop. With this business, he has built up positive relationships with the tailors.

With a growing number of new customers and increasing demand he wants to buy more materials in bulk, so he can easily meet the rapid increase in demand. He hopes to grow his monthly income and ultimately savings as well.

ROBINA praises our honorable support and thanks Kiva and its field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy various colors of thread, laces, spools, paper cotton, packs of zippers and sequins for her husband's tailoring material shop.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en: Faiza is 29 year old widow who manages a low cost private school. The school was set-up by her brother who believes in woman empowerment.  He is proud to have a capable sister like Faiza who handles all school matters with diligence and responsibility.
