Faiza’s sister (shown in the picture; standing at left side) also helps Faiza in the smooth running of the school. Currently there are 112 students in the school, the majority of which are female. Educating the women of our society is important, says Faiza who believes that all women must be educated and taught enough to be economically self-sufficient. Faiza requires PKR 75,000 to purchase furniture for her school. Her aim is to eventually take the school enrollment at a higher level and equip students with skills that can help them through their life.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her school.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Murtala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Murtala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Murtala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Murtala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María es una mujer de 47 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, lo cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive con sus 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad a los que está sacando adelante como madre soltera. María desea invertir en frutas de temporada, para que su venta de frutas sea más surtida, ya que solo cuenta con las frutas que cultiva, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en frutas de temporada para ofrecer más variedad de productos a su clientela. Con el crédito anterior María logro invertir en árboles frutales que espera den frutos muy pronto.
texts.en: María is a 47-year-old woman who works selling fruits and vegetables, work that she has done for 2 years, which has allowed her to get her family ahead. She lives with her 2 children, ages 10 and 8, who she is getting ahead as a single mother. María wants to invest in seasonal fruits, so that her fruit sale is more assorted, since she only has the fruit that she grows, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in seasonal fruits to offer a larger variety of products to her customers. With the previous loan,  María managed to invest in fruit trees that she expects to bear fruit very soon.

loans.use: to invest in seasonal fruits to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

loans.name: Abilio

texts.es:
El señor Abilio de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, no tiene casa propia y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Don Abilio  se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de la venta de verduras y frutas como ser plátanos, papas, sandias, chiles, tomates, repollo, etc. Es un hombre trabajador con deseos de salir adelante.
Don Abilio  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como papa, cebolla, tomates, chile, plátanos, pataste, etc. que son los productos que más se venden para esta época, con el   apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es su segundo crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Abilio, 39 years old, lives with his wife and children. He doesn't have his own house and lives in a community of San Lorenzo, Valle in the south of Honduras.

Abilio has worked for 5 years at his business selling vegetables and fruits such as plantains, potatoes, watermelons, chilies, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. He is a hard-working man with desire to get ahead.

Abilio is asking for the loan to purchase products such as potatoes, onions, tomatoes, chilies, plantains, chayote, etc. which are the products that he sells the most during this season. With the support of the loan, he plans to increase his income and improve his quality of life. It is his second loan that he has applied for from Prisma.

His dream is to have his own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to purchase plantains, potatoes, watermelons, chilies, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 37 años de edad se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos y gallinas ponedoras, lo cual le permite salir adelante desde hace 14 años. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos a los que apoya para que estudien, ya que desea que sean mejores personas. María desea invertir en más pollos y gallinas, ya que en la temporada navideña y de fin de año, las ventas se incrementan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: gallinas ponedoras, pollos y concentrado para su negocio.
texts.en: María is a hard-working woman who, at 37 years old, works raising and selling chickens and laying hens, which has allowed her to get ahead for 14 years. She lives with her life partner and 3 children who she supports so that they go to school, since she wants them to be better people. María wants to invest in more chickens and hens, since during the Christmas season and at the end of the year, sales increase. So, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in laying hens, chickens and concentrated feed for her business.

loans.use: to purchase in laying hens, chickens and concentrated feed for her business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
A few months ago, Marlyn built her store at the front of their house. She will be selling a variety of goods to the community of Baybay, Leyte. To operate her business successfully, she is in need of an additional amount of capital to buy grocery items such as noodles, spices, flour, toiletries, salt, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, candies, eggs, cooking oil and canned goods.

Marlyn is a married woman and a mother of a two-year-old son. She is 28 years old and dreams of improving her business to sustain her family. She wants to have enough income for their daily expenses and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, spices, flour, toiletries, salt, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, candies, eggs, cooking oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina, tiene la edad  de 38 años, está soltera,  vive con sus hermanos y padres, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y con alta germinación y fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old, she is single and lives with her brothers and her parents who are her main priority. With the loan she expects to buy bean seeds of good quality and high germination and purchase fertilizers and other products for the crop. In addition, she will pay for manual labor to apply the products and help with the plantation once it grows, making sure she does a good job.

She plans to take advantage of the good climate and soil condition this region offers for this crop and to put into practice various years of experience she has in dealing with basic grains.

In addition to being able to purchase the best quality products so that her plantation grows well, she will have a healthy harvest, and in a short time, an important production.

With the revenue that she expects to get from the harvest, she will invest in the well-being and education of her family. She wants to reach some family goals and invest in more crops.

This is the first loan from FUNDECOR. She has not had any other loans from state banks, but FUNDECOR offered her the loan with better terms and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en:
Yasemin is married and has one child. After her divorce from her first husband, she had financial problems, and she started selling Amway products in order to not be a burden to her family.

As a group leader Yasemin is increasing the number of her subgroups and customers. She has been doing this for 6 years. At first, she had trouble finding customers, but now she has no trouble.

With help from this second loan, she will buy bulk products so she can meet her customers' needs. She wants to have a good life and be able to purchase a car.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Yasemin Hanım evli, bir çocuk annesi. İlk eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra maddi sıkıntılarından kurtulmak kimseye yük olmamak için Amwey ürün satışına başlıyor. Grup lideri olarak hem alt gruplarını hem de müşterilerini arttırıyor. Altı yıldır amwey ürünler satıyor. İlk başlarda müşteri bulmakta sıkıntı yaşasa da şuan hiçbir sıkıntı yaşamıyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile ürün alıp siparişlerini karşılayacak. İyi bir yaşam ve araba almak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy home care products in bulk.

loans.name: Chhaihoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chhaihoeun is a 32-year-old married woman who resides in Tbaung Khmum Province. She has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she grows wet rice and works for others for a fee. One challenge she faces is drought, which causes rice to produce low outputs.

Leading a group of two members to apply for loans, Chhaihoeun is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer, organic pesticide, and fuel for her water pumping machine. She hopes to improve her yields to increase her income so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop yields so that she can send her children to school.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nilgün

texts.en:
Nilgün is married and a mother of two children. She is an Avon representative. She started buying Avon one and a half years ago as a user and telling her friends about it. With time, she started getting orders and making sales and contributions to the family income.

With help from this second loan Nilgün is planning to buy promotion products and sell them at catalogue prices to make a profit. She wants to reach the platinium level by increasing her subgroups. This way, she will earn a regular salary. After her children grow up, she wants to open a store where she could sell cosmetics.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Nilgün Hanım evli, iki çocuk annesi. Avon ürün temsilcisi. Bir buçuk yıl önce kullanıcı olarak başlıyor ve çevresine tanıtım yapıyor. Zamanla siparişler geldikçe ürünleri satmaya başlayıp aile bütçesine de katkı sağlamaya başlıyor. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile indirimli ürünler alıp katalog üzerinden satıp daha çok kar elde edecek. Alt gruplarını arttırarak işinde platin seviyeye ulaşmak istiyor. O zaman düzenli maaşı olacak. Çocuklarını büyüttükten sonra kozmetik ürünler satacağı bir dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy Avon products.

loans.name: Handan

texts.en:
Handan is married and a mother of two. Since she was a child, she both attended school and worked. She worked in various jobs and finally opened her own cafe, but it was then destroyed by the earthquake. After she recovered she started working again.

Now Handan is a retailer for a telephone company. With help from her second loan, she will buy telephone accessories. She wants to continue practicing mountain sports and live a healthy life. She also wants to grow her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Handan hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Küçük yaş da hem çalışmış hem okumuş. Çeşitli işlerde çalıştıktan sonra kendine bir cafe açmış. Deprem de iş yeri yıkılmış. Kendini toparladıktan sonra tekrar ticarete atılmış. Şuan bir telefon şirketinin bayiliğini yapıyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile telefon aksesuar malzemeleri alacak. Dağ sporlarına devam etmek ve sağlıklı yaşamak, işinde ilerlemek istiyor.

loans.use: to purchase telephone accessories to sell to the public.

loans.name: Delia Cleidy

texts.es:
Delia Cleidy con 20 años de edad,vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y su hijo ,en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de aves de corral, con una experiencia en el rubro hace tres años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más aves de corral. De esta manera incrementará sus ventas y con ello sus ganancias.

Delia Cleidy es socia reactivada en Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado dos créditos los cuáles loa a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Delia Cleidy is 20 years old. She lives in her parent's home with her husband and son, in the Pucará district, province of Jaén, Cajamarca department, country of Perú. She has very good personal and work references from the residents of the region. The residents of this region make a living mostly in farming, commerce and livestock.

She sells poultry and has three years of experience in this trade. She is requesting the loan to buy more animals in order to increase her sales and her profits.

Delia Cleidy is a reactivated member of the Edpyme Alternativa. She has managed two loans, both of which she has paid back on time.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rawda

texts.en:
Rawda is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and five children, four of whom are still studying. Her husband works tirelessly as an employee and also in construction to be able to enhance their way of living works.

Today, Rawda is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en: Tea is 42 years old. She lives in the Natakhtari district with her sister and pensioner mother. Tea is unemployed, wants to start a trading business, and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1500 GEL. With the loan, she will purchase a stock of clothes and will start a trading business. This will increase her income. With the increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Ugandan man, aged 46 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with 10 children aged between 25 and 6 years. He is involved in produce buying and selling and owns several produce stores in his hometown. He also earns from other farming activities like tree planting and growing beans and maize.

Joseph dreams of one day buying a plot in Kagadi Town. However, while he has limited capital, he hopes this loan will enable him to expand and diversify his business. He wants credit in order to buy maize and beans to restock his stores.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Bethuel

texts.en:
Bethuel, 33, is a father to two young girls aged 8 and 4 years. He is an ambitious man, working hard to fend for his family. He has been a taxi driver for a long time and has gradually managed to open a small tuck shop operated by his wife.

After 9 years of working as a driver, Bethuel is now ready to buy his own taxi van "I want to be self-employed," he says. Bethuel is thus requesting a loan to buy a van. He will drive the van for now and hire an employee at a later stage.

Bethuel is determined and wants to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy a taxi van

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en: Fabiano is forty-eight years old and he lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with seven children between the ages of three and twenty-two. He buys and sells produce to earn a daily income and also makes money from farming, serving the rural people. His dream is to expand his business, make it more stable, buy a truck for transporting the produce, and educate the five of his children who are still in school. He faces a challenge of bad roads, especially during the rainy seasons when the roads are impassable. He wants a loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 50-year-old married woman. She works with hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the income of her home.

To help her continue her operations, Naseem has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR in order to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to consistently cater to more customers. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers.

Naseem dreams for a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Elsy Marina

texts.es:
Elsy, vive con la mamá, la hermana que tiene 13 años edad y su hija que tiene 3 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, Elsy se dedica a la cosmetología y venta de accesorios para la salud y belleza; ella comenzó en este negocio gracias a una amiga que tenía un puesto en el mercado pero la dueña del puesto tuvo que irse de la ciudad y se  vio en la obligación de venderlo por lo que Elsy lo adquirió y fue así como puso su propio negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de salud y belleza como lo son polvos, cremas para el cuerpo, cremas para el cabello, tintes, accesorios de belleza entre otros. Manifiesta que con esto ella lograra incrementar su inventario ya que esta a puertas el fin de año escolar y se avecinan las graduaciones, así como las fiestas navideñas, esto le permitirá tener mayor visita de clientes, sus ganancias y ventas incrementaran de una manera muy positiva.
Elsy como toda mujer emprendedora tiene muchos sueños que le gustaría cumplir y considera que con el apoyo que se le brinda Padecomsm lo puede hacer, ella sueña con darle una mejor estabilidad de vida a su familia, tener un negocio que sea muy reconocido en su zona, que le genere muchos ingresos y de esa manera poder cancelar su crédito con la puntualidad requerida.
texts.en:
Elsy lives with her mother, her 13 year old sister and her 3 year old daughter, she is a single mother. Elsy makes a living with cosmetics and selling health and beauty supplies. She started in this business thanks to a friend who had a stand in the market. The owner of the stand had to leave the city and was forced to sell the stand which Elsy acquired. This is how she started her own business.

She is requesting the loan to purchase health and beauty products such as, powder, body lotions, hair creams, hair color, and beauty accessories among others.

She states that with this she will be able to increase her inventory in time for the end of the school year, since with that comes graduations, and also the Christmas holidays. This will allow her to have more clients visit and her profits and sales will increase in a very positive manner.

Elsy, as an entrepreneur woman has many dreams that she would like to make a reality. She considers that with the support received from Padecomsm, she can achieve them. She dreams of providing a more stable life for her family, have a recognized business in her region, generate a lot of income and this way, to be able to pay the loan on the alloted time.

loans.use: to purchase health and beauty products, such as, powder, body creams, hair creams, hair color and beauty accessories among others.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 44-year-old married woman. She is very talented and excels in her work of stitching. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago, she started her tailoring business to be able to pay for her household's activities. Currently, Mariyam is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mariyam has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR in order to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for stitching more dresses on time. This will boost her earnings, and she wishes to spend them on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for stitching more dresses on time.

loans.name: Santos Esperanza

texts.es: Santos tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos de 21, 12 y 10 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para dama y caballero, lo cual le permite salir adelante y sostener los gastos de su familia. Santos desea invertir en su negocio, de venta de prendas de vestir por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, entre otros productos para surtir su mercadería, ya que se acerca la temporada alta.
texts.en: Santos is a 43 year old single mother. She lives with her three children aged 21, 12 and 10 years old who she has managed to raise through great effort. She is an enterprising woman who works selling clothing for women and men. This allows her to get ahead and support the family expenses. Santos wants to invest in her clothing selling business so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in pants, blouses and t-shirts amongst other products to stock up on her merchandise as her high season is approaching.

loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses and t-shirts amongst other products to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Matilde

texts.es: Jose de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijas, el se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace 23 años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor y asi poder continuar con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos economcios.
texts.en:
Jose, age 62, lives in his own home with his partner and his three children.  He has worked selling traditional medicines for the past 23 years.  His business is located near his place of residence, and he has a lot of customers due to the quality of his products and his good prices.  

He is asking for a loan to buy more folk medicines in bulk.  In this way he can keep going with his sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.en: Golibjon was born in 1987. He is a smart, hard-working man. Golibjon is married and has no children. His wife is a housewife. Golibjon works in various trades. Golibjon now needs some financial support because his wife is pregnant and she is in the hospital. The doctor must treat her so that she gives birth to a healthy child. They want a healthy child. Golibjon is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy medicine for the treatment of his wife. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the treatment of his wife.

loans.name: Zafrin

texts.en:
Zafrin was living a tough life some years ago. It was very difficult to cover her household expenditures. So she started her milk selling business which she's been running for many years with the help of her husband.

Zafrin keeps milk producing buffaloes, and she sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 4 children, and she is a dedicated mother and wants only the best for her children.

Zafrin has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR in order to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales. She will be able to earn a good amount of income so she can fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Umar is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Umar would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Umar will now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Umar now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela de 37 años de edad, es casada y  vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 06  años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y hojaldras, también vende golosinas como tamales, pastelitos, enchiladas, tacos, tajaditas de plátano etc. Sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas de su comunidad.
Doña Adela vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Adela está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, cuajada, manteca y leña, etc. para elaborar su producto, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida es un cliente que ya ha tenido prestamos con Prisma y este es su cuarto crédito con la institución y tiene deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su Familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre  del  2015.
texts.en:
Señora Adela, who is 37 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their two children in their own house. For six years she has been working in the business of selling rosquillas [cookies], quesadillas, and pastries. She also sells such items as candies, tamales, meat empanadas, enchiladas, tacos, fried plantain slices, etc. Her customers are all neighbors, friends, and people from her community.

Doña Adela lives in a neighborhood in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to get ahead, and she strives day after day to improve their quality of life.

Doña Adela is applying for the loan for the purchase of products such as corn, fresh cheese, lard, firewood, etc., to make her products. With the support of this loan, she plans to improve her income and also their quality of life. She is a client who has already had loans with Prisma. This is her fourth loan with the institution, and she wants to continue working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, and at the same time to improve her future along with her family.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, lard, firewood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with twelve children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Aida dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Sokhoeun's Group

texts.en:
From Kampong Cham province, Sokhoeun is a 35-year-old married mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and the other one is too young. This family’s income comes from growing rice, raising pigs and working for others for a fee. Earning about USD9 per day, Sokhoeun can manage to save about USD3 every single day for future needs. Rice growing’s challenge is insect pests.

In a group of four members, Sokhoeun is the leader and she is going to use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost her crop yields. She hopes that she can generate more income to improve living condition and to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to get abundant rice yields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam lives at Tuguegarao. She is 34 years old, and had two children. She and her husband manages a transport business providing motorcycle transport business for income. Aside from the transport business, she also sells rice, snacks, and cosmetics(AVON products) to sell. She is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy gasoline for motorcycle and rice, and Avon products to sell. She would like to continue improving her profits for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for motorcycle and rice and Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 37 years old, married and had a child. She involved herself into direct selling business as source of income. She is selling cosmetics and clothes based on a catalog. Her customers are most likely her friends and neighbors. She wanted to improve her earnings that is why she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy more cosmetics, clothes and soap and perfumes to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to sell more products and continue acquiring good profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, clothes and soap and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Jey R

texts.en: Jey R is a married man who engages in various businesses to raised his family. He runs a vulcanizing shop and is driving his own tricycle (a motorcycle with a covered sidecar that seats anywhere from one passenger to as many as the driver will allow) for a year to earn a living and provide the needs of his family. In addition to this, he also sells snacks to the community of Clarin, Bohol. 26-year-old Jey R dreams to improve his business for their sustainability. He also wants to give good life to his family.  With this, he is requesting for a loan of PHP8000 to buy vulcanizing materials and snacks to sell such as biscuits, bread, chips, powdered juice and fruits.

loans.use: to buy vulcanizing materials and snacks to sell such as biscuits, bread, chips, powdered juice and fruits.

loans.name: América Group

texts.es:
La pesca y la agricultura juegan un papel fundamental en la economía de un municipio del estado de Oaxaca cuyo mayor atractivo es la presa. Allí se adentran los pescadores sobre sus lanchas motorizadas o bien a remo con el fin de adquirir la mejor cantidad de pescado fresco. En los límites de dicha presa se ubican distintos comedores que elaboran e l producto de distintas formas.
   En una colonia se integró un grupo llamado América pues este nombre hace referencia al continente de donde son originarios con mucho orgullo. Ellos son: Guadalupe quien invertiría en pan y accesorios para dama; María de los Ángeles, en pan; Marcelina, en pescado; Enriqueta y Abigail, en calzado por catálogo; María, en tortillas y José, en refresco. 
   Doña María de los Ángeles es una de las integrantes fundadoras del grupo y es mejor conocida como doña Mari por sus compañeros. Su familia está integrada por su esposo Alfredo y un hijo quien continúa con sus estudios. Se dedica desde hace 12 años a la elaboración de pan con el firme propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. "Hemos trabajado en equipo y gracias a Dios nos ha ido muy bien" expresó contenta ya que ahora supera a su esposo a la hora de elaborar el pan.
   Uno de los retos más grandes que afrontaron al inicio de su actividad fue el conseguir el horno de piedra, sin embargo el esfuerzo valió mucho la pena ya que el sabor que consiguen hoy en día es inigualable. 
   Cada uno de los préstamos le ha otorgado una estabilidad económica que le ha permitido enriquecer cada vez más su negocio. En esta ocasión comprará harina, azúcar, leche, manteca, levadura ya que en el mes de noviembre y diciembre suelen aumentar las ventas de toda la mercancía. Uno de sus objetivos es ampliar la panadería y aumentar el número de repartidores dentro de toda la región. 
* En la fotografía Doña Mari viste blusa color rojo, falda negra y esta parada detrás de Doña María quien viste blusa morada y falda roja.
texts.en:
Fishing and agriculture play a key role in the economy of a municipality in the Oaxaca whose major attraction is the dam.There the fisherman put in their motorized launches or even with oars in order to get the best quantity of fresh fish. On the shore by the dam there are various eateries that prepare the fish in various ways.

In one neighborhood, a group called "America" was formed, as this names refers to the continent where they come from with much pride. They are: Guadalupe, who will invest in bread and women's accessories; María de los Angeles, quien who will buy bread; Marcelina who will buy fish; Enriqeta and Abigail, who will buy shoes for sale by catalogue, María who will invest in her tortilla-making business. and José, who will use it to buy soft drinks.

María de los Ángeles is one of the group's founding members, and is better known as Mari by her co-members. Her family is made up of her husband Alfredo and a son who is going to school. She has been making bread for 12 years with the firm intention of improving her family's quality of life. "We have worked as a team, and thanks to God it has gone very well." She said she was happy as now she is surpossing her husband, when it comes to making bread. One of the greatest challenges they faced in starting their business was acquiring the stone oven. However the effort was worth it, as the flavor they get nowadays is unequaled.

Each of the loans has given them a financial stability that has allowed them to increasingly improve their business.

On this occasion she will buy flour, sugar, milk, lard and yeast, as in the months of November and December, sales of all her merchandise tend to increase. One of her objectives is to expand the bakery and increase the number of deliveries throughout the region.

* In the photo, Mari is wearing a red blouse with black skirt, and is standing behind María who is wearing a purple blouse and red skirt.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, lard and yeast.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma con 27 años de edad,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, en el distrito de Pimpingos, provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de cafeto, de la variedad Catimor, sembrando 2 hectáreas de cafeto de su propiedad,su predio se ubica en el Caserio el Panamá del Distrito Pimpingos de Cutervo, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 7 años y hace 4 años al cultivo de cafeto. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, así mismo a la venta de animales menores y al cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Vilma es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ella firmará sóla.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 27, lives together with her partner and two young children, ages 3 and 7.  They live in the Pimpingos district, Cuteryo province, Cajamarca department, Peru.  The people in this area work mainly in agriculture, trade, and ranching.  She has very good personal and work references from area residents. 

She works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee trees of the Catimor variety.  She has sown two hectares of coffee trees on her property.  Her piece of land is located in the village of Panamá, in the Pimpingos district of Cuteryo.  She has seven years of experience in this line of work, with four years of growing coffee.  She also works raising and selling cows as well as barnyard animals.  Additionally, she cultivates food crops.  This loan is set aside for the maintenance of her crop, so that she will get a good yield and a better income.  In this way, she will be able to improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

Vilma is a repeat client with Edpyme Alternativa.  She will be the only signatory.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her crop.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional items like noodles, sugar, spices and other groceries.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending business.

Emma dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou is 33 years old, married with three children.

Annalou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchaase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Annalou has borrowed and paid  loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Annalou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchaase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Vigie

texts.en:
Virgie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store business.

Virgie dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Rukiya is a 56-year-old married woman and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son owns a bookstore and sells stationery items, copy, pencils, books and register. He has maintained many contacts with the school, colleges and academic institutions, who refers their students to his book store. His demand for stationery items, copies and led pencils has increased this is the reason he wants to keep more stock at his bookstore.

But the major problem is that he does not have amount to buy more stock.
Therefore, Rukiya requested a loan from Kiva’s field Partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy more stock for his bookstore.
She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will takes an active part to support her.

loans.use: to buy stock of stationery items such as copy, pencils, books of various courses and register for her son's bookstore.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rashel

texts.en:
Rashel is 33 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school, Rashel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Rashel has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Rashel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Chihana

texts.en:
Chihana is a 65 year old mother of four who runs her own mobile transfer business in Luanshya, Zambia. With the depreciation of the Zambian currency in recent months, Chihana’s business has been struggling financially due to inflated transport and rental costs.

Chihana enjoys running her own business because it gives her an opportunity to interact with different people in her community and is a good way for her to provide for her family.
Chihana is requesting for her first Kiva loan in order to purchase a trading kiosk so that she does not have to pay rentals anymore. The loan will help her to grow her business as it will become more visible and attract more customers. With the recent economic troubles, Chihana is hopeful that by procuring her own trading kiosk she will reduce her expenses.

Chihana’s dream is to see her children live comfortable and happy lives. She hopes to grow her business so that one day, one of her children can run the business. Chihana thanks the Kiva lenders for believing in her.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona trading kiosk where she can operate her mobile money transfer business .

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Min is 53 years old and married with 2 children, a son and a daughter who are both married. He has a pig farm in his hometown. He has been running this business for 13 years and his wife is helping with the business as well.

Min describes himself as a hardworking man. He requested 20,000 from Microcred to purchase pig feed and this is his second loan. He has repaid his first loan punctually, which brought a great help to his business. He had sold all his grown up pigs at the end of September and bought more than 20 piglets. He wants them to grow fast so he needs the loan to buy more nutritional feed.

He says that the income will be used on expanding his business in the next year for he will buy more piglets. And he believes that he could improve the family living standard in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Suzette dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money in order to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a hardworking woman who sells new clothes to earn income. She lives in Masindi, Uganda and has rentals and a mobile money business that add to her income as well.

She started her business to support her family and pay her children's school fees. She dreams of growing her business, however competition and seasonality of customers still affect her.

As we move close to the festive season, Stella is looking to stock her clothing shop so as to increases her sales. She intends to use the loan to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Exequiel Enrique

texts.es:
Exequiel, es un joven que vive con su madre, él se dedica a su taller de bicicletas y la mamá tiene una fuente de ingresos como lo es una tienda de productos para el hogar una actividad diferente a la que él realiza; Exequiel trabaja para costearse sus estudios, ya tiene dos años de poseer este negocio, su horario de servicio es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m., lo que resta del día lo utiliza para sus estudios.
Exequiel solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de herramientas y repuestos para trabajar en el taller de bicicletas; él busca poder ser más oportuno con las necesidades que sus clientes le presenten, aparte de eso le generara mayor ganancia ya que su inventario incrementara y así tendrá más productos o repuestos que sus clientes le soliciten.
Los sueños que Exequiel posee son, como todo joven esforzado le gustaría coronar su Carrera Universitaria además de tener un negocio estable que le permita generar más ingresos económicos para poder salir adelante él y su familia.
texts.en:
Exequiel is a youth who lives with his mother. He works in his bike shop. His mother has a source of income that is completely different from his, which is a store with household products. Exequiel works to finance his studies and he has run this business for two years. His hours of service are from 8 am until 2 pm and the rest of the day is for his studies.

Exequiel is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of tools and parts for his bike shop. He is looking to be more expedient with the needs his clients present. Besides this he will generate more income as his inventory increases and will have more products and parts that his clients require.

Exequiel has the dream, like any energetic youth of crowning his university degree and possessing a stable business which would allow him to generate greater economic income to be able to get himself and his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy tools and parts to work in his bicycle shop.

loans.name: Nitha's Group

texts.en: Nitha’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nitha works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhea's Group

texts.en:
Sokhea, 40, is a resident of Kampong Cham Province. She is married with two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other is too young for schooling. Growing rice on a one hectare area of farmland is the main business of her family. In order to add more income, she works for others for a fee. Obstacles to rice growing include such issues as pests.

This will be the second time for Sokhea to work with VisionFund. She, the leader of a five-member group, will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She hopes that she can increase the yields so as to meet her dream of buying an additional plot of farmland and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland so as to buy an additional plot of farmland and keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 35-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He tries to make sure that his family does not have any needs left unfulfilled. He is involved in his own business to provide a regular income for the family. He manufactures and sells furniture, such as single beds, tables, and more. He started this business at a young age, but now he has grown old and weak.

Today, her husband has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for her husband, but her family's needs are increasing day by day and she needs more money to afford household expenses. Now, she wants to buy more raw materials for her husband for making furniture in order to expand the business. This is why she requested a loan through BRAC Pakistan.

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as for his family. Samina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's furniture making business.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es: Lorena de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y agua de cocos en las afueras de su casa desde hace mas de 25 años posee mucha clientela por que es un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Lorena esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas frutas por mayor, azúcar, hielos, cocos, bolsas, pajillas, etc. todo por mayor ya que le va bien en sus ventas y asi tener mas genancias para seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lorena, at the age of 42, lives in her own house with her husband and their two daughters, She has been selling refreshments and coconut water outside her home for more than 25 years. She has many customers because they are very marketable products. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Lorena is again applying for a loan to purchase more fruits wholesale, [as well as] sugar, ice, coconuts, bags, straws, etc., all at wholesale, since she is doing well in her sales and thus [hopes] to have more earnings to continue giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits wholesale, as well as sugar, ice, coconuts, bags, and straws, all at wholesale

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 26 years old, single, and supporting one brother. He has been dairy farming for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000. He has applied for a loan of KES 10,000 to help him buy dairy feeds for his cows.









































































































































































































































































e anticipated profits shall be used in paying school fees for his brother.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds.

loans.name: Glorybell De Maria

texts.es: Glorybell de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una taqueria con karaoque el cual hace muy atracctivo su negocio ya que llega mucha cliente, tiene varios años de tener su negocio el cual esta ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de las tortas y tacos como pan, tortillas, carne, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Glorybell, at the age of 38, lives in her own house with her husband. She has a taqueria with karaoke, which makes her business very attractive, since many customers come. She has had her business for several years. It is located near her house in a zone that is heavily trafficked. With the earnings that she obtains, she manages to pay some of the expenses of her household.

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of basic ingredients to make the sandwiches and tacos, such as bread, tortillas, meat, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and bologna, among other ingredients, to be able to continue with her sales and thus have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy bread, tortillas, meat, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and bologna, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa Emma

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer emprendedora que a sus 29 años de edad cuenta con una pequeña fábrica de elaboración de quesillo, el cual es utilizado para la preparación de pupusas, entre otros platos típicos del país, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Ella vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad a los que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Rosa desea invertir en su negocio, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: queso, crema, leche, harina, margarina entre otros productos para la elaboración de quesillo  para pupusas.
texts.en:
Rosa is an enterprising 29 year old woman who has a small shop making quesillo (a local cheese). It is used in the production of pupusas amongst other traditional dishes of this country, so she has a lot of clients who request her product. She lives together with her husband and her two children aged 15 and 5 years old who she is raising through her great effort.

Rosa wants to invest in her business so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in cheese, cream, milk, flour and margarine amongst other products to make quesillo for pupusas.

loans.use: to invest in cheese, cream, milk, flour and margarine amongst other products to make quesillo (cheese) for pupusas.

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
Diaa is a 29-year-old married woman living with her husband and one child. Her husband is the main income source in the family, and she is a housewife taking care of her family.

Due to hard financial circumstances and with the aim to help her child with his education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay her child's school fees. Her only dream is to ensure him a meaningful life.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees.

loans.name: Ada Lizeth

texts.es:
La joven Ada,  Vive en el barrio la concepción de Santa Cruz De Yojoa. Con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 3 añitos. Su esposo trabaja en un depósito de refrescos en esta misma ciudad. La joven Ada es una persona muy dinámica y trabajadora de muy temprano de la mañana sale a repartir su mercadería a las aldea de aledañas a santa cruz y barrios vecinos. Ella tiene su clientela la cual le hacen encargo de mercadería.
Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada, zapatos de mujer y accesorios  de dama.
Ada solicita el préstamo para la compra de un fardo de ropa usada y compra de sandalia y zapatillas, y una silla de salón de belleza ya que este año se graduara de la academia de belleza lo cual ya cuenta con clientes obteniendo muy buenas ganancias.
Ada espera que con este préstamo poder surtir para esta temporada navideña ya que tiene varios encargos y no tiene el dinero para poder abastecerse de mercadería y con las ganancias obtenidas poder seguir creciendo con sus negocio y así extenderse más en este negocio.
Ada uno de sus sueños es hacerse de su solar en esta ciudad y poder hacer su vivienda la cual  lo ha anhelado mucho ya que ella quiere que su familia salga adelante día a día.     


Santa Cruz de Yojoa  Honduras, octubre 2015
texts.en:
Ada is a young woman who lives in the neighborhood of 'la concepción' in Santa Cruz De Yojoa with her husband and her young son who is 3 years old. Her husband works in a soft drink warehouse in the same city they live in.

Ada is a very dynamic and hardworking person. She leaves her home very early in the morning to deliver her merchandise to nearby neighborhoods and towns. Ada is in charge of merchandise for her customers. Ada has a business selling new and used clothing, women's shoes, and other accessories for women.

Ada is requesting a loan to buy a package of used clothing, sandals, and shoes, as well as a beauty salon chair since she is graduating from beauty school this year, and she already has clients and plans to be able to earn a profit right away. Ada hopes that with this loan she will be able to stock her inventory for this upcoming Christmas season, since she doesn't have the money she needs to be able to stock the merchandise for her customers. Also, with the money she earns, she will be able to continue growing her business.

One of Ada's dreams is to be able to have a plot of land on which she can build her home which she has long wished for. She wants to be able to support her family so that they can get ahead.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras, October 2015

loans.use: to buy a package of used clothing, sandals, shoes and a beauty salon chair for her business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
After her father died, the financial situation of Maryam's family became very bad, therefore she could not complete her ‎education for a time. However, that did not prevent her from working to achieve her dreams and complete her education.

Maryam is a 27-year-old ‎single lady. She lives in Irbid with her little sister and her mother. She is studying for a bachelor's degree, majoring in vocational ‎education. She wants to earn her master's degree as well.

Lately, her small family has been facing a financial problem, so she gave ‎them the money she saved for university. Therefore, she applied for an educational loan to cover her upcoming semester ‎fees.‎

loans.use: To cover her upcoming semester ‎fees

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She will use the loan to increase her sales and earn profits in order to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Farzana aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits in order to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Heba is 30 years old and lives in Wihdat. She is a divorced woman with one child. Her former husband doesn’t help her feed or care for the child. So, ‎Heba is the sole breadwinner for her childr. ‎

Heba is working as a housekeeper. Because of the high standards of living, she has to work another job beside her ‎base job; therefore she decided to start a business selling blankets to increase her income. ‎

Heba is now selling blankets to her neighbors and friends to increase her income and be able to provide a good life for her ‎child. She is working hard to live comfortably with her child without needing things from anybody. She is a very ambitious woman who wants to ‎see her child graduate from university and be an important man in the future.‎

Heba wants to expand her business, therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy more blankets to sell to ‎be ready for the season.‎ Heba is a single mother who needs your help to provide a living for her child.‎

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell to ‎be ready for the season.‎

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hussaini has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land – 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, in order to meet his immediate needs for food and clothing, Hussaini had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hussaini can store his maize and sell it later for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hussaini will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Hussaini is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace mas de 5 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo es como ella puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma is 53 years old, and she has her own home where she lives with her family. She has made a living making and selling tortillas for 5 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. Thanks to her job, she is able to take care of some of her household expenses.

Irma is requesting a loan to buy corn at wholesale and lime in order to be able to continue making tortillas. Through this, she will be able to earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran was living a tough life some years ago. It was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is a 56-year-old married woman who has been running a business for many years, selling milk with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has seven children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales. She will earn a good amount of income and be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales. She will earn a good amount of income and be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: It was hard for Manzooran to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Manzooran is a 46-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children.  Some years ago she started her business, selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan  to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. Manzooran has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Nidale

texts.en:
Nidale is a 39-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and her four children, all attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to enhance their way of living.

Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the last installment of their study fees. She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their education.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of study fees for her children.

loans.name: Three Sisters Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan is 37 years old, and she is married with two children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for eight years.

Lan lives in the Hau Loc district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She always repays on time.

She is the group leader of Three Sisters Group, which consists of three members. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Carla Yileida

texts.es:
Carla es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y estudia gastronomía.
Ella es alegre, optimista y buena estudiante. Sus estudios los realiza en un instituto hotelero ubicado en la zona ‘Sopocachi’ caracterizado por ser la zona residencial ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, donde se aglomeran universidades y centros de estudio. 
Carla es  de tez morena, cabello negro/castaño largo y ojos pardos, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de gastronomía, anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante de cocina lo que le animó a incursionar en el negocio y profesionalizarse, sus intereses son los sabores, las comidas tradicionales e incursionar en la comida internacional, “estudio en mis horas libres y trabajo como cocinera…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios ella trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante conocido. La ventaja de sus estudios es que practica lo que estudia, la desventaja es la falta de capital para pagar la matrícula de su carrera. Su sueño es terminar de estudia y abrir un restaurante, ella desea pagar la matrícula de la carrera de gastronomía. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que estudia y trabaja.
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para pagar la matrícula de la carrera de gastronomía.
texts.en:
Carla is a 19 year old woman. She is single, has no children and studies gastronomy.

She is cheerful, optimist and a good student. She studies a a hotel institute located in the ‘Sopocachi’ area, characterized as being a residential area located in the center of the city where there are universities and centers of study.

Carla has dark skin, long black/brown hair and brown eyes. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her education. She shares her life with her parents, who work. They live in their own home built from bricks and cement, and which has potable water, electricity, and plumbing. She is studying gastronomy. Previously, she worked as a kitchen assistant which motivated her to go into the business and become a professional. She is interested in flavors, traditional foods and getting into international food. “I study in my free time and work as a cook…” she says. While she goes to school she is working as a cook in a well known restaurant. The advantage of her education is that she is practicing what she is studying. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to pay to register for her classes. Her dream is to finish her education and open a restaurant. She wants to pay to register for her gastronomy classes. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that she has been going to school and working.

These are the reasons that Carla is asking for a loan to pay to register for her gastronomy classes.

loans.use: to pay to register for gastronomy classes.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina con 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive en casa propia,junto a su esposo y sus hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Liduvina cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de la crianza y venta de animales como patos y gallinas, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 10 años, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para los mismos. De esta manera podrá hacer crecer más su negocio, obteniendo mayores ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.

Liduvina a tenido 4 préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa, el último fué de S/.2,500.00,el cuál lo canceló puntualmente
texts.en:
Liduvina is 40 years old, and she is married. She lives in her own home with her husband and their children in the district of Cayaltí in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Perú. She has very good personal and professional recommendations from the residents in her area. The people in this region generally make a living in agriculture, commerce and ranching.

Liduvina makes a living raising and selling animals such as ducks and hens. She has over 10 years experience working in this occupation from her home.

She is requesting a loan to buy animals and animal feed. Through this, she will be able to grow her business, earn more income, and improve her quality of life. Liduvina has had 4 previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa, the most recent one being for 2,500 Peruvian Sols, which she promptly repaid.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
José, es un hombre soltero que vive únicamente con su madre y su padre quienes dependen de él económicamente, José se dedica a atender su negocio que consiste en una tienda que ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, los horarios en los que el atiende su negocio es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. de lunes a domingo.
Solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de jabón, desinfectante, golosinas y bebidas refrescantes, que le ayudaran a mejorar su inventario, con esto el recibirá un mayor incremento en ventas que le darán mejores ingresos los cuales le permitirán poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres quienes ya están de avanzada edad.
José sueña con tener un negocio que le genere fuerte ingreso económico y posicionarse como un microempresario de su localidad.
texts.en:
José is a single man who lives with his mother and father. They depend on him economically. José runs his  business which is a store where he  sells basic goods. He works from 7 am to 4 pm from Monday to Sunday. 

He is requesting a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of soap, disinfectant, candy and soft drinks, to help improve his inventory. Doing this, he will increase his sales and have greater income so that he can provide his elder parents with a better quality of life. José dreams of having a business that will provide strong economic earnings and position him as a micro entrepreneur in his locality.

loans.use: To purchase soap, disinfectant, candy and soft drinks that will help improve his inventory.

loans.name: Rubia Lilsy

texts.es:
Rubia, de 25 años de edad, estudio profesorado en lenguaje y literatura, está soltera y no tiene hijos.

Rubia, trabaja como docente en educación básica, tiene tres años de ejercer su profesión y anterior a este trabajo, ella trabajaba en programas de alfabetización de adultos.

Rubia, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos básicos de la canasta básica como, arroz, frijoles, pan y café para vender y tener así mejores ingresos que le ayuden a sufragar los gastos familiares. 

Su sueño es seguir estudiando para tener mejores oportunidades de empleo y en un futuro también pretende tener su familia y tener una vivienda en la cual pueda tener comodidad y privacidad.
texts.en:
Rubia is 25 years old. She studies to be a language and literature teacher. She is single and has no children.

Rubia works as a primary education teacher. She has been practicing this profession for three years. Before this job, she worked in adult literacy programs.

Rubia needs the loan to buy basic staple products such as rice, beans, bread, and coffee to sell and thus have better income to help cover the family expenses.

Her dream is to keep going to school to have better work opportunities and in the future she also intends to have a family and a home where she can have comfort and privacy.

loans.use: to buy basic staple products such as rice, beans, bread and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Adonis

texts.es:
El señor Adonis de 37  años de edad es casado y vive con su esposa  y sus  hijos  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 10  años a la actividad de Pesca, y venta de Pescado,  sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la actividad de venta de pescado ambulante o en un determinado puesto del mercado, pero ellos en especial tienen una persona a la cual le venden todo el producto por conjunto y luego esa persona lo vende por mayor a todo el mercado de san Lorenzo,  sus clientes lo prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Adonis radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha junto a su familia  día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El está solicitando el préstamo para compra de 1 lancha o bote  para su actividad,  con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de trabajar con prisma y KIVA.
Don Adonis su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, para sacar adelante a su familia, y mejorar su calidad de vida.	
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - OCTUBRE  2015.
texts.en:
Señor Adonis is 37 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife and their children in their own home. He has made a living as a fisherman and by selling fish for 10 years now. His customers are all of the people who sell fish travelling from place to place or in the local market. He also sells to another person who in turn sells all of the fish at wholesale to the entire San Lorenzo market. His customers prefer him for his quality of service and good products.

Don Adonis lives in the city of San Lorenzo Valle in southern Honduras. He is an entrepreneurial man with a desire to get ahead as well as strive alongside his family for a better quality of life.

He is requesting a loan to buy either a longboat or a boat for his work. With this loan, he intends to earn more income and improve his quality of life. He wishes to continue working with prisma and Kiva. His dream is to grow his business in order to provide for his family and improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras, October 2015

loans.use: to buy either a longboat or boat for his business.

loans.name: Ugiloy

texts.ru: В городе Турсунзаде очень много талантливые женщин и девушек. Многие девушки с юный возраст начинают освоить швею. Есть женщины которые до сегодняшнего дня занимается шитьем женской одежды. Не только национальной женской платье еще они занимается вышивкой и зардшвеей. Одна опытная и талантливая швея Угилой. Угилой 12 лет занимается швейной деятельности. Ее изделия всем нравится и у нее имеется много клиентов. Угилой в день шьет 2-3 национальное платье за 40-50 TJS. Угилой  54 лет. Она мать  троих сыновей. Сыновьям  по 25, 23 и 21 лет. Они умные, образованные и самостоятельные парни. Младший сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине, что ему сделают операцию. Операцию может сделать только в России. Угилой из-за нехватки денежных средств очень расстроилась, ей очень нужно деньги. По этой причине она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Угилой с большими надеждами обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Поддержите Угилой!
texts.en:
There are many talented women and girls in the city of Tursun-zoda. Many girls start to master sewing from a young age, and there are women who sew women's clothing to this day. Not only do they sew dresses in the traditional style, but they also do embroidery and gold embroidery. One experienced and talented seamstress is Ugiloy, who has been sewing for 12 years. Everyone likes her creations and she has many customers. She can sew two or three traditional dresses in a day for 40 to 50 TJS.

Ugiloy is 54 and has three sons aged 25, 23 and 21. They are intelligent, educated and independent young men. Her youngest son is working in Russia because he needs an operation that can only be done there. She is very upset due to lack of money - she really needs money. For this reason she is turning to you with the greatest of hope for a loan. Support her!

loans.use: to pay for an operation for her youngest son

loans.name: Istatoy

texts.ru:
Истатой – 35 летняя жительница Шахринавского района занимается ручной вышивкой, (наволочки с вышитым орнаментом) и другие национальные изделия. Этому она научилась у своей матери, когда была девушкой.
«Вышивка – это трудоемкая работа и требует полной отдачи. Истатаой  говорить, что женщина без ремесла – это как дерево без плодов. А для того, чтобы искусно научиться ремеслу надо любить то, чем занимаешься». 
Истатой вышивает для себя, своих родных и для своих клиентов из числа местных жителей. Истатой поскольку большую часть времени она занята вышивкой и воспитанием четверых детей. Она на все успевает. Истатой обратилась за кредитом, для купли больше ткани для зардашвея и другие швейные принадлежности.
texts.en:
Istatoy is a 35-year-old resident of the Shahrinav region. She does hand embroidery (pillowcases with embroidered decoration) and other traditional crafts. She learned these skills from her mother when she was a young woman. "Embroidery is time-consuming work and needs full commitment." Istatoy says that a woman without a craft is like a tree without seeds. "And in order to learn a craft well, you have to love what you are doing."

Istatoy does embroidery for herself, for her family and for her customers, who are local residents. She is almost always busy with her embroidery and with raising her four children. She succeeds at everything. She is looking for a loan to buy more fabric for gold embroidery and other sewing supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabric for gold embroidery and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 23 years old, single and engaged in a livestock trading business. He has been in this business for seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This being his first loan with VFK, Geoffrey intends to buy more livestock to sell on market days. He anticipates saving to join college from the expanded business profits.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer from Suddu village.
