As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season. Then he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Kabiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Kabiru hopes to realize better yields and he plans to use his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Edis Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Edis Isabel de 56  años de edad, es Madre soltera y no tiene hijos que dependan de ella ya que su hijo es mayor de edad, vive en su casa propia y se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y hojaldras, sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
Doña Edis vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Edis está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, cuajada, manteca y leña con el apoyo de este préstamo, pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir  trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Señora Edis Isabel is 56 years old. She is a single mother, and she doesn't have any children who depend on her since her son is older now. She lives in her own home, and she has made a living selling doughnuts, quesadillas, and pastries for 20 years. Her customers are her friends and neighbors in the community.

Doña Edis lives in a village of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman with a desire to get ahead and strive everyday in order to improve her quality of life.

Doña Edis is requesting a loan to buy products such as corn, curd cheese, butter, and firewood. With the help of this loan, she intends to earn more income, and improve her quality of life. She would like to continue working with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good business, increase her customer base, and improve her future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – October 2015

loans.use: to buy corn, curd cheese, butter, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
Regina is a hard-working woman. She owns a store house in a commercial center of Teshie, and she has been selling fish for four years. She is the leader of Promise Group and a customer of ID Ghana. She is 34 years old, married to a driver, and has two children (a boy and a girl), who are in school.

She will use her loan to stock many cartons of fish to meet customer demand and also to boost her income. She launched her business thanks to funds received from her husband, a driver. To conclude, Regina thanks ID Ghana for its support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to stock many cartons of fish to meet customer demand and also to boost her income.

loans.name: Silvia Yanett

texts.es: A sus 37 años de edad Silvia muestra cada día sus deseos de superación, ya que desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para dama y caballero, además de ropa interior, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que se siente muy feliz y complacida. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 7 años de edad a los que brinda todo su apoyo para que estudien. Silvia desea invertir en su negocio, ya que cada día cuenta con más clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, faldas, vestidos, entre otros productos para su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
At 37 years of age, Silvia demonstrates each day her desire to overcome. For the past four years, she has has dedicated herself to the sale of items of  men and women's clothing, as well as undergarments. The business allows her to improve conditions for her family, for which she feels very happy and pleased. She lives with her lifelong companion and their two children, 15 and seven years old, whom she offers all her support for their studies. 

Silvia wishes to invest in her business since she has more customers asking for her products every day. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: pants, blouses, t-shirts, skirts, dresses, and other products for her business of selling clothing.

loans.use: To invest in: pants, blouses, t-shirts, skirts, dresses and other products for her business selling clothing

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, is a 45-years old married woman, who lives with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives his rickshaw in Lahore city, which is very populated area. Few days ago his rickshaw body was seriously damaged in an accident and he needs a replacement one. Her husband has some amount short to buy new body for his auto rickshaw.
Therefore, Azra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy the body of an auto rickshaw.
Azra is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy the body of auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Seina's Group

texts.en: Seina’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seina works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria lives in Bohol, Philippines together with her husband and seven school-aged children. She is in the business of hog raising for three years now. 
Desideria gives all her effort to earn a living in order to provide for her family. Her business provides her the income that she needs.
She wants to expand her business to generate more income but she needs fund to make it. She is requesting for a loan to buy feeds feed, piglets and supplements. Once all these are available, her work will not be in vain.
Desideria wants to earn more so that she will have the financial capacity to send her children to school for learning. She believes that education is important for their future.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and supplements

loans.name: G.s Los Planes Group

texts.es:
El señor José es una persona  muy luchadora que vive en una aldea en Santa Cruz de Yojoa  con su esposa e hijo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijoles y vivero de café.
Don José solicita el préstamo para comprar insecticida y abonos y de esta forma poder dar asistencia a sus cultivos y obtener mejores cosechas. Espera obtener un gran beneficio al poder dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos y que esto le mejore sus cosechas  y a su vez espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don José sueño es poder cultivar su propiedad de café ya que es un cultivo de raíces estables y le gusta mucho el rubro del café y a  su vez espera dejar un patrimonio estable a su familia para un futuro mejor.
Don Obdulio vive con su esposa e hijos se dedican al cultivo de maíz y frijoles desde su niñez.
Don Juan se dedica al cultivo de maiz ,frijoles y chile tabasco.
 
Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Octubre del  2015
texts.en:
José is a very determined person who lives in a village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa with his wife and son. He works growing corn, beans, and coffee seedlings.

José requests the loan in order to buy insecticide and fertilizers to help his crops and get better harvests. He hopes to benefit by being able to maintain his crops. He hopes this will improve his harvests and also his quality of life.

José's dream is to be able to grow coffee on his property, since it is a crop with stable roots. and he likes the coffee business very much. He also hopes to leave his family a stable legacy for a better future.

Obdulio lives with his wife and children. They have been growing corn and beans since childhood.

Juan grows corn, beans, and tabasco chiles.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – October 2015

loans.use: to buy insecticide and fertilizers for his business.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allan Rakhi is a 32-years old married woman living with her husband and three children, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
She is very hard work, gracious and honest lady. Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods two times in a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning good profit from restaurant business. She helps her husband by cooking various foods at home and her husband sells it at his restaurant.

He offers tea to his customers also and now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, pans,etc. Due to household expenses his savings are not enough to buy the desired things.
Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, pans, etc. She thanks to Kiva and appreciates for the warmth support to her.

loans.use: to buy furniture, utensils, pans, spices etc for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marieta is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marieta has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Marieta requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like pants, shirts, etc..

Marieta has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Redsella

texts.en:
Redisela aged 23 years old. She is single. She lives with her mother in Iringa Rural District. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide by giving time each week to mentor younger students in well being and life skills. Redisela is a tailor and also sells women clothes and fabrics in her shop.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing more materials for her business. Redisela will use the profit she will earn from the loan to renovate her shop and for household expenses.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more materials for her business.

loans.name: Mei's Group

texts.en: Mei’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Mei works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: For The Future Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bông is 31 years old and she is married with 3 children.

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 5 years. Bông lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. .
The main hardship that Bông faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

This is Bông first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the For the future group, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Bông hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

location.town: Minh Hải Minh Lộc, Hậu Lộc

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Grace is 43 years old and both of her children are enrolled in school.

Mary Grace has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for six years. In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: Sreymom’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreymom works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, debido a los pocos recursos económicos no pudo continuar estudiando, está casada y su esposo trabaja como jornalero. 

Aracely, desde pequeña le enseñaron a elaborar petates de tules y esa ha sido una de las fuentes de ingresos desde hace muchos años, porque además de eso también se dedica a engordar cerdos para vender y este negocio lo tiene desde hace dos años. 

Aracely, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarlo a una parcela de maíz que sembró, porque el dinero con el que contaban no fue suficiente y también va a comprar concentrado para engordar sus cerdos.

Su sueño a futuro es ampliar su granja porqueriza, porque es un negocio que le ha dado mucho resultado económicamente y es así como ella apoya a su esposo.
texts.en:
Aracely is 26 years old. She went to school up to the eighth grade. Due to a lack of economic resources, she could not continue studying. She is married and her husband works as a day laborer.

Since the time she was small, Aracely was taught how to make woven straw mats and this has been one of her sources of income for many years. She also works at fattening up pigs to sell and she has been doing this for two years.

Aracely needs the loan to buy fertilizers to apply to a parcel of corn that she has sown because the money that they have is not enough and also she is going to buy feed for fattening the pigs.

Her dream for the future is to expand her pig farm because it is a business that has provided good economic results and it is in this way that she is able to be supportive to her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply to a parcel of corn that she sowed and feed for fattening pigs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and a salon proprietor at Voi, Kenya. She is a mother of two who has been in this business for the last seven years doing great with support from her spouse.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the money to purchase shampoo, hair food and relaxers, nail polish and polish remover, and braids and use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair food and relaxers, nail polish and polish remover, and braids.

loans.name: Azizan

texts.en: Like many women, it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Azizan to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan. Azizan is 61 years old, married and a mother of six children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is the age of 35 and a mother of two daughters and two sons. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Fozia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Fozia is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 46 years old, married and a mother of six children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing the services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 24, is living with her husband and her children in the Iringa district. She is very happy to finish the repayment of her first loan. The loan has helped her to improve her business, to build her house and take her children to school.

Maria is requesting a second loan from Kiva to expand her business of phone accessories to a wholesale shop. Her social interest will remain as a Camfed learner guide volunteering to mentor young students in her nearby secondary school.

loans.use: to expand her business of phone accessories to a wholesale shop.

loans.name: Sk Group

texts.en:
Mamatsoso is an 87-year-old mother of five children and grandmother of six. She lives with three of her grandchildren aged between 15 and 7 years old. Mamatsoso lives in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. Together with her eldest grandchild, she works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her family, some of whom are going to school and only help her in the field on Saturdays and Sundays. She has to wake up very early, between 4am and 5am, during the week to help start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water, and warming the house for all the children before they go to school. Collecting firewood, setting up the fire, and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time, which due to old age, she does not have.

Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high. Winters can get very cold, and often Mamatsoso has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke, which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time, can lead to lung diseases, eye problems, and in the worst case, death. In these circumstances, life for women like Mamatsoso is very difficult.

Mamatsoso has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to be able to purchase a clean cook stove, which will provide her and nine other people from her village who are living in similar circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require expensive paraffin and gas, or a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho. This stove can be started with the use of very little readily-available biomass, like dry twigs and dry cow dung, that does not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the home.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging a battery, which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. It is a life-improving package for these women. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates toxic inhalation, gives them a better lit home to see in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For more stove info, please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: to pay for the ACE cook stove, which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel, and time spent collecting firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un minisuper ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de un año, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de prodcutos que comercializa, con los que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como: aceites, sopas, jugos, azucar, sal, granos basicos, etc. todo por mayor y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
This youth's face has been pixelated due to being 23 years old and living in a high risk area. He has had a minimart located in his home for more than a year. He has many clients due to the variety of products he sells. With the sales he earns, he manages to settle some of his household expenses.

This youth lives in his own home with his wife and child. He is requesting a loan for purchasing more products such as: oil, soup, juice, sugar, salt, staple grains, etc. all at wholesale. In this way, he will have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy products such as: oil, soup, juice, sugar, salt, staple grains, etc. all for wholesale.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
El socio  José es un persona muy trabajadora, el sigue dedicándose a su negocio de su restaurante donde atiende todo el día, el tiene muchos años en este negocio   y le va bien.
Jose solicito el préstamo para comprar aceite, arroz y pollo. El socio José está muy agradecido con los inversionista de KIVA por seguir confiando en el, ya que gracias al préstamo dado el podrá mejorar su negocio y su servicio se incrementara.
El socio se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jose is a very hard-working person. He continues to work at his restaurant business which he looks after the entire day. He has many years in this business and it is going well.

Jose is requesting the loan to buy oil, rice and chicken. He is very grateful to the Kiva investors for their continuing confidence in him. Thanks to the loan he will be able to improve his business and his service to his customers will increase.

Jose commits to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice and chicken

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is farmer living in Ijevan town with her daughter and two grandchildren. As a part time worker, Hasmik works at the store as a seller, but because her salary is not enough for covering family's costs, Hasmik and her daughter are running a farm. They keep 3 piglets, 67 hens and 2 turkeys in the farm currently.

To develop the farm and enlarge it, Hasmik asks lenders for support. She plans to purchase hens and forage for feeding the livestock.

Hasmik says that extra income from this loan will help her improve her family status and increase her farming business level.

loans.use: to pay for hens and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is 36 years old, married, and a mother of 5 children. She has been in the business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Kousar  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time.

loans.name: Mot Group

texts.en:
Mateboho is a young mother aged 25. She is the mother of three children aged between 6 years and 9 months. She lives with her 30-year-old husband and her children.

Mateboho finds life life very difficult seeing that both she and her husband are unemployed and find means of living from piece jobs they find from time to time. nothing permanent. They live in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor does it warm up well in winter.

Together with her husband, she works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her family, some of whom are going to school and only help her in the field on Saturdays and Sundays. She has to wake up very early, between 4am and 5am, during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water, and warming the house for all the children before they go to school. Collecting firewood, setting up the fire, and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time.

Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high. Winters can get very cold, and often Mateboho has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke, which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time can lead to lung diseases, eye problems, and in the worst case, death. In these circumstances, life for people like Mateboho is very difficult.

Mateboho has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves, which will provide her and six other people from her village, who are living in similar circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require expensive paraffin and gas, or a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho. This stove can be started with the use of very little readily-available biomass, like dry twigs and dry cow dung, that does not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the home.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery, which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones, and a mini LED lamp. It is a life-improving package for these women. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates toxic inhalation, and gives them a better lit home to see in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For more stove info, please check www.africancleanenergy.com.

loans.use: to be able to pay for the ACE cook stove, which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel, and time spent collecting firewood.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 43-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children.

Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

Kousar has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Sunusi

texts.en:
Sunusi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sunusi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sunusi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sunusi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sunusi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Sunusi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
She is 55 years old married, and blessed with six children. She has been in farming business for 30 years.

She has taken a loan to purchase energy saver Jikos (stoves) for sale, hoping that she will get some income. Her dreams and hopes in the future are to have an investment, pay fees, and grow in her business.

loans.use: to purchase energy saver Jiko stoves for sale.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella lives in Saravan village of Vayots Dzor region with her husband and their 18-year-old daughter, Liana.

Ella's family is hard working and they do their best to earn living. Her husband works at the local school and also owns a tractor and provides cultivation work for a fee.

Ella herself helps her husband with their farm. They specialize in keeping livestock: calves, cows, piglets, and some hens.

Ella milks cows and gets milk and other dairy products which they sell in the nearby agricultural market. The loan will help this family to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and sustaining the farm during the winter.

In the future, Ella and her husband would like to see their farming business grow.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and sustaining the farm during the winter.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Greetings from Aygepat village of Ararat region. This is 47-year-old Anahit. She is married with two children, ages 21 and 22 years old.

Anahit runs a farm that includes a greenhouse and arable land where she cultivates wheat and greens in the greenhouse. She has been in farming for 20 years. An additional source of income for this family is the retail business that Anahit's husband runs.

Anahit now requests this loan to purchase two calves, fruit tree seedlings, and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. She says that an extra income from this loan will help her to cover her daily basic needs and enlarge the variety of fruits and vegetables growing in her farm.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, fruit tree seedlings, and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina is a 44 year old married woman in the business of animal purchases and sales, which she has been doing for many years with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 7 children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Gulzaran

texts.en:
Gulzaran is 38 years old, married and a mother of nine children. Because the income generated by her husband was insufficient to cover all household expenses, she started selling milk to earn more income. She has been in business for many years and has become well-known for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation Gulzaran has gradually built up her business. She has now applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kiva's field partner Kashf Foundation to buy another buffalo. More milk will mean more money to provide for her family’s basic necessities of life.

Gulzaran aspires to further build up her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo so she can sell more milk.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 28-year-old married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of six children.

She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children.

Farzana is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits.

This monetary help can take Farzana closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 51-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.

Sakeena makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Sakeena wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a maize farmer from Soba village. As a Babban Gona member Cecilia is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs which will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona Cecilia would have had to sell her maize at harvest time when its price is lowest in order to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With a Babban Gona loan of 13,149 NGN Cecilia can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Cecilia no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Cecilia hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store her harvest until later in the season when the price for maize is higher.

loans.name: Alex Xavier

texts.es:
El joven  Alex Xavier de 22  años de edad, es soltero y  vive con sus padres en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05  años al oficio de carpintería, en su taller se elabora lo que son puertas, mezas, cómodas, chineros, gaveteros, espejos de lujo, camas, etc. 
Alex Xavier también cuenta con una pulpería en su casa donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y demás personas que transitan por la zona, vive en una aldea San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, un hombre emprendedor con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Alex Xavier está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materiales para construcción como bloques, cemento, varillas, grava, etc. para construir un cuarto nuevo en su casa,  con este préstamo el pretende mejorar su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio y llegar a tener uno de los mejores talleres de carpintería de la zona.

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras – Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Alex Xavier is a young man of 22, single, and lives with his parents in their own home. He has worked as a carpenter for 5 years. In his workshop he makes doors, tables, chests of drawers, china cabinets, deluxe mirrors, beds, etc.

Alex Xavier also has a small general store in his home, where he sells all the basic household items. His customers are all friends and neighbors and other people who travel through the area. He lives in the village of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras and is an enterprising man with the desire to improve his family's quality of life.

Alex Xavier is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, such as cement blocks, cement , rebar, and gravel, in order to build a new room in his home. With this loan, he intends to improve his family's quality of life. He is a client who wishes to continue working with Prisma.

his dream is to see his business grow, and succeed in having one of the best carpentry workshops in the area.

San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras – October, 2015.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, cement, rebar, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta greets you from Yerevan town, Armenia. She currently lives alone as her daughter is married and her son is a student in a neighboring town. For over ten years she has ground and sold coffee using her own grinding machine.

Marieta has applied for a 1500 USD loan through Kiva's field partner SEF to buy additional coffee to grind and sell in local stores. This way she will be able to cover her current orders and save money for her children and her own needs.

loans.use: to buy additional coffee to grind and sell in local stores.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 35-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has two school aged children. Her husband represents the main income provider. He is a hard worker in order to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses and as for Fatmeh, she is only dedicated to her family. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the registration fees for her children. She states that she is very happy and eager to always benefit from Kiva’s loan to continue their education appropriately.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for her children

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Betty dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is a 59 year old widow running a milk selling business, which she did for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 3 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing her milk sales so she can earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Chiyembekezo Group

texts.en:
Tereza is 47 and widowed. She has five children, five orphans and one relative who depend on her.

She owns a clothing business. She would like to use this loan to buy more clothes. The profits from the business will allow her to provide basic needs for her home. Tereza started her business to provide basic needs such as food and clothing for the orphans in her home. Members of her family help her with the day to day operations of the business.

Her personal goal is to own a minibus and use it for business purposes. She would also like to have a working capital of not less than 500 thousand Malawi Kwacha in two years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: Samnang’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Samnang makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Tikuoneni Group

texts.en:
Rita is 45 and married. Her husband is a commercial farmer. She has four children and four relatives who depend on her.

Rita owns a fish selling business. She will use this loan to buy more fish. Profits generated from this business will enable her to buy food for her family. She started her business to be financially stable. Her family members help with the running of the business.

Rita's personal goal is to own a motorbike and to open a livestock business in two years.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Crestita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 59-year-old widowed mother of one daughter. Ten years ago, she opened a clothing shop to cover the needs and expenses of her daughter, for she became the only breadwinner after her husband passed away. Wafaa is a sacrificing mother and a hard worker who deprives herself for the sake of her family. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her daughter's university tuition fees. Wafaa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees

loans.name: Seithean's Group

texts.en: Seithean’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Seithean makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.en:
Hương is 24 years old and she is married with one child. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has had a retail business selling incense and ghost money for three years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase votive objects to resell.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of the Happiness group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase votive objects to resell

loans.name: Elfida Albertina

texts.es: Elfida de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, la clienta se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas maíz por quintales y cal ya que la va bien en sus ventas y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Elfida is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion. She has worked for more than 10 years making and selling tortillas. The business is located in her residence and she has a lot of customers. With the money earned from her sales she manages to cover some of the expenses of her household. She is again requesting a loan for the purchase of more hundredweights of corn and lime since her sales are going well and thus she'll be able to continue working to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase more hundred pound bags of corn and lime.

loans.name: Jesus Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jesús Del Carmen CON 28 años de edad,vive en casa de sus padres, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de fruta, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 6 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en el negocio de refrescos, con la compra de insumos para la preparación de los mismos. De esta manera logrará mayores ingresos y con ello sus ganancias serán mayores.

Jesús Del Carmen es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado dos créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Jesús Del Carmen is 28 years old and lives with her parents in the Pucará district of the Jaén province in the department of Lambayeque in Perú. She has very good references, both personal and professional, from the members of her community.
The people of this region work, in large part, in agriculture, ranching and business.
She works selling fruit, and has six years of experience in this business. She requests the loan to invest in her refreshments business, to purchase the supplies to prepare snacks. In this way, she will be able to earn a higher profit and therefore more money for herself.
Jesús Del Carmen is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had two previous loans which she has paid of punctually.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare snacks.

loans.name: Jose Imeldo

texts.es:
José, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es padre de cuatro hijo, tres de ellos viven con él y su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio de productos básicos con el cual contribuye en los gastos del hogar.

José, desde que era un niño empezó a trabajar en el área de cafi-cultura, porque sus padres siempre trabajaron en esta área y él en la mañana les ayudaba y en la tarde estudiaba; luego viajó a Estados Unidos y trabajó muy duro hasta lograr tener el capital suficiente para comprar las propiedades donde ahora trabaja el cultivo del café; también tiene un carro donde transporta el café.

José, necesita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra que le ayudará a recolectar la cosecha de café.

Su sueño a futuro es que sus hijos se preparen academicamente y que tengan una fuente de ingresos digna y también sueña con ampliar su área productiva con el fin de aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose is 47 years old and studied through the ninth grade. He is father to four children, of whom three live with him. His wife has a small business of basic products with which she contributes to the household expenses.

Jose began to work in the cultivation of coffee as a child, because his parents always worked in this sector, and in the morning he would help his parents and in the afternoon he studied. Later he traveled to the United States and worked very hard until he had sufficient capital to buy the properties where he now cultivates coffee. He also has a car to transport the coffee.

Jose needs the loan to pay labor costs for help harvesting the coffee. 

His dream for the future is for his children to be academically prepared and have a dignified source of income. He also dreams of extending his productive area so that he can increase his profits.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for help to harvest his coffee.

loans.name: Ana Nury

texts.es: Ana es una mujer que a sus 42 años de edad pone todo su esfuerzo en salir adelante, es por ello que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, lo cual le permite tener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 20, 19 y 16 años de edad. Ana desea invertir en más mercadería, ya que se acerca la mejor época para la venta de ropa, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en faldas y blusas para dama y de esta manera contar con una venta más surtida.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and puts all of her efforts into moving forward. For six years she has therefore worked selling clothing, allowing her to earn the necessary income to move forward.

Ana lives with her partner and three children, ages 20, 19 and 16 years old.

Ana wants to invest in more merchandise as the best season for selling clothes is approaching. Ana is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy skirts and blouses and have a better-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy skirts and blouses and have a better-stocked business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Juanita grows rice on her land and sells them to the wine producer in the neighborhood.

This loan will help her to buy organic fertilizer, so that she can increase her output of rice. Juanita is already storing some plants to plant them immediately after full funding. The high demand for wine exports will help his family to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Marestella

texts.en:
Marestella works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marestella requested a PHP 7100 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet

She is getting the sanitary toilet because she wants to to make surrounding clean and her family away from any sickness and harmful deceases.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, wood, nails, sand, etc for her sanitary toilet

loans.name: Emilie Ann

texts.en:
Emilie Ann is 52 years old, married and has four children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Emilie Ann requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emilie Ann has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emilie Ann would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mansir

texts.en:
Mansir is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mansir is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Mansir would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mansir will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Mansir now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sophalla's Group

texts.en: Sophalla’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophalla works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alberto de 43  años de edad es casado y  vive con su esposa  y sus dos hijos  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 20  años a la actividad de Pesca y venta de Pescado,  sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la actividad de venta de pescado ambulante o en un determinado puesto del mercado, pero ellos en especial tienen una persona a la cual le venden todo el producto por conjunto y luego esa persona lo vende por mayor a todo el mercado de san Lorenzo,  sus clientes la prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Juan radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha junto a su esposa  día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar dos Trasmallos o Redes nuevas, ya que las que tiene están un poco dañadas, con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  y desea seguir trabajando con prisma.
Don Juan su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, y llegar a tener unas 4 o 5 lanchas para alquilarlas a los pescadores, ya que solo cuenta con dos por los momentos.
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - OCTUBRE  2015.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto, 43, is married and lives with his wife and two children in his own house. For 20 years he has worked as a fisherman and selling fish. His customers are all the people who work as fish street vendors or sell fish at the market. So they all buy their products from the person who sells fish wholesale to the entire market in San Lorenzo. His customers prefer him for his good service and quality products.

Juan lives in San Lorenzo Valle in southern Honduras. He is an entrepreneur with a desire to get ahead, struggling every day, together with his wife, to improve their quality of life.

He is requesting a loan to buy a two new trammels or nets since the ones he has are damaged. With the loan he hopes to improve his income and quality of life. He is a returning client and wants to continue working with Prisma.

Juan's dream is to grow his business and eventually have four or five boats to rent to fishermen, since now he only has two.

San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras - October, 2015

loans.use: to buy two trammels or nets for his business.

loans.name: Vicente Alexander

texts.es:
Vicente, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no continuo con los estudios universitarios debido a que decidió trabajar para poder independizarse de sus padres y con el tiempo no continuo estudiando, está casado, su esposa se dedica al comercio ambulante, tienen tres hijas, dos gemelitas de 3 años de edad y la primera hija de 13 años de edad.

Vicente, es empleado en una empresa de recolección de frutas y verduras desde hace ocho años y gracias a este trabajo ha podido sostener a su familia brindándoles lo necesario para vivir diariamente, además en sus tiempos libres trabaja en su camión halando materiales, ganado y otras cosas.- Y para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que viajar media hora en micro bus y su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 8:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

Vicente, necesita el préstamo para poder reparar su camión porque tiene fallos mecánicos y no le funciona bien para poder hacer su trabajo.

Los sueños de Vicente, son poder darles los estudios a sus hijas para que puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria y puedan desarrollarse mejor en un futuro y poder encontrar un trabajo que les genere bienestar.
texts.en:
Vicente, 35, has a high school education but was unable to continue to university because he decided to start working and become independent from his parents. He is married and his wife is a street vendor. They have three daughters: two little twins, age 3, and the eldest who is 13.

Vicente works for a fruit and vegetable collecting company where he has been for eight years. Thanks to his work he has been able to support his family and give them what they need on a daily basis. In his free time he also works in transportation with his truck, hauling materials, livestock and other things. To get to work in the morning he has to take a mini bus for half an hour. His work schedule is Monday through Friday, from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m..

Vicente is in need of a loan to repair his truck which has mechanical failures and is not working well. This is so he can do his job.

Vicente dreams of giving his daughters a university education so they can lead a better future and find work that will give them a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to repair his truck, which has mechanical failures and does not work well, so he can do his job.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro de 53  años de edad es soltero y vive con  sus  hijas  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 15  años a la actividad de Pesca, y venta de Pescado, los productos se llaman Robalo, palometa, pargo rojo, lisas, panchitas y otros más,  sus clientes son todas las personas que se dedican a la actividad de venta de pescado ambulante o en un determinado puesto del mercado, sus clientes lo prefieren por su buena atención y sus buenos productos.
Don Isidro radica en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras, el  es un hombre  emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha junto a sus hijas  día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente con deseos de seguir trabajando con prisma.
El esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de dos redes nuevas,  con este crédito él pretende mejorar su equipo de trabajo y de esta forma obtener mejores ganancias.
Don Isidro su sueño es  crecer con su negocio, para sacar adelante a su familia, y poder estudiar a todos sus hijos.

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - OCTUBRE  2015.
texts.en:
Isidro, 53, is single and lives with his daughters in his own house. For 15 years he has worked as a fisherman and sellng fish. His products are bass, pomfret, red snapper, flat fish and others. His customers are all people who work as street vendors or sell fish at the market. They prefer him because of his good service and quality products.

Isidro lives in the city of San Lorenzo Valle in southern Honduras. He is an entrepreneur with a desire to get ahead and struggle for his daughters every day to improve their quality of life. He is a returning client and wants to continue working with Prisma.

He is requesting a loan to buy two new nets. With the loan he hopes to improve his work equipment to earn more profit.

Isidro's dream is to expand his business, provide for his family and give his children an education.


San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras - October, 2015

loans.use: to buy two new fishing nets.

loans.name: Gladys Argentina

texts.es:
La  señora Gladys de 61 años de edad es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a su mama y sus hijas e hijos, se dedica a la venta de pan y rosquillas, su venta la realiza de forma ambulante y también cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta donde vende todos los días pan torta, pan bollo, quesadillas, rosquillas, etc.
Doña Gladys sus clientes son todos amistades y personas que a diario le visitan en su negocio, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y le va muy bien, es una mujer emprendedora que lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Doña Gladys está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, huevos, etc. para seguir elaborando su producto y poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su negocio.
Su sueño es aumentar su clientela para mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -   Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
Gladys, 61, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her mother and children. She sells bread and pastries and works as a street vendor. She also has a small stand where she sells cakes, bread, cheese turnovers, doughnuts, etc.

All of Gladys's customers are friends and people who visit her every day. She has been in business for 20 years and it is going very well. She is an enterprising woman who struggles every day for a better quality of life.

Gladys is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, eggs, etc. to continue making her products and earning enough income to get ahead in her business.

Her dream is to increase her customer base to improve her quality of life.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2015

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kettelie

texts.fr: Kettelie est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de trois enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Kettelie achète des barriques d’huiles pour les revendre par gallon aux détaillants. Elle a beaucoup de clients. Kettelie utilise le microcrédit pour acheter de l'huile en gros et optimiser ainsi sa marge de profit. Elle veut augmenter son revenu et pouvoir épargner pour les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kettelie is 44 years old, divorced, and the mother of three children, who regularly attend school.

She buys barrels of oil and resells it at retail by the gallon. She has many customers.

Kettelie is using this micro-loan to buy oil at wholesale so that she can maximize her profit margin. She wants to increase her business and be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy barrels of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de tomates por mayor y al detalle, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y distribuye sus prodcutos en tiendas y otros comerciantes y es gracias a su trabajo como el puede salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas tomates por mayor y asi poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
This young man's face is pixelated because he is only 28 year old and lives in a high risk area. For six years he has been selling tomatoes wholesale and retail. He works from home and distributes his products to stores and other merchants. Thanks to his work he is able to get ahead and cover household expenses.

He lives in his own house with his family and is requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes wholesale to continue his sales activity and generate a good profit.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila con 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar, junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 08 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, con una experiencia en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, para la compra de mercadería como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite,etc, para que de esta manera tener surtido su negocio.

Luzmila es socia reactivada para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 46-years old and in a common-law marriage. She lives in a family home with her partner in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province and department of Lambayeque in Peru. She has good work and personal references from the people who live in the area. The people here mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

She works selling grocery items and has more than 8 years of work experience. She additionally raises and sells animals and has experience doing this. She is asking for a loan to get working capital to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc., and this way her business will be stocked.

Luzmila is a reactivated member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to get working capital to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Viergelie

texts.fr: Viergelie, 47 ans, est veuve. Elle habite dans la ville de Delmas avec ses deux enfants. Elle revend des matériaux de construction depuis 12 ans. Dans un petit dépôt aménagé chez elle, elle range ses produits : ciments, fers, pvc, etc. L’activité marche très bien dans la zone. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock et la perte de ses clients, elle utilise les microcrédits pour renouveler ses stock à temps.
texts.en:
Viergelie is 47 years old and a widow. She lives in the town of Delmas with her two children. She has been selling construction materials for 12 years.

She has a small warehouse at her home where she sells cement, chains, PVC [pipe], etc. She does very well with this business.

To avoid gaps in her stock and a loss of customers, Viergelie is using micro-loans to renew her stock when needed.

loans.use: to buy wire and bags of cement.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, es una cliente que da las gracias por la ayuda que ha recibido, su estabilidad económica ha mejorado considerablemente desde que utilizo el préstamo anterior en su negocio, la familia se mantiene unida y de igual manera las condiciones de vida han mejorado extraordinariamente.
María nuevamente solicita un crédito, ya que se ve en la necesidad de obtener materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas que ella comercializa y con la cual le genera los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia, ella lo invertirá en la compra de maíz y gas propano para la elaboración y distribución de las tortillas.
texts.en:
María is a customer who gives thanks for the help that she has received. Her economic stability has considerably improved since she used the previous loan in her business. Her family is still together and their living conditions have also improved extraordinarily.

María is asking for another loan because she sees the need to get the ingredients to make the tortillas that she sells and which get her the necessary income to support her family. She will use it to buy corn and propane gas to make and distribute tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas to make and distribute tortillas.

loans.name: Neftalie

texts.fr: Neftalie a 24 ans. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant à charge. Elle vit en famille  avec ses parents. Elle revend des chaussures et vêtements pour femme. L’activité lui permet de gagner de l’argent pour soutenir ses parents qui sont sans emploi. Avec les revenus gagnés sur l’activité, elle fait aussi de l’épargne. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Neftalie is 24 years old, single, and has no children under her care. She lives with her parents.

She works selling shoes and women's clothing. This work allows her to earn a living to support her parents who are unemployed.

Neftalie is seeking this loan to increase her stock. With her earnings, she is going to save money.

loans.use: to buy women's undergarments.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee un comedor ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, entre otras cosas para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 50-years old and lives in her own home with her son. She owns a diner located near her house in a very busy area, and she has a lot of customers because of her good prices. With the earnings that she gets from her sales, she manages to resolve some household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials like rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables and more to be able to continue with her sales and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Danese

texts.fr: Danese a 43 ans. Mère célibataire, elle a deux enfants. Elle a mis sur pied une petite activité de revente de vêtements pour pouvoir trouver de quoi prendre soin de sa famille. Au début, elle a rencontré beaucoup de difficultés. Mais grâce au crédit, elle a fait des progrès et l’activité marche très bien désormais.
texts.en:
Danese is 43 years old and a single mother with two children. As a way to take care of her family, she started selling clothing.

At the beginning, she had faced many difficulties. But thanks to a loan, she made progress and now her business is doing very well.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing.

loans.name: Alain

texts.fr: Alain, 36 ans, est mécanicien. Ne pouvant pas se trouver un emploi, il décidé d’ouvrir une petite activité de revente de pneus. Il a trois enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. La vente de pneus lui permet de bien gagner sa vie et d’assurer les besoins nécessaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alain is 36 years old and a mechanic. He has three children, who attend school regularly.

Unable to find work, he decided to open a small business selling tires.

Sales allow him to earn a living and ensure his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Violeta Margarita

texts.es: Violeta es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 43 años de edad se dedica a la venta de platos típicos como: pasteles de carne, enchiladas, pupusas, buñuelos, entre otros productos que sus clientes esperan muy ansiosos cada tarde. Ella vive con su hijo de 23 años y dos nietos de 4 y 7 años de edad a los que cuida con mucho cariño. Violeta desea construir la pared de alrededor de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía esta solo está cubierta por lámina, lo cual no brinda mayor seguridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pared de alrededor de la vivienda que permita dar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Violeta is a 43-year old working woman who works selling traditional foods such as meat pies, enchiladas, stuffed tortillas, doughnuts and other products that her customers anxiously wait for every afternoon. She lives with her 23-year old son and two grandchildren ages 4 and 7 who she cares for with a lot of love.

Violeta wants to build a wall around her house because, as you can see in the photo, it is only covered by a metal sheet and does not provide good security. She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a wall around the house that can provide security to her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a wall around the house that can provide security.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda con 39 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos, en el distrito de Morropón,provincia de Morropón,departamento de Piura, país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la crianza de ganado,comercio en general y al cultivo de arroz.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes,como arroz,azúcar,aceite,fideos y bebidas, la venta la realiza en su propio domicilio, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 4 años.Destino del crédito será para invertir en capital de trabajo, compra de mercadería:gaseosas,chifles, arroz, azúcar, panteones,galletas, golosinas ,etc.

Bernarda es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 39-years old and in a common-law marriage. She lives in her own home with her partner and three small children in the district of Morropón, province of Morropón and department of Piura in Peru. She has very good personal and work references from the people in the area. The people here work mainly raising cattle, business in general and growing rice.

She works selling grocery items like rice, sugar, oil, pasta and drinks. She does the selling in her own home and has 4 years of work experience. The loan will be used to get working capital to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, snacks, rice, sugar, Christmas cakes, cookies, candy, etc.

Bernarda is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to get working capital to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, snacks, rice, sugar, Christmas cakes, cookies, candy, etc.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, es  un padre de familia, su estado civil es acompañado, actualmente vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tres dependen económicamente de él, Trabaja de manera independiente en la compra y venta de rines para vehículos; el lleva en este negocio ya 40 años, por lo que se puede decir que posee la experiencia necesaria para tener buenos resultados.
Oscar solicita el crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de rines y llantas para vehículos, lo cual le ayudara a tener un inventario surtido que le brindara satisfacción a sus clientes, porque sus necesidades serán resueltas en el momento oportuno, espera tener un incremento en sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos económicos serán mejores.
Uno de los sueños de Oscar es poder expandirse en el mercado, atraer nuevos clientes con mayor potencial de ventas y eso le permitirá darles los estudios universitarios a sus hijos y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Oscar is the father of a family. He is married and currently lives with his wife and four children, of which three are still economically dependent on him. He works independently buying and selling wheels for cars. He has been doing this work for 40 years, so you can say that he has the necessary experience to get good results.

Oscar is asking for a loan to be able to buy wheels and tires for cars, which will help him to have a supple inventory that will make his customers satisfied because their needs will be met in a timely manner. He hopes to have an increase in his sales and thus his income will be better. One of Oscar's dreams is to be able to expand into the market, and attract new customers with better sales potential. That will allow him to give his children a college education and to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy wheels and tires for cars, which will help him to have a supple inventory that will make his customers satisfied.

loans.name: Lynda

texts.fr: Lynda, 43 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a deux enfants. Elle revend des produits alimentaires divers : maïs en grain, pistaches, cassaves et autres). Elle s’approvisionne dans des marchés en dehors de Port-au-Prince pour trouver du stock à bon prix. Ensuite, elle revend ses produits au marché du centre-ville de Port-au-Prince. Ainsi, elle gagne de grands bénéfices sur ses ventes. Elle demande un crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Lynda is 43 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children.

She resells various food products, such as corn, pistachios, manioc, and others. She procures her stock in the markets outside Port-au-Prince in order to get a god price. Then she makes her resales at a market in the middle of town.

She is seeking this loan to increase her stock.

She earns good profits from her sales.

loans.use: to buy sacs of corn and groundnuts.

loans.name: Ones

texts.fr: Ones a 39 ans. Il vit en union libre et est père de quatre enfants. Il est propriétaire d’une petite entreprise de revente de pièces détachées pour automobile. Son ambition est de développer son entreprise pour y gagner des revenus plus importants. Il souhaite avoir suffisamment de moyens pour envoyer ses enfants à l’université.
texts.en:
Ones is 39 years old. He lives with his partner and is the father of four children.

Ones owns a business reselling spare parts for vehicles.

His goal is to expand his business to earn more revenue. He wishes to have enough means to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es: Con 22 años de edad Silvia cuenta con vivienda propia desde hace 5 años de edad, y en ella habita con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 4 años y un año de edad. Ella presta sus servicios en una pupusería, en la cual también vende platos típicos por las tardes, lo cual le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Silvia desea construir una pila con lavadero en su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para guardar el agua de uso diario, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila con lavadero en su vivienda lo cual le permita abonar a la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
