Silvia is 22-years old and has had her own home for 5 years. She lives in it with her partner and two children ages 4 and 1. She loans her services in a store making stuffed tortillas (pupusas), where she also sells traditional foods in the afternoons which allows her to get a better income.

Silvia wants to build a cement water basin in her home since, as you can see in the photo, she does not have a proper place to keep the water for daily use. She is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a concrete water basin in her home, which will allow her to improve her home's cleanliness.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a concrete water basin in her home.

loans.name: Maye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en novembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes très solidaires et très dynamiques qui habitent dans le même village et s'activent principalement dans l'embouche.
Sizanne debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette. Elle mariée et âgée de 53 ans, elle est mère de 6 garçons et 2 filles. Elle s'active dans l'embouche.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter deux bœufs à 200 000 FCFA l'un et les revendre après élevage à 300 000 FCFA l'unité. Elle paye aussi 10 000 FCFA  pour le transport et fait un apport personnel de 50 000 FCFA pour acheter de l’aliment de bétail et aussi assurer les soins vétérinaires.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider son fils qui est à l’université en assurant les frais de scolarités et aussi épargner au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of seven women makes up a part of the banc villageois which was established in November 2009. The women in the group share solidarity and are very dynamic. They also all live in the same village and work primarily in livestock farming.

Sizanne, who is standing on the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is 53 years old, married, and is the mother of six sons and two daughters. She works raising livestock.

With her loan, she plans to buy two cows at 200,000 francs CFA each. After she raises them, she will resell the cows for 300,000 francs CFA each. She also pays 10,000 francs CFA for the transport costs, and 50,000 francs CFA of her own money will go towards feed and veterinary care.

With the earnings, Sizanne plans to help her sons who are in college by covering their tuition and also saving some money in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Magaly Del Rocio

texts.es:
Magaly del Rocio con 27 años de edad,de estado civil soltera, vive en casa de familiares,junto a su madre, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de bazar,regalos,ropa y alquila disfraces, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 02 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería (insumos para la confección de disfraces,regalos y ropa) para su negocio, así mismo como otros gastos en adecuar su local para una mejor presentación y comodidad. De esta manera obtendrá mayor venta y atención, así poder generar mayores ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.

Magaly del Rocio no cuenta con experiencia crediticia.
texts.en:
Magaly del Rocio is 27 year old. She is single and lives in her relatives' house with her mother in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque in Peru. She has very good personal and professional references from the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of this area mainly earn a living in farming, business and livestock breeding.

She earns a living selling assorted products, gifts, clothes and renting costumes with more than two years of experience in the business. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise (supplies to make costumes, gifts and clothes) for her business and to cover the costs of adapting her premises to present it better and to make it more comfortable. In this way she will improve sales and service and thus be able to generate more income for a better quality of life.

Magaly del Rocio does not have credit experience.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (supplies to make costumes, gifts and clothes) for her business and to cover other costs of adapting her premises.

loans.name: Laba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en novembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes très solidaires et très dynamiques qui habitent dans le même village et s'activent principalement dans l'embouche.
NDIACK debout à droite la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette et est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 garçons et 5 filles. Elle s'active dans l’embouche en collaboration avec son mari.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 4 moutons à 50 000 FCFA l'unité dans les marchés hebdomadaires prés de sa localité en collaboration avec son mari. Elle fait un apport personnel de 10 000 FCFA pour le transport du bétail et 20 000 FCFA pour les soins vétérinaires et l'aliment de bétail. Après élevage elle revend l'unité à 100 000 FCFA. 
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte payer la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group of 20 women makes up a part of the banc villageois that was established in November 2009. The women share solidarity and are very dynamic. They also live in the same village and work primarily in livestock farming.

Ndiack, who is standing on the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of three sons and five daughters.

Ndiack raises livestock with her husband. With this loan, she is going to buy four sheep at 50,000 francs CFA each from the weekly markets near where she lives in collaboration with her husband. She will also, with her own money, pay 10,000 francs CFA for transportation and 20,000 francs CFA for feed and veterinary care.

After raising the sheep, she will resell them for 100,000 francs CFA each. She will use her earnings to cover her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy four sheep.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas y tamales su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Carmen is 68 and lives in her own home with her family. She has earned a living for 10 years from making and selling tamales and pupusas. Her business is located close to her home in a busy area and from its sales she manages to cover some household expenses. She is applying for a loan in order to buy pork rind, fresh cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients in order to continue with her work that generates a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy pork rind, fresh cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquin de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de hielo por mayor en el mercado municipal y tambien a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 5 años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de bolsas y botellas con agua por mayor para la preparacion del hielo y asi seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Joaquin is 41 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his two children. He earns a living selling ice in bulk in the local market and also in selling second hand clothes. He has been doing this for five years. With what he earns he manages to cover some household costs. He is asking for a loan to buy bags and bottles of water in bulk in order to make ice and thus continue with his work in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy bags and bottles of water in bulk.

loans.name: Kabeega

texts.en:
Kabeega is a father of two children living in Kagadi. He deals in the produce business, selling maize, beans and ground nuts in order to generate income and satisfy his family's demands. He also owns a boutique business which is managed by his wife.

Kabeega is challenged by price fluctuations but he describes himself as hardworking. He is requesting a loan to buy produce such as beans, maize and groundnuts for reselling. In the future, Kabeega hopes to finish the construction of his residential house.

loans.use: to buy more beans, maize and groundnuts for reselling.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es:
Benilda, es una persona que ha sido beneficiada con el apoyo del crédito anterior, cuenta que pudo surtir el negocio, vendió más mercadería, tuvo mejores ganancias con las  que pudo pagar sus deudas y además pudo suplir las necesidades del hogar, también ha ventiladores para poder sofocar un poco el calor y ha hecho mejoras a la vivienda, en la actualidad se encuentra con una situación económica estable, ya que tiene el sustento diario para ella y sus hijos.
Actualmente ella solicita otro financiamiento ya que se avecinan unas buenas temporadas para las ventas y además le generan mayores ganancias, invertirá en material para hacer flores, además comprara plástico, sombrillas, sandalias y productos de temporada, con esto ella busca atender mejor las demandas de sus clientes, así obtendrá un incremento en sus ganancias para continuar dándole una vida de calidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Benilda has benefited from the support of a previous loan. She says that she was able to stock up her business, she sold more merchandise, and she had better earnings, with this she was able to pay her debts. Furthermore she was able to supply for her household's needs. She also now has fans in order to soften the heat a little and has made improvements to her home.
She is currently asking for a new loan as good seasons for selling are coming and they generate better income. She will buy material to make flowers and will also buy plastics, parasols, sandals and other seasonal products. With this she hopes to meet the demands of her customers better. In this way she will have an increase in her earnings and this will continue to give her family quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material to make flowers and to buy plastics, parasols, sandals and seasonal products, with this she is looking to meet the demands of her customers better.

loans.name: Mkwawa Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 60s, is married with grown-up children. She has been selling fish for 22 years now. She works from 5am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

Asha will share this loan with her loan group, Mkwawa, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She will use this loan to increase her stock of fish, and to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. 

This will be Asha's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of fish and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to take care of her family, to repay loans and to cover household expenses. Asha is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for supporting the group, which is doing fine and can support their families and take their kids to good schools.

Asha dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: to increase their stock of fish, and to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Jactone

texts.en:
Jactone is a 48-year-old retail shop proprietor and a motorcycle transporter from Bombolulu Kisimani, Kenya. He is a father of six children and has been in his businesses for the last 10 years, doing well.

This is third time borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his businesses. Jactone will use the requested money to purchase wheat and maize flour, soap, milk, tea leaves, sugar and loaves of bread. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. 

Jactone hope to have a happy and educated family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, soap, milk, tea leaves, sugar and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For a long time, Musarat's husband has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. He is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle and to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of funds, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body. 

Therefore, Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. Musarat is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian con 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Julian cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca.De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Julian es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Julian is 38 years old, is in a common-law relationship and lives with his partner and his four children in the district of Cañaris in the province Ferreñafe in the Lambayeque department of Peru. Julian has very good personal and professional references from the inhabitants of the area.The inhabitants of the area mainly earn a living in farming, business and livestock.



He earns a living in farming, specifically in growing coffee. He has more than ten years of experience in this. He is asking for a loan to buy manure and to invest in maintaining his farm. In this way he will obtain better yields.



Julian is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy manure and to invest in maintaining his farm.

loans.name: Elista

texts.en:
Elista is 19 years old. She is currently living with her parent in Iringa district. Volunteering as a health activist, she gives time each week to deliver programs in communities that provide information on sanitation, infant care, HIV/AIDS, and many other health-related topics. 

Though she currently doesn't have her own business, Elista is now requesting a Kiva loan to start selling vegetables and fruits from a fruit stall in the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and fruits from farmers to start her own fruit stall business. 

She plans to use the profits she will earn to fulfill her basic needs and also plans to reinvest in her business to help it grow. The interest on her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Elista's weekly two-and-a-half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits from farmers to start a fruit stall business.

loans.name: Lourdes Eliana

texts.es:
La socia Eliana continúa dedicándose a su labor de artesanía de papel en su taller y ahora también se dedica a producir  bocaditos, como pasteles, queques , empanadas, etc. ya que le apasiona el arte culinario.
 Ella es una adulta mayor, pero eso no le impide seguir produciendo, gracias a sus ingresos saco adelante a su familia y ahora solo quiere tener una calidad de vida sus 65 años.
La socia solicito el préstamo para  comprar papel y moldes.
La socia está muy contenta con el crédito  ya que le permitirá seguir produciendo más y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lourdes Eliana continues to earn a living from her work making artisan products from paper in her workshop and now she also makes small snacks such as pies, cakes, empanadas, etc. as she loves cooking.

She is an older woman but this does not stop her producing, thanks to her income she has gotten her family ahead in life and now she only wants to have quality of life at 65 years of age.

She is asking for a loan to buy paper and moulds.

She is very happy to have this loan as it will allow her to continue producing more and she is committed to making the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy paper and moulds.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace mas de 20 años y comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de 2 vacas lecheras y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Ricardo is 45 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his two children. He earns a living raising livestock and he has done this for over 20 years. He sells his products in the neighbouring towns and with what he earns he manages to cover some household costs. He is asking for a loan to buy two dairy cows and in this way be able to continue with his work which gives him a good income.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en novembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes très solidaires et très dynamiques qui ont de bonnes relations et qui habitent dans le même village. Elles  s'activent principalement dans l'embouche et commerce.
SATOU  debout à droite la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 garçons et 3 filles. Elle s'active dans l’embouche.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 2 bœufs prés de sa localité, l'un à 200 000 FCFA revendu à 250 000 FCFA et l'autre à 150 000 FCFA revendu à 175 000 FCFA au bout de 3 mois. Elle fait ça deux fois pendants le six mois.
Elle utilisera les bénéfices pour épargner au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of five members belongs to the Banc Villageois which was set up in November 2009. It is made up of women who are very united and dynamic, enjoying a good relationship with one another and all living in the same village. They are primarily occupied with fattening up animals and small trading activities.

Satou, who is standing on the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is the star borrower. She is 43 years old, married and mother to three boys and three girls. She fattens animals, and with this loan she is planning to buy two cows near to her town, one for 200,000 FCFA to be resold after three months at 250,000 FCFA, and the other for 150,000 FCFA to be resold at 175,000 FCFA. She does this twice during a six-month period. She will save the profits in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Dibor's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré en novembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes très solidaires et très dynamiques qui habitent dans le même village et s'activent principalement dans l'embouche et le commerce. 
AISSATOU  debout à droite la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont  2 garçons et 2 filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce de mil et d'arachide.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 600 kilogrammes de mil à 150 FCFA le kilo et 400 kilogrammes d'arachide à 300 FCFA le kilo. Elle achète sa marchandise dans son village et le revend dans la capitale le kilo de mil à 200 FCFA et celui de l'arachide à 700 FCFA. Elle assure le transport en faisant un apport de 10 000 FCFA.
Les bénéfices générés serviront à épargner d'une part, et d'autre part à aider ses enfants notamment en leur payant la scolarité et en leur achetant des fournitures.
texts.en:
This group of 22 members is part of the "banc villageois" ["village bank"] that was founded in November 2009. It is made up of very supportive and dynamic women living in the same village and who primarily work in livestock fattening and trade. 

Aissatou, standing in the far right of the photo with her left hand raised, is the group's representative and is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls. She makes a living in the resale of millet and peanuts. 

With the loan she plans on buying 600 kg of millet for 150 CFA francs per kg and 400 kg of peanuts for 300 CFA francs per kg. She buys her merchandise in her village and resells them in the capital for 200 CFA francs per kg of millet and 700 CFA francs per kg of peanuts. She spends 10,000 CFA francs on transporting her goods. 

The revenues will go towards her savings and to support her children by sending them to school and buying their supplies.

loans.use: to buy 600 kg of millet and 400 kg of peanut crops.

loans.name: Mbayang's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 3 novembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes très solidaires et très dynamiques qui ont de bonnes relations et qui habitent dans le même village. Elles  s'activent principalement dans l'embouche et commerce.
SAYE  debout à droite la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 1 garçon et 5 filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce d'arachide, de mil et de haricot.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de mil l'unité à 7500 FCFA et le revend à 10 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi 3 sacs de haricot à 15 000 FCFA l'un  et revend l'unité à 20 000 FCFA. Elle achète enfin 1 sac d'arachide à 37500 FCFA et le revend à 52500 FCFA. Elle fait ça deux fois pendants les six mois.
Les bénéfices serviront à épargner au niveau du banc villageois mais aussi à répondre aux charges familiales en achetant de la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group of 26 members belongs to the Banc Villageois which was set up on 3rd November 2009. It is made up of very united and dynamic women, who enjoy a good relationship with one another and live in the same village. Their main activities are fattening animals and small trading businesses.

Saye, who is standing on the right of the photo with her left hand raised, is the star borrower. She is 56 years old, married and mother to six children, one boy and five girls. She has a small trading business, selling groundnut, millet and beans. With this loan she is planning to buy three sacks of millet at 7,500 FCFA each to resell at 10,000 FCFA. She is also buying three sacks of beans at 15,000 FCFA each to resell at 20,000FCFA and, finally, one sack of groundnut for 37,500 FCFA to be resold at 52,500 FCFA. She does this twice during a six-month period. The profits will be used to boost her savings with the Banc Villageois, but also to meet family expenses by buying food.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of millet, three sacks of beans and a sack of groundnut.

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson, de 29 años de edad, estudio la carrera de idioma inglés, está soltero, en su casa vive con su hermana y su madrastra.

Nelson, culmino sus estudios hace un año y actualmente trabaja en la alcaldía municipal de su pueblo, desde hace 10 meses labora en el área social deportiva, con el sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo compra lo necesario para poder sostenerse y ayudar a su hermana, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 8:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. y viaja 25 minutos en auto bus.

Nelson, necesita el préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio de zapatería, específicamente comprará 30 pares de zapatos de diversas tallas y estilos para damas, caballeros y niños.- Este negocio le será de gran ayuda para poder tener una fuente de ingresos.

Los sueños de Nelson, son poder seguir estudiando una maestría, para poder tener un mejor empleo y con el tiempo poder tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Nelson, 20 years old, studied the English language track, is single, and lives in his house with his sister and stepmother.

Nelson finished his schooling a year ago and currently works in the municipal government of his town. He has worked for 10 months in the social sports area. With the salary that he gets from his job, he purchases what he needs to sustain himself and help his sister. His work schedule is from Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm and he travels 25 minutes by bus.

Nelson needs the loan to begin his own shoe sales business, specifically he will purchase 30 pairs of shoes in a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children. This business will be a great help to him to be able to have a source of income.

Nelson's dreams are to be able to continue studying for a master's degree, to be able to have a better job and, with time, be able to have a larger business.

loans.use: to begin his own shoe sales business, specifically he will purchase 30 pairs of shoes of a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children.

loans.name: Kledys Yaneth

texts.es:
Kledys, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja es electricista y ella vive con sus suegros y aún no tiene hijos.

Kledys, se dedica al comercio desde hace 4 años, ella vende productos de la canasta básica en su casa, optó por colocar este negocio debido a que necesitaban una fuente de ingresos; con el pasar del tiempo ha aumentado su negocio.

Kledys, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, maíz, entre otros productos necesarios para el diario vivir y gracias a este negocio ha tenido una fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia.

Kledys, sueña con tener hijos y poder construir su propia casa, para estar más cómodamente con su pareja y sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
Kledys, 20 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade, she is partnered, and her partner is an electrician and she lives with her in-laws and doesn't have children yet.

Kledys has worked in sales for 4 years, she sells basic pantry items in her house. She decided to establish this business because they needed a source of income. With the passing of time, her business has grown.

Kledys needs the loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, corn, and other products needed for daily living and, thanks to this business, she has had a source of income for her family.

Kledys dreams of having children and being able to build her own house to be more comfortable with her partner and future children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, corn and other products.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos, es un hombre soltero, no tiene hijos y económicamente de él solo dependen sus padres, Carlos se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de ropa; ambos oficios los aprendió al ver la necesidad de llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
Carlos solicita un crédito para poder invertirlo en abono y fertilizante para sus cultivos, asimismo comprara camisas y blusas para poder incrementar su inventario y de esa manera tener más que poderles ofrecer a sus clientes y generar más ganancias que le ayudaran a mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus padres y la suya.
Uno de los sueños de Carlos es tener una economía estable y atraer mucho más clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a single man, he doesn't have children and only his parents depend on him economically. Carlos works in agriculture and selling clothing. He learned both trades upon seeing the necessity to bring daily sustenance to his home.

Carlos asks for a loan to be able to invest it in manure and fertilizer for his crops, and also he will purchase shirts and blouses to be able to increase his inventory and in this way have more to be able to offer to his customers and generate more earnings which will help him to improve his parents' and his own living conditions.

One of Carlos's dreams is to have a stable economy and attract many more customers.

loans.use: to invest in manure and fertilizer for his crops, and also to purchase shirts and blouses to be able to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Ndeye Awa

texts.fr:
Ce membre fait partie d'un banc villageois qui a été créé en juin 2011 
NDEYE AWA sur la photo est âgée de 43 ans, elle mariée et mère 6 filles et 2 garçons.Elle est la secrétaire du banc villageois, assume pleinement son rôle et s'active dans le commerce de produits agricoles, alimentaires et de beauté.Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'autant plus qu'elle fait cette activité depuis des années. 
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 10 barils de mil, 5 barils d'arachide, 60 litres d'huile de palme, 3 seaux d'encens, 125 kilogrammes de macaroni et des produits de beauté ( lait de corps, parfums, savons).
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte aider ses enfants dans leurs études en leur achetant des fournitures mais aussi  en leur achetant des vêtements, mais également acheter de la nourriture pour la famille et enfin épargner au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This member belongs to a Banc Villageois which was set up in June 2011. Ndeye Awa, who is the woman in the photo, is 43 years old, married and mother to six girls and two boys. She is the secretary of the Banc Villageois and assumes this role very seriously; she also sells farming produce, food and beauty products. She has good experience in this field since she has been doing it for years.

With this loan she is planning to buy ten barrels of millet, five barrels of groundnut, 60 liters of palm oil, three buckets of incense, 125 kilos of macaroni and also beauty products (body lotion, perfume, soap). With the profits she makes, she is planning to help her children with their studies, by buying them school materials but also clothes, as well as buying food for the family and putting some money in her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy 10 barrels of millet, five barrels of groundnut, 60 liters of palm oil, three buckets of incense, 125 kilos of macaroni and beauty produts.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en juin  2011. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations et sont très solidaires. Elles s'activent principalement dans l'embouche.
BOUSSO debout à droite la photo et levant la main est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 5 filles et 4 garçons. Elle s'active dans l'embouche et parallèlement dans le commerce de draps.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter un bœuf à 200 000 FCFA et le revendre à 400 000 FCFA après élevage. Pour les soins de vétérinaires et l'aliment de bétail elle dépense 25 000 FCFA.  elle achète 3 draps à 25 000  et revend l'unité à 15 000 FCFA.  Avec le reste du prêt elle assure le transport.
Les bénéfices serviront à épargner mais aussi assurer les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group of four members belongs to the Banc Villageois that was set up in June 2011. It is made up of women from the same village and surrounding areas, who enjoy a good relationship with one another and are very united. Their main activity is fattening animals.

Bousso, who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the star borrower. She is 48 years old, married and mother to nine children, five girls and four boys. She fattens animals buyt also sells sheets. With this loan she is going to buy a cow for 200,000 FCFA to resell at 400,000 FCFA once it has been raised. She will spend a further 25,000 FCFA on vetinerary care and livestock food, and she will buy three sheets for 25,000 FCFA, which she will resell at 15,000 FCFA each. She will use the remainder of the loan to pay for transport. The profits she makes will be partly saved but also used to cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy one cow and three sheets.

loans.name: Zulma Esmeralda

texts.es:
Zulma vive en casa propia junto a su bella familia integrada por su esposo e hijos, en busca de alternativas para aportar a la economía familiar, hace algún tiempo estableció la venta de hot dogs, sus clientes son los vecinos de los alrededores, los días sábados sale a vender su producto al tiangue de la comunidad, por el momento no representa dificultades en sus actividades.
Para mejorar la productividad de su negocio ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprarse básicamente aceite, embutidos, pan, aderezos y bebidas, tendrá a su alcance los ingredientes necesarios para continuar vendiendo hog dots, la finalidad que Zulma tiene al trabajar con créditos es tener mayores ventas e ingresos.
Las aspiraciones que ella tiene son tener estabilidad económica y mejores condiciones de vida junto a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Zulma lives in her own house with her beautiful family made up of her husband and children. In search of alternatives to contribute to the family economy, some time ago she established the sale of hot dogs. Her customers are the neighbors from the nearby area. On Saturdays, she goes out to sell her product at a small stand in the community. At the moment, she doesn't have any difficulties in her work.

To improve her business's productivity, she is asking for a loan to be able to basically purchase oil, cold cuts, bread, seasonings, and drinks. She will have at her reach the necessary ingredients to continue selling hot dogs, the end that Zulma has from working with loans is to have better sales and income.

The aspirations she has are to establish economic stability and better life conditions along with her family.

loans.use: to basically purchase oil, cold cuts, bread, seasonings, and drinks. She will have at her reach the ingredients necessary to continue selling hot dogs.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio, actualmente su estado civil es casado y su grupo familiar está compuesto por él, su esposa y su hija, las cuales dependen económicamente de él, Porfirio se dedica a la venta de ropa; el inicio este trabajo hace más de 20 años y lo hizo con un pequeño puesto en la calle del mercado, luego pudo adquirir un local que es con el que cuenta en la actualidad y además pudo darle empleo a dos personas más.
Porfirio solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra camisas, faldas, vestidos, blusas etc., ya que se avecina una buena temporada con la que espera poder obtener mayores y mejores ingresos que le permitan satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia además de poder incrementar su inventario para poder ofrecerle mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Porfirio ve una buena oportunidad de poder generar ingresos que le permitirán poder cancelar su crédito lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Porfirio currently is married and his family is made up of him, his wife, and daughter, who depend on him economically. Porfirio works selling clothing. He began this work over 20 years ago and he did it from a small stand in the market street, later he was able to get a retail space which is what he currently has, and in addition he was able to provide jobs to two other people.

Porfirio asks for a loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of shirts, skirts, dresses, blouses, etc., since a good season approaches in which he hopes to be able to get more and better income which will allow him to satisfy his family's basic needs in addition to being able to increase his inventory to be able to offer a greater variety to his customers.

Porfirio sees a good opportunity to be able to generate income that will allow him to be able to pay off his loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, skirts, dresses, blouses, since a good season is approaching in which he hopes to be able to get more and better income.

loans.name: Gs El Coroza Group

texts.es:
Beneranda, Es una Señora con más de 40 años ella vive con su esposo, y tiene 2 hijos de los que uno depende de ella, Beneranda se dedica desde hace 5 años, al negocio de venta de leña y tortilla,
Beneranda  la mayoría de sus clientes son de su comunidad, el negocio lo administra ella con su esposo.
Beneranda el crédito lo necesita para la compra de leña y maíz. Beneranda  con el préstamo espera que su negocio crezca y tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes, Beneranda es su Tercer crédito con Prisma, espera seguir contando con el apoyo para hacer crecer su negocio.
Maribel su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio para atender mejor sus  clientes 
Betulia  se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde  hace varios años.
Digna  se dedica al servicio de elaboración y venta de tortilla 
Leydi    es una mujer emprendedora con deseo de hacer crecer su negocio
 .
Todos ellos necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios, ya que ahorita no cuentan con capital de trabajo
	
Choluteca, Honduras  –  Octubre  del 2015
texts.en:
Beneranda is over 40 years old and lives with her husband. She has two children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She has been making a living selling firewood and tortillas for five years. The majority of Beneranda's customers are from her community. She manages the business with her husband.

Beneranda needs a loan to buy firewood and corn meal. She hopes that, with the loan, her business will grow and that she will have more merchandise to offer to her customers. This is her third loan with Prisma. She looks forward to being able to count on their support so that she can grow her business.

Maribel's dream is to grow her business in order to better serve her customers.

Betulia has owned a grocery store for several years.

Digna makes a living at the service of preparing and selling tortillas.

Leydi is an enterprising woman with the desire to see her business grow.

All of them need the loan to invest in their businesses since, at the moment, they don't have enough working capital.


Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2015

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn meal for her business.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude, 57 ans, est marié. Il a deux enfants. Il revend des produits alimentaires tout près de chez lui. Pour pouvoir renouveler ses stocks à temps, il a souvent recours au microcrédit. Il espère voir un changement dans l’activité.
texts.en: Jean Claude. 57 years old, is married. He has two children. He re-sells food products near his home. To be able to renew his stocks in time, he often resorts to micro-credit. He hops to see a change in his business.

loans.use: to buy crates of tomato paste.

loans.name: Carmen Marlene

texts.es: Carmen tiene 32 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijas Julissa de 16 y Michel de 5 años de edad están estudiando en unidades gratuitas del sector, hace dos años decidió tener su propio negocio una pequeña papelería en un lugar donde es muy difícil encontrar este servicio por estar alejado de la ciudad y carecer de transporte para llegar allí con el dinero que obtiene alimenta y educa a sus hijas. Carmen necesita el dinero para incrementar los productos obteniendo mayores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en: Carmen is 32 years old and a single mother of 2 daughters, Julissa is 16 and Michel is 5 years old. They are studying in the free schools in the area. Two years ago, she decided to have her own business, a small stationery store in a place where it is very difficult to find this service because it is far from the city and lacks transportation to get there. With the money she gets, she feeds and educates her daughters. Carmen needs the money to increase the products, getting more income to cover her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to increase products to stock her stationery shop.

loans.name: Marcos Argencio

texts.es: Marcos a sus 66 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y su hija de 28 años de edad a la que siempre brinda su apoyo. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador que presta sus servicios en una finca cercana a su comunidad, por lo que se siente muy feliz y satisfecho. Marcos desea ampliar el área del corredor de su vivienda, ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para ampliar el área del corredor y mejorarla.
texts.en: Marcos, 66 years old, lives in a house he owns with his wife and 28-year-old daughter to whom he always offers his support. He is characterized as a hard-working man who works in a nearby farm in his community, for which he is very happy and satisfied. Marcos wants to expand the size of the outdoor walkway of his house, since it is deteriorated. So, he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to expand the area of the outdoor hallway and improve it.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to expand the area of the outdoor walkway and improve it.

loans.name: Rachelle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en juin  2011. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations et sont très solidaires. Elles s'activent principalement dans l'embouche et l’agriculture.
RACHELLE debout à droite la photo et levant la main gauche  est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée e 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon. Elle s'active dans l'embouche.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter deux bœufs à 200 000 l'unité et avec le reste du prêt, elle achète de l'aliment de bétail. Elle revend le bœuf à 400 000 FCFA après élevage.
Les bénéfices serviront à payer la scolarité de son fils  d'une part, et d'autre part épargner au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en: This group of 2 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created in June 2011. It groups together women from the same village and surrounding areas who have good relationships and are very united. They work mainly in animal fattening and agriculture. Rachelle standing up on the right of the photo and raising her left hand is the star borrower, she is 56 years old. She is married and mother to one boy. She works in the animal fattening. With this loan, she hopes to buy two oxes at 200 000 each and with the rest of the loan, she will buy livestock feed. She will re-sell the ox at 400 000 FCFA after breeding. The profits will help to pay her son's schooling on the one hand, and on the other, to save up at the level of the 'banc villageois'.

loans.use: to buy two oxes.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 29 años de edad, está casado, es padre de un hijo de 3 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y tienen un hijo.

José, trabaja en una empresa eléctrica desde hace 3 años de laborar en esa empresa y recorre 5 kilómetros en una motocicleta y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. Pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de hortalizas desde su infancia, realiza esta actividad pues es muy productiva junto a su esposa que le apoya en los trabajos y aparte de generarle ingresos económicos le proporciona alimentos para su familia. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, porque es otra actividad que quiere iniciar ya que ha trabajado con un tío y ha observado el manejo y cuido de esta actividad y considera que genera buenos ingresos.

José, sueña con seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria junto a su esposa y optar por un mejor empleo y además desea también reparar un poco su vivienda y comprar un vehículo que le facilite el trabajo en los cultivos.
texts.en:
José, 29 years old, is married and the father of a 3-year-old child. He went to school up to the ninth grade, is married, and has a child.

José works at an electric business and has been working at this business for 3 years and he travels 5 kilometers by motorcycle and his schedule is 8:00 am to 3:00 pm. But, apart from this he also works in agriculture, specifically growing vegetables since he was a child. He does this work because it is very productive. His wife who supports him in the work, and apart from generating income, it provides food for his family.

José needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow because it is another job that he wants to begin since he has worked with an uncle and has observed how to manage and care for this job and believes it will generate good income.

José dreams of continuing studying for a university degree along with his wife and to choose a better job, and in addition he wants to also repair his house a bit and purchase a vehicle which will make working his crops easier.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carlos Umberto

texts.es:
Carlos, es acompañado, actualmente vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos; él se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras, gallinas y coronas de flores artificiales en el mercado municipal de su localidad. Quien inicio en este negocio fue su compañera de vida y luego él se incorporo ahora es Carlos quien administra el negocio,  en compañía de su pareja.
Carlos solicita crédito para fortalece su negocio invirtiéndolo en la compra de coronas de flores para la temporada de los fieles difuntos, así también invertirá en frutas y verduras para la venta, con esto el espera generar mayores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y su compañera de vida.
Uno de los sueños de Carlos es poder crecer con su negocio y asegurar un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is partnered and lives with his life partner and their two children. He works selling fruits, vegetables, chickens and artificial floral wreaths in the municipal market of his town. The one who began this business was his life partner and then he joined and now it is Carlos who runs the business, with his partner.

Carlos asks for the loan to strengthen his business, investing in the purchase of floral wreaths for the season of the loyal dead, and also he will invest in fruits and vegetables to sell and, with this, he hopes to generate more income to give his children and life partner a better quality of life.

One of Carlos's dreams is to be able to grow his business and assure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase floral wreaths for the season of the loyal dead, and also he will invest in fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Manuel José

texts.es: Manuel de 42 años, habita en Madrid un municipio de Cundinamarca en  compañía de su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, él se ha destacado en las labores del campo y desde sus doce años trabaja en el. Su principal fortaleza es la cría de cerdos, actividad con la que ha mantenido a su familia durante 30 años consecutivos y manteniendo su  amplia clientela. La principal prioridad de Manuel es que sus hijos estudien para que tengan la oportunidad de surgir en la vida, es por ello que se entrega mucho a su negocio y diariamente a partir de las 5 a.m. está en las porquerizas realizando sus labores que finalizan a las 5 p.m. Manuel necesita comprar crías de cerdo para su engorde y para ello que aplicó a un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar cerditos a buenos precios. Esta inversión le permitirá ampliar su capacidad y a futuro tener jugosas utilidades.
texts.en:
Manuel, 42 years old, lives in Madrid, a municipality in Cudinamarca in the company of his spouse and four children. He has stood out in the farmwork and since he was 12 years old, he has worked in it. His primary strength is raising pigs, work with which he has supported his family for 30 consecutive years and maintained a broad customer base. Manuel's principal priority is that his children go to school to have the opportunity to get ahead in life, and for this he gives a lot to his business and daily, from 5:00 am, he is in the pig sties doing his work that finishes at 5:00 pm.

Manuel needs to purchase baby pigs to fatten them and for this he applied for a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become involved with a financial institution through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and purchase piglets at good prices. This investment will allow him to expand his capacity and, in the future, have lucrative profits.

loans.use: to purchase piglets at a good price.

loans.name: Katindo Kaseo Dip W.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Theophilus. He is twenty six years old and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to benefit from its training programs, especially enterprise development.

Theophilus practices mixed farming i.e he keeps poultry and grows fruit. He is taking out a Kiva loan to buy more chickens and hence boost his poultry production. This will enable him to add stock to meet the rising demand for chicken and eggs, thus increasing his income. He will then be able to advance his education.

Theophilus is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for poultry production.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and married with two children. He has had a hotel business for four years. He will be using this loan to buy more stock of goats for slaughter at his butchery and hopes this will help him to support his family well and expand his business.

David's hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children well and open a new butchery and restaurant. He is in his 6th loan cycle and has borrowed 120,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to be repaid in 12 months.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Humberto Mario

texts.es:
Humberto,  cliente actualmente vive con su compañera de vida e hijos, su estado civil es acompañado y se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, cliente tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y es una persona reconocida en su lugar de residencia.
Él solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas para fortalecer los cultivos y de esa manera poder generar más ingresos económicos que le ayudaran a darle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
El sueño de Humberto es ver a sus hijos ser unas personas que sean útiles a la sociedad además de continuar siendo una persona honesta y responsable ante todos los habitantes de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Humberto, the borrower, currently lives with his life partner and children, he is partnered and works in agriculture and raising animals. The borrower has some years of experience in the business and is a well-known person in the place where he lives.

He asks for a loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of agricultural supplies to strengthen the crops and, in this way, be able to generate more income that will help him to give his family a better quality of life.

Humberto's dream is to see his children be some people who are useful to the society and in addition continue to be an honest and responsible person to the people in his house.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to strengthen his crops and, in this way, be able to generate more income.

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
Mario, de 24 años de edad, es muy trabajador, estudio hasta bachillerato, pero nunca descarta la posibilidad de seguir estudiando en la universidad y terminar una carrera, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, juntos tienen una hija de 2 años de edad.

Mario, es ayudante de albañil desde hace dos años, su jornada empieza a las 5:00 de la mañana y se tarda media hora para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo y sale a las 3:00 de la tarde; pero además de eso también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, pues esa es otra fuente de ingresos.

Mario, necesita el préstamo para comprar 3 terneras lecheras, porque esto le ayudará a obtener mejores ganancias económicas y también alimento para su familia.  

Mario, sueña con seguir estudiando y terminar una carrera universitaria para optar por un mejor trabajo; además desea remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Mario, 24 years old, is very hard-working. He went to school through secondary school but he never rejected the possibility of continuing to study at the university and complete a degree. He is partnered, his partner works at the household chores and together they have a 2-year-old daughter.

Mario has been a construction assistant for two years. His day begins at 5:00 in the morning and it takes a half hour to get to his workplace and he leaves at 3:00 in the afternoon. But, in addition to this, he also works growing basic grains such as corn and beans since this is another source of income.

Mario dreams of continuing his schooling and completing a university degree to get a better job, in addition, he wants to remodel his house.

loans.use: to purchase 3 dairy calves.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 45 years old, married and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from their training programs, especially enterprise development.

Regina grows crops like maize and beans and also keeps livestock. She is taking out a Kiva loan to buy animal feeds, drugs and also certified seeds. This will boost her farm's production and earn her more income. She will then be in a position to pay her children's school fees with ease.

Regina is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds, drugs and certified seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a married woman who has been in the business of selling vegetables for many years. She is very enthusiastic in her work and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is the loving mother of two children, who is responsible for their food, health and clothing and is trying hard to fulfil their basic necessities through her business.
To improve her business, Perveen contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 60,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy sacks of potatoes, onions and tomatoes so she can meet market demands consistently. This will ultimately enable her to cover her utility bills in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, onions and tomatoes to meet market demands.

loans.name: Hazra

texts.en:
Hazra is a 46-year-old married woman. In order to meet her household expenses, she started her business selling animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and then sells them at the market for higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income and she also sells milk to generate extra money.
Hazra needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. Thus, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy more animals to increase her sales. Hazra is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
Before joining Babban Gona, Mary would have had to sell her maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mary can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
As a Babban Gona member, Mary will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare. She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 31 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en juin  2011. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations et sont très solidaires. Elles s'activent principalement dans l'embouche, l'agriculture et le commerce.
MAREME  debout à droite la photo et levant la main gauche  est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée e 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 garçons et 3 filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce de légumes et de poissons. 
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter tous les jours des légumes, 2 kilogrammes de carottes, 3 kilogrammes de choux, 3 kilogrammes de patates, et utilise 5 000 FCFA pour acheter du poissons. Elle s’approvisionne prés de sa localité et revend dans son village. Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement.
les bénéfices serviront à assurer la dépense quotidienne en achetant de la nourriture pour la famille mais aussi à épargner.
texts.en:
This group of 31 members is part of the "banc villageois" ["village bank"] founded in 2011. It brings together women from the same village and surrounding area who maintain ties of friendship and solidarity. They make a living primarily by raising livestock, and through agricultural and trade work. 

Mareme, standing on the right side of the photo with her left hand raised, is the representing borrower and is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 boys and 3 girls. She sells vegetables and fish.

She will use her loan to purchase vegetables (2 kg of carrots, 3 kg of cabbage, 3 kg of potatoes) and 5,000 West African francs worth of fish. She buys her goods in the area and resells them in her village. The rest of the loan will go towards her business' working capital. Her revenues will be used to provide food for her family and to contribute to her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Kisa Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joseph of Kisa Self Help Group. He is 68-years-old, married and blessed with three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.
After taking Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training course on enterprise development and financial management, he was able to diversify his business. He now earns a living by selling fish and poultry farming and has increased his income. Joseph is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy more fish for resale. He looks forward to more earnings that will enable him to pay for his family’s food and children's school fees with ease.
Joseph is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and he promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale and increase his income.

loans.name: Nia

texts.en:
Nia is 24 years old and currently living with her grandmother and her two children in the Iringa district. She is volunteering as a health activist and she gives time each week to deliver education on sanitation, infant care, and HIV/AIDS. 

Nia is requesting a loan to start a pub for selling hard and soft drinks. She plans to use the profit from her loan to support her family. Her “social-interest” loan will be repaid with Nia's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to start a pub for selling hard and soft drinks

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Greetings from the Ashotavan community of the Syunik region. This is Anna and her youngest son, Grisha, who is 4 years old. Together with her two sons and husband, she happily lives and works in Ashotavan. By profession, Anna is a teacher working at the local village school. After her work, together with her husband, Anna has been running the family farm which includes cows, calves, sheep, and hens and also growing emmer wheat, potato, and cabbage.

Anna is requesting a loan to purchase fuel and forage for feeding her livestock in the winter season. In the future, she plans to see their farm grow.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and forage for feeding livestock in the winter

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en: Hoy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Hoy works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lodicea

texts.en:
Lodicea is 31 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Lodicea is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lodicea has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. Remedios is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy new fishing net.

Remedios has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net

loans.name: Sylvest

texts.en:
Sylvest, age 31, is a very hardworking married man charged with the task of taking care of four children who all attend school in Hoima, Uganda.

He ventured into the selling of bicycle spare parts. This is supplemented by income from farming, mainly growing cassava and beans.

He desires to expand and develop his business; however, inadequate capital poses a strong threat to his wish. He is seeking credit to buy more bicycle spares to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bicycle spares to sell.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
A 23-year-old, single, ambitious lady who has been studying in university for three years majoring special education--this is ‎Alaa!

Her father is the sole breadwinner for her family. Alaa is a hardworking lady who puts so much effort into advancing ‎in her work and increasing her income.

Because of the high cost of living, her family could not cover her semester fees, so she is acquiring a loan from ‎Kiva to pay for her university and achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to pay for her university and achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Fe has a food vending business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, peanuts, etc..

Fe has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 24 years old and currently lives with her parents in the Iringa district. She runs a retail shop where she sells products such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, beans, rice, and drinks. Grace also volunteers  as a Camfed learner guide, giving time each week to mentor younger students and members of her community in personal growth and development. 

Grace is requesting a loan to buy products for her shop. She plans to use the profit from her loan to expand her business and to build her own house. Her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Grace's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
A local resident living in a two bed-room house in Bovel district of Battambang province, Mao is 57 years old and she is a widow, who has six children, two of whom are dependent and need her to support their education.

She has sold grocery items for 10 years and she has worked for others for a fee to earn additional income. Because of lack of funds to support her son's studying for a bachelor degree in Agriculture, she decided to take a loan, which is the first time for her with VisionFund.

She is willing to use her loan to pay for her son university's fee. She hopes that the first loan will help her son to be able to successfully complete his bachelor so as to get a well paid job in the future.

loans.use: pay for her son's university fee for a BSc.in Agriculture.

loans.name: Nebo Angwan Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Milka, a member of Nebo Agwan group. She is 38 years old, married and blessed with 11 children.

She joined Hand In Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from courses on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management.

Milka is now able to advance her business of poultry keeping through proper recording and using the profits prudently. With these skills she is able to provide better education to her children.

Milka is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chickens and also chicken feeds to expand her business further. She appreciates Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and also chicken feeds to expand her business further.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 60 years old from the small village Zumi, which is located in the Chkhorotsku district. Revaz is divorced and lives alone.

He is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns four cows and produces cheese products. Revaz also owns 1.5 hectares of agricultural land, where he grows nut trees.

Revaz wants to start a taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 5,500 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a car and will start a taxi business. This will give him a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi service.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
Umaru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Umaru is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Umaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Umaru will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Umaru now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Insherah

texts.en:
Insherah is 47 years old and is the caring mother of four children. She has high hopes and a desire to move forward. ‎She has a son, Majed, who is appears in the photo instead of her because she is a conservative woman.

Insherah is a very hardworking woman and example of the woman who sacrifices for her children.‎

Majed makes a living running his own grocery store, and thanks to the support he received from another loan in the past, ‎his shop improved a great deal. He wants his store to continue and improve even further. Now he needs another loan ‎because he wants to buy rice, beans, eggs, bananas, coffee, detergent and other items for his store, so his mother, ‎Insherah, wants to help him as usual to expand his shop and achieve his goals.

Majed dreams of being able to ‎continue running his business and making profits so that his family can have better opportunities.‎

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, eggs, bananas, coffee, detergent and other items for his store.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 26 years old. He comes from a family of seven and is the fourth-born. Lawrence runs a mobile money transfer business in Mazabuka, a large, tree-lined town that is 349 km from Livingstone and 124 km from Lusaka, Zambia. He is hardworking and enjoys talking to people.

Lawrence’s business helps people in his community to send and receive money. Most people send money for school fees, business purposes, medical bills, and other emergencies. Lawrence strives to provide the best customer service to his customers. He explains that accessing capital in Zambia is very difficult for young people. Lawrence’s major business challenge is that he cannot expand his business to new locations due to a lack of working capital. 

Lawrence is requesting a loan to expand his business by setting up two additional locations. He will purchase two kiosks and provide funds to serve customers in both locations. This will be Lawrence’s third Kiva loan. He used his first Kiva loan to begin his business. After fully repaying this loan, Lawrence accessed his second loan to increase the capital float that he uses to serve customers. Lawrence is hopeful that his Kiva loan will give his business the boost that it needs. He says his life will change as he will earn more profits and help his siblings, who are struggling.

loans.use: to expand his business by setting up two additional locations so that more people can access financial services

loans.name: Khak's Group

texts.en: Khak’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khak works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Auwalu

texts.en:
Auwalu is a maize farmer from Baure A village. As a Babban Gona member, Auwalu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Auwalu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Auwalu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Auwalu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Auwalu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Muh'd

texts.en:
Muh'd is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Muh'd has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muh'd would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Muh'd can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Muh'd will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Muh'd is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Born in 1974, Ziad is an ambitious Palestinian father of two who works in the manufacturing industry. He lives with his family in the refugee camp located in North Lebanon, in which he and his wife grew up. Ziad's wife does not work and his children still go to school, which makes Ziad's income the household's only source of revenue.

Ziad has 12 years of experience working as a blacksmith. After making himself connections and a good reputation in the camp, he decided to establish his own business by opening his shop in 2007. He is hoping that one day he will be able to pass over the business to his sons.

For the first time, Ziad is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. He needs this loan to buy a large quantity of iron at a lower price. In that way, he will be able to reduce his costs and increase his projects' profitability.

Ziad's projects include houses and shops inside the camp's area. His clients appreciate his professionalism and honesty, which is good for him as he is doing his best to increase his network of clients.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of iron for his projects.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr: Marthe a 39 ans. Elle est revendeuse de vêtements usagés. Son commerce est très florissant dans la zone, elle a beaucoup de clients. Elle ne s’arrête jamais de faire avancer son commerce en y appliquant une bonne gestion. Elle rêve de devenir propriétaire d’une grande boutique de vêtements neufs.
texts.en: Marthe is 39 years old. She is retailer of used clothing. Her business is flourishing in her area and she has lots of customers. She is committed to growing her business using her strong management skills. Her dream is to become the owner of a large boutique that sells new clothing.

loans.use: to buy a supply of clothing.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is a 42-year-old married man from Gardabani district. His wife, Sevil, works as a perfume distributor and gets a small monthly income.

Mubariz wants to start a taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 6,000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a car and will start a taxi business.

Mubariz hopes that this business will be profitable for his family and he awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Here is Armenuhi from Meghri town. She lives there with her parents-in-law, husband and 4-year-old son.

They run a farm that includes three cows and they would like to enlarge it so the family will have normal living conditions.

Armenuhi has applied for this loan to purchase a cow, a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. She greatly hopes for lenders' support to sustain the farm and continue their family business.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a calf and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Yousef is a shepherd, 60 years old, married with four kids, and lives in Doura Neighborhood in Hebron city. Yousef has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc.

Yousef needs the loan to buy more sheep for his flock in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profit. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the changeable weather conditions, and the other challenge is the high costs of the feed.

For the future, Yousef hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of his livestock.
Yousef thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to add to his flock and to buy fodder for them.  He is a shepherd.

loans.name: Sikudhani

texts.en:
Sikudhani is 20 years old. She is living with her relatives in in Bagamoyo District.

She is volunteering as a Camfed alumnus. She gives time each week to mentor younger students and members through a range of personal issues, and she teaches them life and problem-solving skills to help them improve their learning performance.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to start a charcoal business. She plans to use the profit she will earn to support her family in daily basic needs and to attain further education. This social interest loan will be repaid through Sikudhani's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to start a charcoal business.

loans.name: Auwal

texts.en:
Auwal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Auwal has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Auwal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Auwal can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Auwal will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Auwal is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alba Esperanza

texts.es: Alba es una mujer de 38 años que considera que lo más importante en su vida es la familia y que por ella busca alternativas y oportunidades de mejorar en su negocio de perfilaría en aluminio y vidrio, negocio con el que se han solventado durante estos últimos tres años.
