Su cónyuge laboro por muchos años con empresas de instalación de vidrios y protectores en aluminio en donde aprendió el oficio y con una liquidación que recibió al quedar cesante estableció el negocio en compañía de Alba, su mano derecha.  Diariamente abren el negocio  a las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. y sus trabajos son ejecutados una vez el cliente entregue el 50 % del servicio, sin embargo en esta temporada que se aproxima, prevén que necesitaran mucha más materia prima para responder al incremento de la demanda porque las personas aprovechan dineros extras que reciben para realizar cerramientos, divisiones de baño, protectores y ventas,  por ello Alba aplicó a un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar vidrio de diferentes calidades y calibres, aluminio, bisagras, entre otros. A futuro proyecta que ampliará su bodega y sus ventas serán mucho mayores.  En lo personal desean comprar vivienda.
texts.en: Alba is a 38 year old woman who considers the most important thing in her life to be her family. It is for them that she is seeking alternatives and opportunities to improve her business of aluminum and glass profiles. This business has supported them for the last three years. Her spouse worked for many years installing glass and aluminum protective casings, where he learned the trade. With some severance pay he received when he was laid off he opened the business with Alba, his right hand. They open the business every day at 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. and they do the work once the customer has paid for 50% of the service. Nonetheless, with the coming season, they will need a lot more raw materials to respond to the increase in demand. People take advantage of extra money they have to do enclosures, bathroom divisions, protective casings and sales. That is why Alba applied for a Kiva loan, an opportunity to connect to financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She did this to buy different types and sizes of glass, aluminum, hinges, and more. In the future, she plans to expand their warehouse and have many more sales. For her personal life, they want to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy different types and sizes of glass, aluminum, and hinges, and more.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto tiene 59 años  de edad, de estado civil casado vive con su esposa en un lugar alejado de la ciudad, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras por más de cinco años esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que puede cubrir las principales necesidades del hogar. Gilberto necesita el dinero para incrementar su pequeño negocio aumentar las ventas generando mayores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades fundamentales de su hogar.
texts.en: Gilberto is 59 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in a place that is away from the city. He has sold fruit and vegetables  for  more than five years. This is the only source of income to cover the main household needs. Gilberto needs the loan to expand his small business, increase sales and generate more income to cover the basic needs of his home.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to stock his small business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 12 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero como no posee suficiente capital para poder hacerlo esta solicitando un credito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda segura.
texts.en: The young woman's face is pixelated because she is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has sold fruit and vegetables for 12 years. With her profits, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and their two children. She wants to improve her home by changing the roof, but she doesn't have enough capital to do it. She is asking for a loan to buy sheeting, rods and to pay for labor costs, so that she can have a secure home.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, rods and to pay for l.abor costs

loans.name: Kelvy Reynaldo

texts.es:
Kelvy Reynaldo con 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú,en una zona rural.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Kelvy Reynaldo se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y abarrotes, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de infraestructura de su negocio y para la compra de más mercadería, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas,con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los habitantes de la zona.

Kelvy es socio reactivado en Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido seis créditos de S/. 10000,00; S/.10000,00; S/.1000,00; 5000,00;S/.1000,00 y S/.4000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Kelvy Reynaldo is 28 years old. He is in a common law marriage and he lives with his wife and their two children in the district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Peru, in a rural area. He has very good personal and work references from the area residents. The residents of this locality mainly work in agriculture, commerce and ranching.

Kelvy Reynaldo works selling fruit, vegetables and groceries. He has more than 5 years' experience in the business. It is located in his home. He is asking for this loan to do some repairs on the infrastructure of his business and to buy more merchandise. This investment will serve to increase his sales and really influence his business. This way, he plans on having more products in stock to serve the different needs, requirements and tastes of the area residents.

Kelvy is a re-activated member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had six loans of S/. 10000,00; S/.10000,00; S/.1000,00; 5000,00;S/.1000,00 and S/.4000,00, which were paid of on time.

loans.use: to do some repairs on the infrastructure of his business and to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Osmar

texts.es:
José, cuenta que en relaciona al crédito anterior su familia se mantiene unida, aunque sus ingresos no han variado mucho pero continua con el deseo de poder terminar la construcción de su hogar y de comprar el resto de herramientas que le faltan para poder continuar dando el servicio de albañil.
José  solicita un nuevo crédito para poder realizar la compra de algunos materiales que le hacen falta para poder hacerle unas mejoras a su hogar y fortalecer su equipo de trabajo para prestar un servicio,  invertirá en la compra de ladrillo, arena, hierro, y otros así como algunas herramientas, espera tener mejores resultados que con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
José reports that in regards to the previous loan, his family remains close. Although his income hasn't changed much, he continues to want to finish building his home and buy the rest of the tools he needs to continue with the masonry work.

José is asking for a new loan to be able to buy some materials he needs to do some home improvements and to fortify his work equipment to offer service. He will invest in buying bricks, sand, iron and some tools. He hopes to have better results than with the previous loan.

loans.use: to invest in buying steel, sand, iron and more, as well as tools to do some home improvements and fortify his work equipment.

loans.name: Mountaha

texts.en:
Mountaha runs a beauty salon in her house providing her clients with all types of beauty-related services.

After losing her husband a couple of years ago, Mountaha decided to dedicate her time and efforts to her own business allowing her to provide herself with decent living conditions.

Mountaha lives alone in the Chouf area of Lebanon but still gets the support of her son who works as an employee in the private sector. She also works as a kitchenware salesperson for extra revenue which allows her to meet potential clients for her salon.

Mountaha needs a loan of 2,056,987 Lebanese pounds (LBP) for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She will be using the loan to upgrade her salon's equipment and buy beauty products. With this small investment, she is expecting to generate more income from her business and provide her clients with a more comfortable space.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a single woman in her late 40s with three grown children. She has been a food vendor for nine years and works from 8am to 3pm daily. She makes a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanahamisi's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her food stock and has successfully repaid her loans. She is happy with the loan and thanks Kiva lenders for their support. She used the profit to repay the loan, reinvest in her business, and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock out of stock items such as cooking oil, kilos of rice, and beans to meet her customer's requirements. She dreams of opening a classic restaurant.

Mwanahamisisi will share this loan with her 5-member loan group "SINGIDA" who hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and kilos of rice.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih, who is 31, owns a motorcycle repair shop where he also sells a wide range of motorcycle-related accessories.

He recently got married and lives with his wife in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. His wife is unemployed, so Rabih strongly relies on his business to generate enough income for the household.

Rabih opened his business two years ago with the support of his uncles after working for 17 years in the industry, and now he has two workers helping him in the shop.

Rabih is asking for a loan of 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds (LBP) for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to buy new motorcycle accessories that will increase his business profitability.

For the past three years, Rabih managed to build himself a good reputation by providing his clients with excellent service quality. He is hoping that by maintaining such results, he will be able to expand his shop during the upcoming years.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories for his repair shop.

loans.name: Noé

texts.fr: Noé, 24 ans, est célibataire et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Jeune entrepreneur fougueux, il a décidé de créer sa petite entreprise afin de gagner des revenus pour répondre à ses besoins. Il offre des services de blanchisserie et de pressage de vêtements. Son entreprise est très prospère. Il demande un prêt pour investir dans l’achat de produits pour sa blanchisserie.
texts.en: Noé is 24. He is single and does not yet have any children. He is a spirited young entrepreneur, who decided to create a small business in order to earn some income to provide for his own needs. He offers laundry and dry cleaning services. His business is doing very well. He requests a loan to invest in products for his laundry.

loans.use: to buy washing powder.

loans.name: Milfort

texts.fr: Marie Renée a 33 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a quatre enfants. Pour prendre soin de sa famille, elle revend des produits alimentaires. Depuis deux ans, elle a commencé à emprunter de l’argent pour investir  dans son business. Ces prêts ont beaucoup aidé au progrès de l’activité. Elle rêve de parvenir à l’autonomie financière.
texts.en: Marie Renée is 33. She lives in a de facto union and has four children. To take care of her family she sells food products. For the last two years she has been borrowing money to invest in her business. These loans have really helped her business to progress. She dreams of attaining financial independence.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is the owner of a bakery in the Chouf mountains of Lebanon. She is 45 years old and has run the bakery with her husband since 2003. They make all types of local breads, rolls, and other bakery products to sell to nearby schools. They also cater events upon request.

Majida is asking for a 2,571,213 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy large quantities of ingredients. By buying them in bulk, she will ensure a low price which will decrease her costs. It will also allow her to increase her production and boost the bakery's income.

Majida works hard with her husband to improve the bakery's performance as it is the family's main source of income. Her son works as an employee and tries to support his parents financially and her daughter is pursuing a university degree.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Mission Group

texts.en:
Theophil is a married man in his mid 60s with five children, four attend school. He has been selling cold drinks and milk for twenty years. He works from 7:30am to 8pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Theophil's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to purchase cold drinks and cows. He is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, build his house, repay the loan, purchase two cars, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to purchase cold drinks and milk. He dreams of expanding his business by buying more cows and selling drinks at wholesale prices.

Theophil will share this loan with his 2-member loan group "Mission".

loans.use: to purchase  cold drinks and milk.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Ngeme, who is in her early 60s, is married with three children who are grown-up. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 6 am to 2 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Ngeme's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her mamalishe and has managed to repay all of her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to repay her loan and cover household expenses. She also renovated the place where she sells her food by putting in floor tiles, a new washing basin for washing hands, burglar windows and doors. She will use this loan to replace the out-of-stock items in her food store.

Ngeme will share this loan with her loan group Bega Kwa Bega, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replace the out-of-stock items in her food store.

loans.name: Jean Lerome

texts.fr: Lerome est âgée de 59 ans. Il vit en union libre et a six enfants. Il possède une petite boutique chez lui où il revend des produits alimentaires, des boissons gazeuses et quelques produits cosmétiques. Pour assurer le développement de cette activité, il contracte souvent des prêts qu’il utilise pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Jerome is 59. He lives with his partner and has six children. He has a small shop at his home where he sells food products, fizzy drinks, and a few cosmetic products. To ensure the development of this activity, he often takes out loans that he uses to increase his stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy crates of condensed milk.

loans.name: Noel

texts.fr: Noel a 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie et trouve de quoi nourrir sa famille. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Noel is 52. She is married with three children. She sells cosmetic products. That is how she earns a living and finds the means to feed her family. She needs a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en:
Ilkin, 23, is single. He is an international displaced person who lives in Azerbaijan's Bilasuvar region, which is a settlement for refugees. His family isn't large. He helps his family and takes care of his elder parents. He grows vegetables and fruits. He supports his family with his farming activities.

Ilkin is a well-reputed man in the local market. Even at his young age, he has been successful in the local bazaar. People see him as an honest, intelligent and hardworking man. His income is more dependent on people who have a high demand for fresh fruits and vegetables. Many traditional dishes consist of such vegetables as potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes and eggplant. People prepare dolmas, bozbash and other meals with these vegetables.

Ilkin is a very hard-working and energetic person. He wants to become successful and better meet his family's needs. To do so, he plans to improve his business. He is planning to buy seeds and fertilizer. He requires a loan of 1,200 Azerbaijani New Manats. Kiva lenders should support him.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.fr: Wilson est âgée de 47 ans. Il est marie et père de cinq enfants. Il y a 27 ans, il a ouvert une petite boutique chez lui. Il  y vend des produits cosmétiques. Cette activité est la seule source de revenus de sa famille. Pour la développer, il a contracté plusieurs prêts. Il rembourse toujours ses prêts sans difficultés et les utilise de façon adéquate.
texts.en: Wilson is 47 years of age. He is married and the father of five children. 27 years ago he started running a small store from his home. He sells cosmetic products. This work allows him to make a living and support his family. In order to develop his business he has taken out several loans, which he used appropriately and successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Michelet

texts.fr: Michelet est âgé de 35 ans. Il est célibataire et père d’un enfant en bas âge. Il revend des chaussures. Avec cette activité, il gagne suffisamment d’argent pour prendre soin de son enfant et pour entreprendre d’autres projets. Il fait beaucoup de ventes. Il a recours au microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Michelet is 35. He is single and has one young child. He sells shoes. With this activity, he earns sufficient income to provide for his child and to begin other projects. He makes a lot of sales. He requests a loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy a stock of shoes.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en:
Julio is a 28-year-old man, married to a loving wife. He has a young child and is in charge of the economical support of his family. He works hard every day to provide for his wife and child. He likes working hard because this allows his wife to take care of their child.

Julio repairs cars at his workshop which employs two people. Julio started to fix cars at his parents' garage, but needed to move to a bigger place. He has moved ahead and succeeded with his projects.

His biggest achievement is getting a business of his own and keeping his clients because of his quality of work. His biggest goals are to increase the size of his workshop and get more clients.

Julio is applying for 10,527.00 MXN at Kiva through Kubo to buy extra tools and a scanner (to fix the electric problems of cars). This will allow him to keep up with the daily standards of his work.

loans.use: to buy a new scanner

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a freshman in the Business Administration Program at AUCA. From her childhood she had her fondest dream to enter AUCA. And she knew that it would be an uphill climb to gain admission into this prestigious university in Central Asia.

She is inspired with her aunt, who is the Alumna of AUCA, and now she is very successful and skilled worker. Samira is always delighted to see her aunt and wants to become like she her. But now Samira is adult and understands that she can’t study at AUCA by herself as she needs financial aid and is now applying for a Kiva loan.

Samira lives with her mother. Her parents divorced several years ago, but her father still tries to help her as he can. Samira’s mother is looking for a job and unemployed at present. When she told about her dream to study at AUCA, both Samira’s parents supported her and father promised to pay part of her tuition fee. The reason for that is Samira had excellent marks at school and loves to study. Her parents want to see her broad-minded and well-educated in the future, so they are going to do their best. Samira sincerely hopes to get financial aid from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education at AUCA, for a degree studying Business Administration

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a farmer from the village of Busila in the Ungheni region. She has a small farm to raise cows, pigs, chickens, and a horse. Her husband, Ion, is a farmer and helps Ana to manage this farm. Ana owns five hectares of land and grows grain to feed the animals.

She collects about 120 liters of milk every day to sell. Ana built a bigger shed for her cows. She wants to buy cows to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

Ana will use this loan to finish construction of the animal shed. The family’s financial situation will improve.

loans.use: for finishing construction of a animal shed and buy cows.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a single woman in her early 30s with one child who attends school. She has been selling bed sheets and fabric for three years. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Zena's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to purchase fabric and bed sheets. She is happy with the loan and has managed to successfully repay her loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, and cover house hold expenses. She will use this loan to fabric.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa is from the town of Jagna. This place in Bohol is where businesses thrive because of the pier located in this town. From the pier, passengers flock to reach other places of destination in the Philippines. Out of this, Diosa made a business cooking suman (rice cake made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed wrapped in buli or buri palm (Corypha) leaves). Suman is usually eaten sprinkled with sugar or with latik (caramelized sugar). Diosa can sell this food near the pier where passengers are waiting for ferries. She is asking a loan to buy sugar, sticky rice and coconut. Any income will be utilized to pay for the school fees of her three dependents aged 7, 11 and 18.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sticky rice and coconut

loans.name: Thuraya

texts.en:
Thuraya was born in 1971. She is a married woman with six children and lives at a sector in Jordan called Salheye. ‎Thuraya has been trying her best to support her husband financially. She started her project which is sewing clothes for ‎women and children and sells it; she has started her business for six years ago. She considered her work as a good ‎source of income to support her children in covering their needs. Being so popular among her family members, neighbors, ‎and friends who like what she creates.

Thuraya decided to take a big step four years ago by starting her own association ‎where there beauty salon and tailor shop also she employed a women who are needs work in association. And because ‎of the high standard of living, she decided to expand and develop her work, so she applied for a loan to become ‎able to buy yarn, fabrics and tools to produce larger number of products and to improve her salon to increase her sales and ‎profit and also to do a good promotion for her shop to attract more customers.‎

loans.use: to be ‎able to buy yarn, fabrics and tools to produce a larger number of clothes and improve her salon .

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 61 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilian is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilian has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Sin’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is the age of 56, living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her son has been running a mobile shop for couple of years and earning sufficient income. Her son can troubleshoot mobiles and he sells accessories, such as charger, body, data cable etc and provides the recharge facilities for different networks.

Nowadays the demand increases for mobile accessories and for recharge and sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest in his business because he already has spent his all savings on household expenses.

Therefore, Shamshad requested a loan for her son so that he is empowered to purchase additional accessories and extra credit for the recharge facility.

Shamshad thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan, over this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile's accessories for her son's mobile phone's store.

loans.name: Faxraddin

texts.en:
Faxraddin is a taxi driver. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together his wife and child in the Garband village of the Fuzuli region. Faxraddin is 52 years old. His wife is a housewife and their child is studying second course at a technical college.

This is Faxraddin’s second loan and he repaid his first loan on time. He wants to buy new tires for his taxi.

Faxraddin has applied to Komak company and he needs a loan in the amount of 1700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir, 50, is an international displaced person from the Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan. He is married with one son and two daughters. He helps his elder mother as well, who lives in a refugee settlement. He grows vegetables and fruits in the yard. He has more than five years of experience and he loves this job.

With support from his family, especially his wife, Nadir has been running quite a successful farming business. Her wife is a school teacher but helps him with great passion. He relies on his children for support as well. They help him by watering, cleaning the yard and doing other related work. They support each other very well.

Nadir runs the farm with great passion and love because he wants to take care of his family. He sells natural fruits and vegetables in the local market. In Azerbaijan, there is a great demand for vegetables to make traditional foods like dolma and bozbash and for fruit for after-dinner desserts.

Nadir is currently planning to expand the business. He requires 1,200 Azerbaijani New Manats to buy fruit trees and fertilizer for his vegetables. He hopes that Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees and fertilizer for his vegetables.

loans.name: Jenniffer Lissette

texts.es: Jenniffer es una mujer de 21 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de bisutería de acero inoxidable, actividad que lleva desarrollando dos años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive en vivienda propia desde hace 15 años junto a su grupo familiar, por lo que es muy reconocida en su comunidad. Jenniffer desea reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado como demuestra en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y evitar que la lluvia deteriore sus pertenencias.
texts.en: Jenniffer is a 21-year-old woman who makes a living by selling stainless steel jewelry, a profession which she has been developing for two years and has permitted her to move her family ahead. She has lived in her own house for 15 years together with her family relatives, for which she is the most recognized in her community. She wishes to repair the roof of her house as it is damaged, as is shown in the photograph, hence for this she requests a loan to FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the roof of her house and avoid the rain which damages her property.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling feeds and gasoline.  Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mwitemania Songa Mbele Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Gladys. She is fifty years old and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit through enterprise and financial management in order to run her business well.

She operates a cafe and wants to buy crockery for her cafe which will improve the service hence increase the customer base. She hopes for more income that will enable her pay school fees for her child.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy crockery for her cafe that will boost service for more customers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 32 year old single man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of farming, growing food crops like bananas and has been doing this for over 5 years now. He was inspired by his parents to start business and he has a vision of raising his own income and look after himself as he plans to marry in the nearby future.

David is challenged by inadequate capital hindering him from achieving his dream of completing his rentals. David is charged with the duty of looking after his family, that is his parents and other siblings.

loans.use: to buy windows and complete constructing his rental houses.

loans.name: Mehrali

texts.en:
Mehrali is a 39-year-old refugee from Bilasuvar IDP settlement. He is a highly motivated farmer who was able to get his business idea going through effort and dedication. He is taking care of his family: he helps his old parents who are retirees. Sometimes his parents come and support Mehrali in the yard with farming activities.

For the last six years, and with the goal of generating more income, he has been doing farming activities like growing vegetables and fruits. He is a very diligent and honest man. People know him as a trustworthy person. He sells them in a local bazaar and to clients in the neighbourhood. Mehrali displays his products in a shop located in the bazaar close to his home.

He is now applying for 1,200 AZN for expanding the business activity. With the growing demand for fruits and vegetables, he needs to expand. He will use the funds to buy fertilizers and new fruit trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and new fruit trees

loans.name: Ines Del Carmen

texts.es: Ines de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ines, who is 43 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She makes a living by producing and selling tortillas, which she has been doing since 10 years ago. Her business location in her home of residence, and she has many customers. With her earnings, she has managed to settle the costs of her home. She is requesting a loan to buy corn at wholesale and lime to be able to continue her production of tortillas, and hence be able to have better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
When Uzma realized the schools in her area were unable to provide her children with a high quality education, she decided to open a school herself in order to ensure her family had a bright future.

In 2011, she managed to open a school which now has over 200 students, but as the financial burden increased, she realized she would need a loan of PKR 100,000 to purchase more desks and chairs along with the computer for the students. Uzma hopes she can continue to grow the school and improve their equipment so that her children and the other students are prepared to enter universities and colleges when they graduate.

loans.use: to purchase more desks and chairs along with the computer for the students

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Jocelyn has a poultry business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fruit trees, vegetable seeds and fertilizers for the fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ulkar

texts.en:
Ulkar is a 41-year-old lady. She is an IDP who, at the moment, lives in Bilasuvar region, which is a settlement for refugee people. Ulkar is married and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her family isn't large. She is taking care of her family and also her elder parents.

Ulkar has a good reputation in the local market. At this age, she has been successful in the local bazaar. She grows some vegetables and fruits. People see her as an honest, intelligent and hard-working lady. Ulkar's job is more dependant on people who have high demand for fresh natural fruits and vegetables. There are many traditional dishes which consist of vegetables like potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes and egg-plants. People prepare dolmas,  bozbash and other meals with them.

Ulkar is a very hard-working and energetic lady. She wants to become successful and to meet the family's needs in a better way. To do this, she plans to improve her business. She is planning to buy new seeds and fertilizers. She requires a 1,800 AZN loan. KIVA lenders should support her.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина – предприниматель из Дрогобыча. Она занимается торговлей детской одежды. На данный момент Галина арендует торговую точку в местном санатории. Подобный бизнес она ведет уже 7 лет. Весь товар у Галины – качественный и добротный. Галине 48 лет, она замужем, с двумя детьми.
На 40 000 гривен Галина планирует закупить детский трикотаж, костюмчики и другую детскую одежду под реализацию на своей торговой точке. Галина знает, что детская одежда всегда пользуется спросом, поэтому и выбрала в свое время для себя именно это направление торговой деятельности. Галина планирует потом реинвестировать полученный доход в развитие бизнеса, а со временем хочет также открыть и новую торговую точку.
texts.en:
Galina is a businesswoman from Drogobych who sells children's clothing. She currently rents a storefront in a local sanatorium and has been running her business for seven years. All of Galina's goods are high-quality and durable. She is 48 years old, married, and has two children. 

Galina plans to use 40,000 hryvnia to buy children's knitwear, suits, and other clothing items to sell at her store. She knows that children's clothing is always in demand, which is why she chose this area of sales. Galina plans to reinvest the earnings from the loan in developing her business and eventually open a new retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy knitwear and other children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children; one of them is still small and the other two are in school.

She has been running two projects, selling clothes and selling drinks for four years now. She works from 7 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling clothes and to increase the drink stock, thereby meeting her customers' demands. She has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees for her two children, repay loans, reinvest in her business and cover household expenses.

Fatuma will use this loan to increase the best selling drink and clothing stocks. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group Jitahidi Msakuzi, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase the best selling drink and clothing stocks.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is a married woman with two children. She is 47 years old and both of her children are in school.

Maria Elena is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She buys and sells beauty products in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, lotion, perfumes, etc.

Maria Elena has been in business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, lotion, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Osnel

texts.fr: Osnel a 36 ans. Il est marié et a un enfant. Osnel habite à Port-au-Prince avec sa femme et leur enfant. Sans emploi, il revend des boissons énergisantes et boissons gazeuses pour pouvoir prendre soin de sa famille. Il a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock. Il souhaite économiser de l’argent pour envoyer son fils à l’université quand il sera grand.
texts.en:
Osnel is a 36 year-old married father to one child. He lives in Port-au-Prince with his family.

Currently unemployed, he sells soft drinks and energy drinks to support his family. He is seeking this loan to bolster his stock.

Osnel wants to save money to finance his son's university studies when the time comes.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages.

loans.name: Emilia Paulina

texts.en:
Emilia, 54, is the mother of four sons, three who are grown men with families of their own. Her 17-year-old son still relies on her and attends school. Her husband passed away a long time ago. Her biggest accomplishment has been to move ahead with her family as a widow. She describes herself as a person who never gives up. She claims she will always do what it takes for her family.

Emilia has been working at a stand, selling candies and fries among other products, a business she started 15 years ago, when her husband lost an arm through an accident at work. At that time, she had nothing but a small table on which she placed her products to sell. Today, she owns a much bigger stand. She is looking for a loan of 10,000 Mexican pesos to buy merchandise to sell. She is pictured here, at her stand, with some of her grandsons while waiting for clients.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Pirum

texts.en:
Pirum, 19, was an outstanding student when he was in high school. He is from the Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Currently, he is studying at a university in the city to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Information Technology.

Due to a shortage of financial support, Pirum would like to request a loan to pay the university fees for his first to fourth year. With this loan, he will be able to graduate and earn skills for his future job. When he finishes his bachelor's degree, Pirum is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary and he will be able to build a proper house for his family.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for his first to fourth year.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана живет и работает в городе Першотравенске. На местном рынке она арендует у администрации площадь для двух торговых точек, а также работает в собственных магазинах, реализуя стройматериалы, сантехнику и обои. Таким бизнесом она занимается уже 12 лет. Оксане 39 лет, она замужем и у нее есть 18-летняя дочь.
Оксана хочет вложить 80 000 гривен в закупку товара для новой торговой точки по продаже стройматериалов. Несмотря на экономическую ситуацию в стране, Оксана не только не сдалась, но и смогла расширить свой бизнес, что планирует делать и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Oksana lives and works in Pershotravensk. She leases two storefronts from the administration of the local market and works in her own stores selling building materials, bathroom fixtures, and wallpaper. She has been in the business for 12 years already. Oksana is 39 years old, married, and has an 18-year-old daughter.

Oksana wants to invest 80,000 hryvnia in purchasing goods for a new store selling building materials. In spite of the economic situation in Ukraine, Oksana did not just refuse to give up, she was also able to expand her business, which she plans to continue to do in the future.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of construction materials

loans.name: Nery Erodita

texts.es: Nery de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de pescado de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas pescado por mayor ya que le va muy bien en sus ventas y asi podra tener mejores ingresos economicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nery, who is 34 years old, lives in her own house with her relatives. She has made a living for 20 years by selling fish as a street vendor in different neighbourhoods which are close to her house. She has many clients because of her good prices. With what she gains from her sales, she has managed to settle some costs of her house. She is asking again for a loan to buy more fish wholesale, as her business is going very well, and hence she will be able to have better economic income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fish wholesale.

loans.name: Olga Esperanza

texts.es: Doña olga de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda economicamente, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes y es gracias a su trabajo y ayuda de su hijo que es como ha logrado salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Olga is 61 years old and lives in her own house with her child who works and helps her economically.  She has worked for ten years in the production and sale of tortillas.  Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers.  It is thanks to her work and her child's help that she has managed to move forward with the expenses that her home presents.  She is requesting a loan to buy maize by the quintal [a regional unit of approximately 100 pounds] and lime to be able to continue producing tortillas and in this way have a better income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: maize by the quintal [a regional unit of approximately 100 pounds] and lime.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz, 32, is a refugee. He lives in a refugee settlement called Bilasuvar, in the south part of Azerbaijan. He resides with his family, including his father and mother. He has a college education and uses this knowledge in his daily farming activities.

Mubariz has studied agricultural subjects. To provide a good income for his family, he is involved in agriculture. Mubariz started his business eight years ago and has good experience. He has six cows and 14 sheep. He raises calves, fattens them and sells their meat at the local bazaar. He keeps these animals on his own land.

There is a big demand for meat in Azerbaijan. People consume a lot of meat. Most of the traditional dishes, like kebabs, kufta and rice, consist of meat. Mubariz has requested a loan for 1,200 Azerbaijani New Manats to buy sheep for fattening and subsequent resale. Mubariz intends to channel his earnings toward developing his business and improving family conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and subsequent sale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Emma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith works hard to support her family. Faith is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Faith requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paints, etc.

Faith has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income. In the future, Faith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paints, etc.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is 48 years old and married, with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, coffee, etc. to sell.

Fanny has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, noodles, soap, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, etc. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, junk foods, juices and other groceries.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, vive en casa familiar con su compañero de vida y un hijo de 4 años, él abastece a su familia de alimentación, vestuario y otros, su manera de generar los ingresos familiares es: cultivar maíz, arroz y frijoles, está desempeñando dicha actividad desde hace 9 años con un horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde.
Invertirá en abono, semilla mejorada e insecticidas para lograr que sus cultivos le den mejores cosechas, podrá seguir trabajando sin problemas y con todo lo necesario a su alcance.
Su finalidad es tener un negocio más grande en su localidad y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Juan lives in his family house with his life partner and a 4-year-old son. He provides his family with food, clothing and other things. His manner of generating family income is by cultivating corn, rice, and beans. He has been doing this work for 9 years, with a schedule from seven in the morning to three in the afternoon. He will invest this loan in fertilizers, better seeds, and insecticides to enable his crops to give him better harvests. He will be able to keep working without problems, with everything necessary within his reach. His final goal is to have a bigger business in his locality, and to move forward with his family.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizers, better seeds, and insecticides to enable his crops to give him better harvests.

loans.name: Josie

texts.fr: Jeune entrepreneure très dynamique, Josie 47 ans, fait le commerce de matériels ménagers.  Elle revend chaudron, casserole, couvre-plat, etc. Grace aux revenus gagnés de cette activité, elle arrive à bien prendre soin de sa famille et payer les frais scolaires de ses quatre enfants. Elle utilise le microcrédit pour pouvoir toujours augmenter ses stocks à temps.
texts.en: Josie, age 47, is a very dynamic businesswoman who sells housewares such as pots and pans, plate covers, etc. The income earned through this activity allows her to look after her family and to pay the tuition for her 4 children. She uses microcredits to be able to replenish her stock of merchandises when necessary.

loans.use: to buy housewares.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 54 years old with 2 children ages 13 and 11 years old.

Merlinda operates her sari-sari store to help her husband, a machine operator, in supporting their family needs. Merlinda sells vinegar, soy sauce and other condiments in her community. She wanted to add more items to her store to generate more income to help her family, but due to lack of capital she cannot do so.

Merlinda is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to buy sugar, noodles, coffee, canned goods and other items to sell at her store.

Merlinda is hoping to improve her store and add more items in the future to help her family more and to help with her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles, coffee, canned goods and other items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Châu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Châu is 51 years old and she is married with one child.

She has had a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, and other general items for eight years.

Châu lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Châu faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

This is Châu's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the 26 Minh Hải Minh Lộc, which consists of three members.

With her business profits, Châu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 54-year-old married woman and has five children. One of her children is still attending school. Her husband is a farmer, and he grows and sells rice.

For many years now, Felicitas has earned a living by making atsuete (annatto) seeds, which are used for coloring, and sometimes flavoring in some cuisines. Aside from this, she also raises and sells hogs in order to earn supplemental income and cater to the needs of her family.

Felicitas decided to join CEVI in order to boost her atsuete business. She requested a loan to buy more annatto seeds and empty bottles. In this way, she can cope with demands and continue to improve her business. This could help enhance her source of income and slowly enable her to settle her obligation.

Fellicitas is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to continue to support the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy more annatto seeds and empty bottles

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has kept a chicken coop near her house in Badian, Cebu. As a married woman with seven children, she is always on the lookout for a chance to earn a living. She raises native chicken and sells them in the market for a profit.

She is asking a loan to buy feed for the chicken and wood to repair her chicken coop. Alma is determined to make her business successful so she can send her children to school. They are aged one to fourteen.

Alma plans to expand her business so that her family can live in comfort and abundance.

loans.use: to buy feed and wood

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 45 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

Joy works hard to provide for her family. She sells tupperware products in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional tupperware products to sell.

Joy has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her tupperware product business for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling herbal medicine.

Joy aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional tupperware products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elsa

texts.en:
Ma. Elsa is 55 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, chips, candies, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ma. Elsa has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, chips, candies, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Yolanda

texts.en:
Ma. Yolanda is 44 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Yolanda requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Yolanda has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Yolanda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Marie is 54 years old and has one child in school.

Ana Marie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items to resell, such as eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell, such as eggs, beverages, home products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jorry

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jorry works hard to support his family.

He has a furniture-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Jorry is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to  purchase additional wood, nails, and other materials needed for his furniture-making business.

Jorry has been sustaining his business activities through his past 16 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood, nails, and other materials needed for his furniture-making business

loans.name: Chanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanh, born in 1983, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband and her two sons, and they live in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her two sons are both obedient and good at learning at primary school.

Her family lives mainly based on cultivation, so the annual income after deducting costs is just enough to cover food for the family and to save a small amount. She wants to invest more in her children’s education and prepare money to pay for the second term of the school year, but there is still not enough to be paid. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time and she hopes that the loan amount will help her two sons have better conditions for learning and that they will have a bright future.

loans.use: to invest more in her children’s education

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
Nimol, age 21, is a young mother of a dependent daughter who is under the age for school. She lives in Kampong Cham province, where she has been growing rice and working for others for a fee to make a living. The challenge to her rice growing business is insect pests chewing the rice crop severely.

She is now leading a group of four members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. The past loan has enabled her to better support her family and renovate her house. As the group leader, Nimol will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She hopes that she can harvest abundant rice yields to support a living and send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland so that she can get abundant rice yields to send her daughter to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Felipina

texts.en:
Felipina is 38 years old with 3 children all doing their schooling.

Felipina operates her carinderia (eatery) to help generate income since her husband can barely support their family expenses as a welder.

Felipina carinderia (eatery) is popular because its located in a stall front of their street. She wanted to expand to add more menu items to increase her income, especially now that one of her children is in college.

Felipina is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and spices for additional menu items for her customers.

Felipina is hoping to expand and improve her business in the future to save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and spices for additional menu items for her customers

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, born in 1976, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman, currently living with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is doing farming, so the income after each harvest is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a very small amount.

She wants to raise a sow to get additional income for the family, but she does not have enough capital to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in this breeding purpose.

She hopes the loan amount will help her family invest in the breeding with high productivity, and next year the breeding model will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise a sow.

loans.name: Nelby

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelby se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo el Sr. Félix, trabajan en la agricultura hace 5 años en los terrenos agrícolas de su padre del Sr. Félix, cultivan zanahoria y papa en pequeñas parcelas. ambos tienen un hijo dependiente de sus ingresos. En la comunidad donde trabajan los terrenos cuentan con riego para la producción agrícola, pero por falta de recursos económicos a la Sra. Nelby y su esposo no les alcanza el dinero para comprar mayor cantidad de semillas y abonos para de esa manera cultivar en mayor cantidad, puesto que lo que cultivan solo les alcanza para el sustento de su familia, a veces los señores tienen que trabajar de jornaleros en otros terrenos. 
El esposo de la Sra. Nelby también se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil cuando termina la temporada de cosecha y siembra. Por estos motivos mencionados la Sra. Nelby necesita el préstamo para poder comprar semilla de papa y abono orgánicos y así poder sembrar en mayor cantidad y mejorar su economía y un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Nelby works in agriculture together with her husband Felix. They have worked in agriculture for five years in Felix's father's fields, growing carrots and potatoes in small parcels. Both have a child dependent on their income. In the community where they work, the fields have agricultural irrigation, but because of a lack of economic resources Nelby and her husband don't have enough money to buy a larger quantity of seeds and fertilizers for this larger-scale cultivation. Given that what they grow is only enough to support their family, sometimes the men have to work as day laborers in other fields.

Nelby's husband works as a bricklayer assistant after the harvest and sowing seasons. Because of the mentioned reasons, Nelby needs the loan to be able to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer to be able to plant in larger quantities and better her economic situation and and her child's future.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer to be able to plant in larger quantities and better her economic situation and her child's future.

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is 45 years old and married with three children. Analita works very hard to provide for them.

Analita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to resell, such as canned goods, junk foods, home care product and other groceries.

Analita has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Analita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to resell, such as canned goods, junk foods, home care product and other groceries.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 40 years old and married with two children.

Annalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to resell, such as biscuits, junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Annalyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and earns an income from bicycle transport.

Annalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to resell, such as biscuits, junk foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Mary Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a "buy-and-sell" frozen products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Mary Rosie is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like hot dogs, tocino (cured pork), chorizo, ham, etc. to sell.

Mary Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like hot dogs, tocino (cured pork), chorizo, ham, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old with five children; the oldest is 35 and the youngest is 15.

Nenita used to work in a foundation giving education to underprivileged communities. Nenita left her work to take care of her son, who was diagnosed with a serious illness. They needed financial to support for his medication and treatment. To help generate an income, Nenita sold home products such as soap bars, fabric conditioner and dishwashing liquid, at first to her neighbors. The products came from the manufacturer, and she bought at a much lower price. She sells it also at a low price, and through that, she gained a lot of customers; most of them are small grocery store (sari-sari) stores.

Now Nenita is delivering her home products to her customers near her community and wanted to expand and deliver a much larger stock to a wider area, but she has limited capital.

Nenita is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to buy 50 kilos of soap bars, 50 kilos of fabric conditioner and 50 kilos of dishwashing liquid as additional stock to sell and deliver to her customers.

Nenita wants to expand her business more to increase her income so she can continuously support her child's treatment and medication.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilos of soap bars, 50 kilos of fabric conditioner, and 50 kilos of dishwashing liquid to sell and deliver to her customers.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn is 32 years old, with one child.

Cherrylyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Cherrylyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from "buy-and-sell" ready-to-wear.

Cherrylyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 23 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré en juin 2011. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui sont solidaires et très dynamiques. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
BASSINE debout à droite de la photo et levant la main  gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est  âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 garçons et 4 filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce de mil qu'elle achète dans son village et revend dans un marché hebdomadaire prés de sa localité. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Avec le prêt elle compte acheter 300 kilogrammes de mil dans son village qu'elle va revendre à 225 FCFA le kilogramme.
les bénéfices récoltés serviront d'une part à investir dans l'aviculture et d'autre part épargner au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This 23-member group belongs to the village finance association inaugurated in June 2011. It gathers women from the same village and neighboring areas. They help one another and are very active. Most of them work in trade and animal fattening.

Bassine, standing to the right with her left hand raised in the picture, is the group's featured borrower. She is fifty years old, married, and mother to three boys and four girls. She works in the retail of millet; she purchases in her village and resells at a nearby weekly market. She has a good amount of experience in this domain.

With the loan, she plans to purchase 300 kilos of millet in her village; she will resell it for 225 XOF per kilo. Profits made will be used on the one hand to invest in bird farming and on the other hand to increase her savings in the village finance association.

loans.use: buy 300 kilos of millet.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a boarding house rental. Aileen is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 35-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives a rickshaw in Lahore city which is a very populated area.

A few days ago he had a road accident. When he was looking for a passenger, standing beside the road, a speeding car hit the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any injury but the rickshaw’s body was seriously damaged and needed replacement with a new one. He wants to replace the rickshaw body with a new one, but does not have enough cash in hand to fix it.

Therefore, Jameela has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy an auto rickshaw body and he can drive smoothly again.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services, so he can repair it after accidental damage.

loans.name: Nien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nien, 35 years old, has been participating in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since the year 2006. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is breeding and cultivation, so their income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to buy a breeding cow, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family to have a good breeding cow, and that next year, the breeding cow will bring her family a calf.

loans.use: to buy a breeding cow.

loans.name: Jessica Yuriana

texts.es: Jessica de 19 años es una joven enérgica, alegre y emprendedora, que aprendió a elaborar muñecas cuando apenas era una niña, sus padres fundaron una microempresa de juguetes en material PVC y ella observaba todo el proceso productivo, empíricamente fue realizando sus primeras creaciones para sí misma; muñecas de los personajes animados de su preferencia.  Hace dos años sus padres le entregaron la administración de la microempresa puesto que está cursando estudios en Contaduría Pública y aunque todavía le encanta participar en la elaboración de las muñecas, cuenta con un gran criterio para realizar inversiones con excelentes resultados.  Como se aproxima la temporada decembrina, deberán estar preparados para el incremento de pedidos que le realizarán las misceláneas y personas particulares que ofertan estos juguetes; Jessica realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar PVC, telas, cabello artificial y pinturas, con las que realizará su nueva producción. Jessica sueña con ampliar la capacidad instalada del negocio y adquirir una vivienda con bodega.
texts.en:
Jessica, 19, is an energetic, happy and enterprising young woman. She learned to make dolls when she was just a child. Her parents established a small business of toys made of PVC and she observed all of the production process, empirically making her first creations for herself, which were dolls of animated characters of her choice. Two years ago, her parents handed over the administration of the small business to her, given that she is studying Public Accounting. Although she still loves to participate in the production of the dolls, she has a great sense of judgement to make investments with excellent results. 

As December is growing closer, they should be prepared for the increase in orders from general stores and individuals that offer these toys. Jessica has made a loan request, a credikiva, to become rooted in her financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has made the loan request to purchase PVC, fabric, artifical hair and paint, with which she will carry out a new production. Jessica dreams of expanding the installed capacity of the business and acquiring a home with a storeroom.

loans.use: to buy PVC, fabric, artificial hair and paint.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a "buy-and-sell" fruits business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell.
Rebecca has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from "buy-and-sell" dried fish.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell

loans.name: Phieu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phieu, born in 1966, is a Thai ethnic woman currently living with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and a child of her son's, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from agricultural work, but the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She wants to raise pigs to get additional income for the family, but she does not have enough money to buy breeding pigs and foods for these pigs.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, and next year the herd will bring her family a considerable profit. For herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong is a 36-year-old woman of Thai ethnicity. She currently lives with her husband and her three daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and to save a small amount. Phuong wants to repair her house because it is not good to stay in but she does not have enough money to buy building materials. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Phuong will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan will help her family have a spacious house with better living conditions for all members.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Sindiso

texts.en:
Sindiso (44) is married and has two children (21 and 15 years). Her diligence and perseverance is an inspiration not only to her children but her community as well. She is respected and loved all over the neighborhood having built her business from a small container shop to a retail store selling everything from groceries to fruits, fresh vegetables and even providing public phone services.

She is requesting for a loan to further expand her product range. "It's summer now and people want ice cream to cool off" she says, laughing. She wants to buy an ice cream machine, a photocopy machine and to repair 2 of the public phones so that people who cannot afford to travel back home can call their families over the holidays.

She aspires to grow her store into a supermarket and wants to open a butchery as well in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a copier machine, repair public phones, Ice cream machine, and buy general grocery stock

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 39 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Christine works very hard to provide for them.

Christine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Christine has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Christine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 54 years old and married with five children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Estrella has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now, she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Estrella aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Genelyn is 43 years old now.

Genelyn has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Genelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as vegetables, sugar, etc.

Genelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Genelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as vegetables, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu is a woman of Kinh ethnic majority. She joined M7-MFI’s program in 2007. Her family consists of four members; including her husband, her son, and her daughter. The family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her meager civil servant salary, so it is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She wants to buy building materials to repair her house but she does not have enough money to do it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Thu will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan will help her family in repairing the house to make it more spacious and more beautiful.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Jennifer
