texts.en:
Jennifer is 35 years old and married with six children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jennifer has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling mineral water.

Jennifer aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 39 years old and lives with her husband and children in a small town close to a village. She has been running a small school for 13 years.. There are 148 students in her school out of which 51% are female. Nasreen aims to expand her school in future and wants to focus on female education. Adamant to change the status of her poverty stricken community and the areas around it Nasreen plans to open an additional branch as well.

When asked about the major challenges that she is faced with as a school owner Nasreen mentioned that student enrollment fluctuates as parents are mostly looking out for low fee rates, while compromising on the quality component of schools. However she keeps engaging with parents to inform them of the importance of allowing their children to remain in the same school, as this has an impact on the child's learning.

Recently she has requested for a loan worth Rs 60,000 to purchase new furniture for the school

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her school.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Liberty has a food vending business in the Philippines. Liberty requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

Liberty has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Liberty would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Patricia Yamilet

texts.es: Patricia de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, etc. que vende en su casa y también de manera ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, plátanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración ya que con el prestamo anterior pudo comprar mas ingredientes y asi ha podido tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Patricia is 31 years old. She lives in her own home with her life partner and her two daughters. She works making and selling snacks, such as: fried potatoes, fried yuca and empanadas, etc. that she sells from her home and also by walking near her home. Thanks to the sales that she completed she has been able to pay for the expenses of her home. Patricia is seeking a new loan to purchase the products that she uses to make her snacks, such as: oil, potatoes, bananas and all of the other ingredients for making them.  She was able to purchase more ingredients with her earlier loan and consequently she was able to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase oil, potatoes, banana and all of the ingredients she needs.

loans.name: Maria Marina

texts.es: Doña Maria de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda en su casa de habitación desde hace 10 años en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Su deseo es ampliar su tienda con el fin de mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos ya que desea dar a su familia mejores condiciones. Por lo anterior solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: huevos, cereales, golosinas, aceite, macarrones, detergente, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maria is 59 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has run a store from her home for 10 years in which she sells a variety of staple groceries. She wishes to grow her store with the goal of improving her sales and income as she wants to provide better living conditions for her family. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy products for her store such as: eggs, grains, candy, cooking oil, cookies, detergent, etc, so that she can have better income.

loans.use: to buy eggs, grains, candy, cooking oil, cookies, detergent,  etc. c

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa resides in Badian, Cebu. Two years ago, she started her sari-sari (variety store) business to cater to the needs of people in her community. She sells basic household grocery items, such as bath soap, detergent, matches, kerosene, sugar, cooking oil, soy sauce and snacks. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory.

With this loan, she will buy additional stock of chips, canned food, seasonings, condiments, shampoo and bath soap. By buying in bulk, she can be assured of higher earnings. She plans to manage her business well to further expand, save and reinvest in the same business. She is also determined to send her two children, aged 13 and 17, to school.

loans.use: to buy chips, canned food, seasonings, condiments, shampoo and bath soap.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Cristina is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as sugar, bananas, etc.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as sugar, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorena is 45 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Lorena has a fruti vending business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jaqueline Dolores

texts.es: Dolores tiene 32 años de edad es madre soltera de cuatro hijos Edwin de 14, Gisela de 9, Evelyn de 6 años de edad estudian en unidades educativas gratuitas del sector para hacerlo tuvieron que dejar la montaña y buscar donde vivir en la comunidad, Alexander tiene 3 meses permanece junto a su madre que se dedica hace diez años atrás  a la crianza de pollos este pequeño negocio le ha permitido pagar los gastos de alimentación, educación y vivienda de su familia. Dolores necesita el dinero para construir un galpon para pollos evitando que se pierdan estando dispersos, aumentaría sus ingresos para continuar cubriendo los principales gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Dolores is a 32 year old single mother with four children; Edwin is 14, Gisela is 9, and Evelyn is 6. They attend local free public schools. To do this they had to leave the mountain region and find a place to live in the community. Alexander who is three months old stays with his mother who for the last ten years has made a living rearing chickens.This small business has provided an income to pay for food, education and accommodation for her family. Dolores' chickens are scattered about so she needs the loan to build a chicken shed so the chickens don't get lost. The loan will allow her to increase her income so she can continue to meet her children's expenses.

loans.use: to build a chicken shed.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van, a Thai ethnic woman, has been participating in the M7-Microfinance Institution program since 2013. Her family comprises four members. She lives with her husband and her two children -- one son and one daughter -- in the Mai Son district of Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is in cultivation and breeding. The family has more than one hectare of land for cultivating coffee. The income from harvesting coffee is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and save a small amount. She wants to build a house with room for the whole family but she does not have enough money to buy building materials. Therefore, she wants a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to earn the money to repay this loan from M7-MFI on time, and she hopes this loan will give her family a new spacious house.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is 23 years old and lives in a rural area of Banteay Meanchey province. She a married mother of a child who is not old enough to attend school.

The primary source of her family’s income is from raising piglets. She has been doing this for three years. Chantha also earns additional income via working for others for a fee to improve her living conditions.

Chantha's business has not been growing well. Her piglets got sick and she was unable to sell them at a higher price as before. Therefore, she is leading a two-member group to take a loan in order to save her business. This will be the first loan for Chantha and her group member, Sopheak.

With this loan, Chantha will buy more piglets and pig feed to support her business. She hopes that her pigs will grow well so that she can sell them at a good price. Then, Chantha can earn more money and she will be able to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed to support her pig-raising business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thabor Group

texts.en:
Bounlam and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

Bounlam and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Bounlam and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Bounlam and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.

Bounlam is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nonsomboon Group

texts.en:
Kham’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Kham and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets.

Kham and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

The filter is guaranteed for two years, and within these two years, filter users like Kham’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Santos Salvador

texts.es: Santos es un hombre trabajador de 41 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y su hija de 11 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando. Él muestra cada día su deseo de salir adelante, por lo que desde hace 18 años presta sus servicios en un centro educativo como mantenimiento. Santos desea construir una pared en su vivienda, la cual le permita brindar mayor protección a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared que brinde protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking 41 year old man, who lives in a house he owns, with his wife and 11 year old daughter, who is in school. Every day he demonstrates his desire to get ahead. For 18 years he has worked in maintenance at an educational center.

Santos wants to build a wall at his house, which will allow him to provide greater protection to his family. For that reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to construct a will that will provide protection to his family.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to construct a wall to provide protection for his family.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es: Evelin de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas que realiza es como puede solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Evelin is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her three children. She has worked selling clothing for three years. The business is located in her place of residence and she also sells itinerantly in the various neighborhoods. With the profits she gets from her sales she is able to pay some of the household expenses. She is once again requesting a loan to buy more clothing for women and men wholesale to continue with her sales and have greater income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for women and men wholesale.

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en:
After taking a loan, Ni Kadek and the Sari Wangi Ternak group can repay their loan on time. During six months of pig maintenance, Ni Kadek can enjoy satisfactory results.

Ni Kadek uses her net gain from the overall sales of pigs for children's education, and for their families. The group hopes to continue their loans for the second time. They give their thanks to the lenders, Kiva, and MUK for supporting their business.

Now, Ni Kadek has a new activity. Besides her work as a pig breeder, she also busies herself as a farmer, planting chilis in her garden. With this work, Ni Kadek has a higher income.

The pig breeding process has been going well without any obstacles. One advantage of raising pigs is that she can use them for everyday family needs.

Ni Kadek wants to increase her business by keeping additional local pigs for pig barbecues. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and pig feed. The pigs for pig barbecues are usually only keep for two to three months before selling. Her husband supports her business by helping her feed the pigs and clean the cages. Ni Kadek saves her profit because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, es una señora soltera, en su juventud ejerció la profesión de maestra, actualmente ya se ha jubilado y recibe una pequeña pensión, tiene dos hijos, uno de los cuales vive ven en España, actualmente ella para poder cubrir todos sus gastos atiende una venta de variedad de bebidas y un chalet en el que ofrece a sus clientes comida rápida, golosinas, etc., su negocio lo fundo hace un año y le ayuda una nuera a atenderlo, su horario de trabajo es de nueve de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Solicita un financiamiento en Padecomsm para pagar la remodelación del local del negocio, trabajará en un lugar con mayor comodidad y sus clientes apreciaran una mejor imagen del establecimiento, considera que así sus ventas e ingresos aumentarán.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio más grande, resarcir su deuda y tener un patrimonio para ofrecerles una mejor vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single woman. She worked as a teacher when she was younger and now is retired and receives a small pension. She has two children, one of whom lives in Spain. Now, she is able to cover all of her expenses, helped by selling various beverages and a cottage in which she offers quick food, sweets, etc. She started her business one year ago and a daughter-in-law helps to staff it. Her work schedule is from nine in the morning to five in the evening.

She is requesting financing from Padecomsm to remodel her business. She will work in a more comfortable place and her customers will appreciate the establishment's better image, considering that like this her sales and income will increase. Her aspirations are to have a larger business, pay her debt, and have the assets to offer her family group a better life.

loans.use: to pay to remodel her place of business.  She will work in a more comfortable place and her customers will appreciate the establishment's better image.

loans.name: Leydis Patricia

texts.es:
Leydis, es una mujer casada que vive junto a sus esposo y sus dos hijos; ella se dedica a la crianza y al destazo de cerdos, aparte de eso ella tiene una pequeña tienda y también realiza el oficio de sastrería, ella comenta que este negocio lo comenzó al ver la necesidad de proveer lo necesario a su familia.
El crédito lo invertirá en comprar cerdos pequeños para incrementar su inventario además de hacerle algunas mejoras al corral, esto le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio y a tender a nuevos clientes.
Leydis tiene muchas aspiraciones y una de ellas es mejorar su negocio para poder darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Leydis is a married woman who lives with her husband and her two children. She works raising and butchering pigs and she has a small store and also works as a tailor. She says that she started this business when she saw the need to provide for her family.
She will use the loan to buy small pigs and to make some improvements to the sty. This will help her to strengthen her business and to cater for new customers.
Leydis has many aspirations and one of these is to improve her business so that she can give her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy small pigs to increase her inventory and to make some improvements to the sty.

loans.name: Sengey

texts.en:
Sengey is a 20-year-old single student who is from the Kandal Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in nursing, and is in her second year at a university in the city.

Her family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue. Because Sengey is short of finances to cover her tuition fees from the second to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, Sengey will be able to cover her university fees and earn skills to achieve her future goal. In the future, she hopes to run her own clinic and build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to cover her tuition fees from the second to the fourth year

loans.name: Felicita De Maria

texts.es: Doña Felicita de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 21 años y gracias a las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos para su tienda como: más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Felicita is 61 years old and lives in her own house along with her daughter. She has run a store from her home for more than 21 years and, thanks to the profits that she makes, has been able to cover some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more products for her store such as: more soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, candy, cakes, etc. This will give her a better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store such as: soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, candy, cakes, etc.

loans.name: Huana Group

texts.en: Lerm’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Lerm and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Lerm and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within these two years, filter users like Lerm’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thongnameetai Group

texts.en:
Archong understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Archong knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter he purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Archong is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es: El  sr. Elio es una persona que siempre ha querido salir adelante el entro a la universidad y ahí fue donde le conoció a su esposa ellos enamoraron poco tiempo hasta que tuvieron a su hijo que lamentablemente nació con un retraso infantil, el al enterarse de esta situación de su hijo dejo la universidad y comenzó a trabajar para su hijo que necesitaba de muchos tratamientos y medicamentos de igual manera su esposa dejo la universidad para poder atender a su hijo ellos solo estuvieron un año en la universidad, ya que por la situación de su hijo ya no pudieron estudiar, el sr. Elio tampoco tuvo el apoyo de sus papas moralmente y peor aun económicamente, mientras que sus papas de su esposa no pueden ayudar porque son de bajos recursos, el sr. Elio comenzó a trabajar en metal mecánica y también hizo un curso en este rubro para mejorar sus ingresos y así poder ayudar a su familia el señor ELio necesita el préstamo para la compra de más equipos como ser cierra circular esmeril prensa torno y otros para aumentar su producción
texts.en:
Elio is a person who has always wanted to succeed. He entered the university and met his wife there. They fell in love and in little time had their son who unfortunately was born with a childhood disability. Upon encountering this situation with his son, Elio left the university and began to work for the benefit of his son who needed many treatments and medications. Similarly, his wife left the university to care for her son. They were both in their first year at the university. Now, because of the situation with their son, they cannot study. Elio also did not have the support of his parents morally and even less economically, while the parents of his wife were not able to help because they have few resources.

Elio began to work as a metal machinist and he completed a course in this trade to improve his earnings. This is how he is able to help his family. Elio needs the loan to purchase more tools, such as a circular saw, a grinding wheel, a lathe and other items to increase his production.

loans.use: to purchase tools, such as circular saw, grinding wheel and a lathe so that he can earn more income for his family.

loans.name: Lahakhok Group

texts.en:
Xom understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Xom knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Xom purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Xom is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonsaward Group

texts.en:
Niyom understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Niyom knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Niyom purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing the money spent to buy charcoal, or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Niyom is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonmoungkhoun Group

texts.en:
Latee and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. Latee and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease.

After totaling up the costs, Latee and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Latee and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years.

Latee is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 50-year-old married mother with three children. She lives in Takeo province of Cambodia. She is a farmer who cultivates rice and fattens animals. One of her children is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a 73-year-old construction worker. Together, they can earn approximately 14 USD per day.

To improve her family’s finances, Ly would like to request a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to resell. This loan will help her earn more income to improve her family’s standard of living. For her future plans, Ly is going to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to resell.

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: Astrid de 51 años es una madre de familia amorosa y entregada que levantó su hogar con el fruto de su trabajo, ella estuvo empleada como representante de ventas en laboratorios y distribuidora de producto de belleza durante 30 años y con toda la experiencia que había adquirido y muchos deseos de mejorar sus ingresos, tomó la determinación de iniciar su propio negocio de venta directa de estos productos.  Con su liquidación adecuó su almacén con vitrinas exhibidoras de productos de peluquería como tintes, tratamientos, decolorantes, acondicionadores, queratinas, cremas de peinar, gel, laca, también incluyó una variada gama de accesorios para el cabello que le generan una buena utilidad. Actualmente necesita realizar compras de cosméticos y tintes para cabello, puesto que la temporada más alta en ventas del año se aproxima, para ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo e invertir en nuevo surtido.  La meta de Astrid es lograr costear toda la carrera que está cursando su hija y en su negocio trasladarse a un local más amplio para manejar un mayor surtido.
texts.en:
51-year old Astrid is a loving and devoted mother who supports the family through her work as a laboratory sales representative and distributor of beauty products. She's done this work for 30 years and with all this experience and a desire to increase her income, she decided to start her own business selling the products directly.

With her severance pay Astrid installed display cases in her premises. These allowed her to display hair products such as dyes, treatments, lightening agents, conditioners, keratin, detangling products, gel, hairspray, and a wide range of hair accessories which generate a good profit.

Now Astrid needs to buy cosmetics and hair colors as the most important season for these services is approaching. For this reason she is seeking a loan from Kiva, giving her the opportunity to participate in the financial system through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundatiion by buying new stock.

Astrid's goals are to be able to pay for the whole of her daughter's professional training and to expand her business premises where she can display more stock.

loans.use: buy cosmetics and hair colors

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 44-years-old married woman, living in Lahore, Pakistan and mother of five children. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband, he has the only single source of income.

He owns a workshop in which he makes the rickshaws bodies by using welding material, iron rods and nylon sheets. He also provides the services to paint and assembled the bodies of auto rickshaws. He removes the dents over rickshaw’s body and paint for renewal.
He wants to reduce his shortage of raw materials and wants to buy stock of iron rods, raw material for welding, repairing tools and nylon sheets. He wants to generate maximum income but does not have any other source of income. He wants to invest some capital in current enterprise so he can earn money for his family.

Therefore, Samina has requested a Kiva loan, so her husband can buy desired inventories for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy welding's raw material, nylon sheets and repairing tools for her husband's rickshaw repairing workshop.

loans.name: Yuri Sirley

texts.es: Yuri tiene 27 años de edad es madre soltera de una pequeña niña de 4 años de edad Ingrid permanece junto a su madre que se dedica a la crianza de pollos, todos los días viernes sale a vender en la pequeña feria del lugar donde viven. Yuri necesita el dinero para comprar un congelador ya que el que tiene  no funciona y el intenso calor hace que el pollo de descomponga rápidamente  así obtendría mayor ingreso para seguir cubriendo los gastos de alimentación y vivienda de ella y su pequeña niña.
texts.en: Yuri is 27 years old. She is a single mother of a little girl who is 4 years old, Ingrid. Ingrid lives together with her mother who works raising chickens. Every Friday she leaves to sell them in the small fair located where they live. Yuri needs the money to purchase a freezer because the one that they have does not work and the intense heat makes the chicken decompose quickly. Through this purchase they would be able to obtain better earnings to continue covering the expenses of food and housing for Yuri and her small daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for chickens.

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is 27 years old, lives in Zarqa, a married man without children. He could not complete his education because of the financial situation for his family, therefore he did ‎not has a stable income to him, so he decided to open his own business and start to save money to insure a good future for his ‎coming children. He wants to provide good life and good education for them.‎

Because of the high standards of living and he is very ambitious person, he decided to open his own cell ‎phones shop, Shareef started his business 6 months ago and now he wants to complete the license for the shop and to buy ‎more cell phones to sell to increase his income and improve the standards of living for his family. For this he applied for a ‎loan and he needs your support.‎

loans.use: to complete the license for his shop and to buy ‎more cell phones to sell.

loans.name: Victor Jose

texts.es: Víctor tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos Ruth de 4 años y Jimmy  de 3 años permanecen junto a sus padres, vive en unión libre su conviviente le ayuda  a trabajar en el vivero  de plantas de café y cacao, hace 10 años atrás  se dedica a plantarlas, cuidarlas para poder venderlas obtener un poco de dinero para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, el lugar donde viven no tiene energía eléctrica, ni agua potable .Víctor necesita el dinero para poder incrementar  su producción de plantas obtendría más ingresos que le ayudarían a seguir alimentando a su familia, a futuro educando a sus hijos el aspira que su vida sea diferente con mayores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Víctor is 25 years old and has two children -- Ruth, age four, and Jimmy, age three. They stay together with their parents. He lives in a common-law marriage. His partner helps him work on the coffee and cacao farm. For ten years back, he has worked planting and cultivating them to be able to sell and obtain a little money to cover food expenses. The place where they live doesn't have electric energy or potable water.

Victor needs the money to be able to boost his production of plants and so yield more income, which will help him move his family forward, educating his children in the future. He hopes that their life might be different with better opportunities.

loans.use: to increase his farm's production.

loans.name: Isaura Gladis

texts.es: Isaura es madre soltera tiene 27 años de edad y tres hijos Mathyuri de 8, Melany de 6 estudian en una unidad educativa gratuita del sector,  Ever de  3 años permanece en un centro de cuidado gratuito de la parroquia donde viven mientras su madre  trabaja cultivando plantas frutales de naranjilla, plátano, limón, guayaba una vez que estos árboles dan fruto ella sale a vender en el mercado de su pequeño pueblo, los compradores pagan muy poco dinero por los productos indican que el costo más alto es el transporte porque es sumamente difícil el traslado a la ciudad. Isaura  necesita el dinero para  plantar  árboles de otras variedades de frutas generaria mayor ingreso ya que este es su unico  sustento  que le permite alimentar y educar a sus pequeños sus hijos.
texts.en: Isaura is a 27 year old single mother of three kids. 8 year old Mathyuri and 6 year old Melany are both in a free school, and 3 year old Ever goes to a free care center in the parish where they live. Meanwhile, their mother works cultivating fruiting plants such as naranjilla (a type of bitter orange), banana, lemon, and guayaba. Once these trees produce fruit, she sells them in the market in her little town. The buyers pay very little for the varieties mentioned because of transport costs, as it is very difficult to transport goods to the city. Isaura needs the money to plant other types of fruits that generate greater profits as this is her only income from which she feeds and educates her children.

loans.use: to plant trees of other fruit varieties.

loans.name: Bunthorn's Group

texts.en: Bunthorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Bunthorn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Winifrida

texts.en:
Winifrida, she has a fruit stall business and she is requesting a loan to build her own fruit stall and increase products. She is 23 years old and currently living with her parents in the Iringa district. She will use a loan to buy products such as potatoes, onion, tomato, small fish to sell to peoples.

She is volunteering as a Camfed learner guide, she gives time each week to mentor younger students and members through a range of personal issues She plans to use the profit she will earn to pay her school fees because she wants to redo her form four exams and reinvest in her business to help it grow. Her “social-interest” loan will be paid through Winifrida's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to build her own fruit stall and increase products

loans.name: Chakriya

texts.en:
Chakriya is 24 years old and single. She is a student from the Kratie Province in Cambodia. She is taking an English Literature major at a university in the city. In order to support her studying, she has also worked at an insurance company in the city. Being on staff, Chakriya can earn approximately $5 per day.

Chakriya is in his fourth year at the university. Since she is lacking finances to pay her tuition fees for the fourth year, she requested a loan, which will help her finish this fourth year successfully and build a better future. In the future, she plans on finding another better job with a reasonable salary, so that she will be able to build a new proper house in the city.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the fourth year for a BA in English Literature

loans.name: Mariana Alejandra

texts.es: Mariana es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 20 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en vivienda propia. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una pequeña librería familiar, la cual ha comenzado a administrar hace algunos meses. Mariana desea invertir en el negocio, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papelería y materiales para mejorar el cuarto del negocio y así ofrecer mejor servicio. Con el crédito anterior Mariana logro reparar el servicio sanitario de su hogar, por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Mariana is a hardworking 29-year old who lives with her family in their own home. She earns her living from a small family stationery store which she took over a few months ago. Mariana wishes to invest in the business so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy paper products and to renovate the premises to improve service to her customers.

With her previous loan she repaired the bathroom in her house, and she is most grateful for this.

loans.use: buy products for her stationery store and renovate the premises

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee desde hace mas de 20 años un tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia en la cual vende una variedad de productos a buenos precos por esa razon posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y asi seguir con sus ventas para poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 49 year old Jose lives in his own house with his wife and their 3 children. For over 20 years, he has run a store in his home from which he sells a variety of well-priced products. For this reason he has many customers. He has been able to cover some household expenses with the profits that he generates. He is requesting a loan to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, candy, and cake. This will allow him to continue selling and to be able to make a better income so he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, sodas, candy, cake, etc.

loans.name: Fortunata Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Fortunata es una persona muy trabajadora, y  a sus 66 años ella sigue trabajando y dedicándose a su negocio de tejido, ella  elabora ropones para bebes y ropa de niños.
Este negocio ya lo realiza varios años y con esta actividad ella sigue adelante.
Fortunata necesita el crédito para comprar lana y botones. 
La socia está muy agradecida con lo inversionista de  KIVA porque gracias a él crédito ella seguirá produciendo más y mejores ropitas.Ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower, Fortunata, is a very hardworking person. At 66 years old, she is still working and continues to dedicate herself to her knitting business. She makes clothes for babies and children. She started this business several years ago, and continues with it going forward. Fortunata needs the loan to buy wool and buttons.

The borrower is very grateful for the KIVA investment because thanks to the loan, she will continue producing more and better clothing. She promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy wool and buttons.

loans.name: Victoria Teresa

texts.es:
Victoria, es una mujer que se encuentra casada y tiene una hija de 6 años la cual depende de ella económicamente, Victoria se dedica a la venta de sopa de puya (es un plato típico de El Salvador, se hace con tripas y nervios de las patas de la res, se le agrega verduras) y bebidas, su horario de trabajo son los días lunes, viernes y sábado y lo hace desde las 10:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m.; ella cuenta con un gran ventaja, ya que en la zona donde ella reside solamente ella es quien elabora y distribuye este platillo.
Victoria solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra carnes, pollo, verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, etc., estos productos le permitirán variar el menú que le ofrece a sus clientes, con esto ella busca poder incrementar su clientela y lo podrá trabajar todos los días de la semana lo que le generara un mayor incremento en sus ganancias.
El mayor sueño de Victoria es poder darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y darle todo lo que ella necesita para su buen desarrollo.
texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with a 6-year-old daughter who depends on her economically. Victoria works in the sale of puya soup, (a typical dish in El Salvador that is made of intenstines, the cartilage of cow's legs and vegetables), and beverages. Her working hours are Mondays, Fridays and Saturdays from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. She has a great advantage, as she is the only person that makes and distributes this dish in the area she lives. 

Victoria is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of meat, chicken, vegetables, basic grains, beverages, etc. These products will allow her to vary the menu that she offers to her customers. In doing so, she seeks to expand her clientele and she will be able to work every day of the week to produce a greater increase in her earnings. Victoria's biggest dream is to be able to give her daughter a better quality of life and give her everything that she needs for a good development.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, basic grains, beverages, etc. These products will allow her to vary the menu that she offers to her customers.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
32 year old Imran belongs to a middle class family. Three years ago while deciding where to invest his savings he knew that it had to go towards a good cause. "I always wanted to make my work meaningful' says Imran who is a proud owner of a low cost school.

The school is providing education to 229 students half of which are female. While discussing difficulties faced while managing a small school, Imran discussed that private schools that charge high fees are able to deliver better education, as compared to schools of the same scale as his school. Increasing school fees is not an option as that will simply exclude many deserving children from gaining access to education.

While planning to renovate his school and get it painted he has requested for a loan worth Rs 100,000. This will improve the outlook of the school which currently needs repair and maintenance.

loans.use: to renovate his school and get it painted

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Yorn is 52 years old. She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are dependent on her and need her to support their education. To make a living, she has been growing rice for 32 years. Moreover, she has been working for others for a fee to earn additional income. Recently, her rice crop did not produce a good yield, and its price decreased in the market. These issues are the main challenges for her business.

Now, she is leading a group of two members to request a new loan to save her farming business. This is her fifth loan cycle with VisionFund; her group member is on her fourth loan cycle. Yorn completely repaid her past loans, which enabled her to better support her family's household consumption and her children’s education. Yorn will use her new loan portion to buy organic fertilizers to increase productivity of her crop yield in order to get more profits. She will use those profits to save for future needs. She wishes to expand her farming business in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to increase productivity of her crop.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Tabarak

texts.en:
Tabarak has requested to borrow Rs 150,000 to pay for repair and maintenance for the purpose of improving the general outlay of his school. His school has been operational for the past 15 years, during which time his wife (also shown in the picture) helped him immensely in the smooth running of his school.

The school is located in a peri-urban community where the majority of parents are illiterate, so Tabarak understands that students are unable to get the help that they want with their studies at home. Therefore, his school must not compromise on the teaching quality. There are 3 other schools in the community but they charge a high fees compared to Tabarak’s school.

Currently there are 211 students enrolled in the school out of which 135 are female. ‘My aim is to increase the enrollment of my school and provide quality training to my teachers so they use modern methods of teaching and do not only contribute to test scores but help children become better individuals, says Tabarak

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance for the purpose of improving the general condition of his school.

loans.name: Fredy Concepcion

texts.es:
Fredy Concepción con 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de San Felipe,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Fredy Concepción se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de lima, con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 08 años. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de productos de pan llevar como son yuca,frejol,etc, los cuáles son para consumo. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su finca en gastos de abonos y en el mantenimiento de la misma. De esta manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Fredy Concepción es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
36-year old Fredy Concepción lives with his partner and their son in the district of San Felipe, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area. For the most part local people earn their living from agriculture, business, or from raising livestock.

Freddy Concepción is a farmer who grows mainly limes, a job he's had for more than eight years. He also grows other food crops such as yucca, beans etc.

He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and provide maintainance for his farm. Then he will earn more money so that he can improve his standard of living.

He is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and maintain his farm

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila es una mujer de 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 años, trabaja como costurera en un taller. Ahora que conoce mejor el rubro desea implementar su propio taller de costura, tiene buenos conocimientos en el rubro ya que cuenta con certificados de capacitación de cursos realizados como técnico medio en el rubro que ahora se dedica. La señora cuenta con buenas espectativas ya que a ella lo que mas le motiva es salir adelante y con varias metas por realizar, quiere el préstamo para que le pueda brindar la apertura de su propio taller con las prendas que confecciona donde la mayor parte son para mujeres, actualmente trabaja en un taller como costurera.
La señora Domitila viene de una familia humilde y sobre todo trabajadora la cual esta inculcada con los valores de humildad, buena administración de recursos, respeto, con una vision de emprendimiento y alcanzar los objetivos que ella misma se traza a lo largo de su carrera técnica."
texts.en:
Domitila is a 29 year old woman who has a four year old son. She works as a seamstress in a workshop. Now that she knows the business better she wants to start her own sewing shop. She has good knowledge in the field and she has training certificates from courses she took as a technician in the field she now works in. This woman has good prospects as what motivates her most is getting ahead and she has a number of goals to achieve. She wants the loan so that she has the means to open her own workshop with clothing that she makes, the majority of which are for women. She currently is working in a shop as a seamstress.

Domitila comes from a humble but hard-working family where she was instilled with the values of humility, managing resources well and respect. She has an vision of entrepreneurship and achieving the objectives that she herself has drawn up during her technical career.

loans.use: to start a sewing workshop and sell her clothing to her clientele, in this way have greater income for her son.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries for her general store business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Segundila

texts.en:
Segundila is 60 years old and married with six children. Segundila works very hard to provide for them.

Segundila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Segundila has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Segundila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en:
Nicat is 26 years old. He is living in Bilasuvar region with his family. He has just finished his education. He loves helping his family and he also supports his old parents such as visiting them daily and taking care of the farm. He is very hard-working person and loves his job as a farmer.

He is a farmer and involved in daily farming activities. He has some cattle and raises small calves in his own yard. He usually fattens them and sell their meat in the local market. This activity he has been doing since last two years, but has seen his parents doing it for more than 10 years and gained a vast experience. People in Azerbaijan prepare traditional foods mostly with meat. Since he knows that the existing demand is high in the local bazaar, he is also planning to expand the business a little.

To meet the demand he needs to have calves fatter and buy few more cows. Currently he is planning to expand the farm. In order to expand his farming business, he requires to buy 2 more calves. For this he needs 1200 AZN. He hopes that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to buy 2 more calves

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia Mariluz tiene 30 años y ella se dedica al negocio de las pizzas, con esta actividad saca adelante a su único hijo.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar harina y así incrementar sus ganancias este fin de año por fiestas.
La socia Mariluz se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente los días acordados y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en ella, ya que le ayudaran a salir a delante.
texts.en:
Bank member Mariluz is 30 and she has a business selling pizzas. This business is how she provides for her only son.

She requested this loan to buy flour so she can increase her earnings at this year's end with the holidays.

Mariluz promises to make her payments punctually on the designated days and she thanks Kiva's lenders for their confidence in her, as they will help her get ahead.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Johara

texts.en:
Johara is 35 years old and married she works very hard to provide for family.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Johara has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Johara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Chamroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeurn, who is 25 years old, is married and blessed with two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the remaining one is under the age of school. She lives in Kampong Cham province where she and her husband have been working construction workers and harvest rice for her neighbors for a fee.
She has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and past loans have helped her improve living condition and send her child to school. In a group of two members, she is the leader and she will use her loan to buy construction materials to support her construction business. She hopes to earn more income to expand her business to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to support construction business so that she can keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana, es una joven que vive junto a sus padres y hermanos, su estado civil es soltera, no tiene hijos pero le gusta ser independiente por lo que a diario ella se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón; este oficio ella lo aprendió gracias  a sus padres, pero hace tres años ella decidió invertir en sacos de semilla y desde entonces ella trabaja por su cuenta pero siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.
Diana dice que con el crédito invertirá en la compra de semillas de marañón, leña, bolsas, etc., para poder fortalecer las ventas, ya que se acerca la temporada de diciembre y es una temporada buena, ya que vienen al país muchos turistas; ella tiene fe que esto le ayudara a poder generar mayores ingresos económicos, ya que a esta fecha la semilla de marañón se encuentra a un precio cómodo por lo que obtendrá más ganancias.
El sueño de Diana es poder tener una casa digna para poderla  compartir con su familia y tener una estabilidad económica que le permita ayudar a su familia a subsistir.
texts.en: Diana is a young woman who lives with her parents and siblings. She is single, has no children but enjoys her independence and so every day she sells cashews to make a living . She learned this business from her parents. Three years ago she decided to work for herself and purchased sacks of nuts. However she still relies on the support of her parents. Diana says that she will use the loan to buy cashews, firewood, bags, etc to boost sales in anticipation of the approaching December season; typically a good time of year because many tourists visit the country. She is confident that this will help generate more income, given the advantageous price of cashews at the moment.   Diana dreams of having a home worthy of sharing with her family and economic stability so that she can help her family survive.

loans.use: to buy cashews,  firewood, bags, etc to help boost sales

loans.name: Zoila Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zoila, comparte su vida con su esposo, tienen dos hijos pero ya han formado su hogar propio y son profesionales, su medio de subsistencia desde el año 2012 es la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene su propio puesto de venta en el mercado municipal, aprendió a trabajar en este rubro con ayuda de su madre, trabaja de lunes a viernes con un horario de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, y los domingo lo hace de siete de la mañana a doce del mediodía.
Necesita de capital para pagar el enrejado de su puesto de ventas en el mercado, con ello tendrá mejores medidas de seguridad y no correrá riesgo de que le roben la mercadería, su objetivo es sacar el mayor provecho de la inversión para resarcir su deuda sin dificultades.
Para Zoila es importante administrar bien su negocio para que continúe en el mercado y lo más importante es darle a sus seres queridos un ambiente más comfortable.
texts.en:
Zola shares her life with her husband. They have two children but they have already formed their own home and they are professionals. She has earned her livelihood since 2012 selling fruits and vegetables. She has her own stall in the municipal market. She learned this profession with the help of her mother. She works Monday through Friday from seven in the morning until four in the afternoon and on Sundays she works from seven in the morning until twelve noon.

She needs capital to pay for a security screen for her stall in the market. With this she will have greater security and she will not run the risk of having her merchandise stolen. Her goal is to get the greatest benefit from her investment to repay her debt without difficulty.

For Zoila it is important to run her business well so she can stay in the market and the most important thing is to provide her loved ones with a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to pay for a security screen for her market stall, which will provide her with greater security and eliminate the risk of her merchandise being stolen.

loans.name: Phoumchedee Group

texts.en: Khamtheang is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Khamtheang and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Khamtheang and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Khamtheang and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khamtheang and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sokhern's Group

texts.en: Sokhern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller by selling grocery to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 42yrs old married and having four children,her husband is a driver. Evelyn is an ordinary housewife that needs an extra income aside of the income of her husband, because she wants to help her husband in their daily needs.

Evelyn took a new loans to renovate her pig fence to buy some additional materials for her pig fence. Evelyn has a two pairs of piglets and she has also a mother pig in her pig fence.Evelyn got success in this business she help her husband for their daily needs and she also help the needs of her children because she earns through this business.

loans.use: to pay for materials for her pig fence renovation.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel con 37 años de edad,de estado civil casada,vive en casa propia,junto a su esposo y sus hijos, en el distrito de Nueva Arica,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de champú y cachamgas, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 01 año, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de activo fijo como sillas y mesas,para arreglos para su vivienda, compra de calamina para su casa, esto can la finalidad de tener un mejor nivel de vida.

Maribel es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and their children in the district of Nueva Arica, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Department, in a rural area of Peru. She has very good personal and professional references among the local residents. The people who live in this area work mainly in farming, commerce, and livestock.

She makes and sells shampoo and fried pastries. She has been doing this work for one year and her business is located in her home. She is requesting this loan to buy fixed assets, such as tables and chairs, and to make repairs to her home she will buy sheet metal for her house. This will provide her with a better quality of life.


Maribel is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets, like tables and chairs, and to make repairs to her home she will buy sheet metal for her house.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Azamat is 19 years old freshman in the International and Business Law Program at AUCA. He is from a village, where life and education are not as good as in the city. Universities like AUCA he has watched just on TV. Since school he had a passionate goal to enter the AUCA, where he would be able to study and develop himself. So now his parents are so proud of him and trying to help him with his tuition fee.

Last year finishing school, Azamat was a finalist of full Scholarship for the AUCA’s 1-year-study Preparatory Program, which allowed him to move to Bishkek city, live in the dormitory and have a stipend. During that year Azamat improved his English, learned how to think critically and logically and made a huge progress in his studies.

Becoming a freshman this year brought a new problem to Azamat, as this time he has to pay for his university degree by himself. As he says, he comes from a low-income family from a village. His father is a pensioner, and mother is a teacher. Unfortunately, teachers earn so little in Kyrgyzstan that can’t allow the tuition fee of AUCA. Azamat has an elder brother; unfortunately, due to the lack of money his brother couldn’t get a higher education when he finished school, so went to earn money for living as he could.

Azamat doesn’t want to follow his brother’s life and wants to make steps now in order to succeed and be independent in the future.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fee for his degree in International Business Law.  His parents are impoverished and cannot help.

loans.name: Daniel Adan

texts.en:
Daniel is a 23 year old man and he works at a sea food restaurant. He decided to look for independence and get a place of his own, so he left his parents' house not long ago and he has been planning this for a considerable time.

Is a huge step in Daniel's life, moving out of his house to live on his own and he has been doing well lately. His new place needs to be repainted and he also needs to change some windows, therefore Daniel is looking for a 10,000.00 MXN loan that will allow him to refurbish his new home.

loans.use: to fix his house

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
This young entrepreneur is Lotis from Polomolok, South Cotabato. She operates a school supplies store with plaques and brass plates. She also offers tarpaulin printing, photocopying, typing, and computer services. She employs two helpers in her store and her business partner is her husband, Arnold. They have one child who is studying in high school.

Now that the second semester for college students has just begun, Lotis wishes to enhance her business by both adding more school supplies and brass plates, as well as buying ink and toner for her computer printer and xerox machine. She is requesting financial assistance of 15,000 PHP to meet this purpose. She also anticipates that she will be busy printing tarpaulins as campaign materials for the upcoming National Elections in the Philippines, which are set for May 2016.

Eventually Lotis’ goal is to not only have a bigger location for her business but also build their own house and lot. She would be very happy to see her child with a college diploma from a reputable university.

Lotis is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to both add more school supplies and brass plates to her inventory, as well as buy ink and toner for her computer printer and xerox machine.

loans.name: Betsabe Elinor

texts.es:
La socia Betsabe tiene 55 años y es una persona responsable y se dedicada a trabajar en una clínica donde expende medicamentos y artículos de belleza. 
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar cremas de belleza y medicamentos en general.
Betsabe pertenece al banco “HUAYNA PICCHU” ubicada en la provincia y departamento del Cusco. Ella está contenta por el préstamo y agradece a los inversionista de KIVA por darle el crédito y asegura que pagar puntualmente el préstamo.
texts.en: Betsabe is 55 and is a responsible person. She works in a clinic where she sells medicines and beauty products. She is seeking a loan to purchase beauty creams and medicines in general. Betsabe belongs to the communal bank "HUAYNA PICCHU" located in the province and department of Cusco. She is happy to get the loan and is grateful to KIVA supporters for providing the loan, and she assures that she will pay it back on time.

loans.use: to buy beauty creams and medicines in general.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 27 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré en juin 2011. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui sont solidaires et très dynamiques. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
RAMATA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main  gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est  âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un  garçon et 7 filles. Elle s'active dans l'embouche depuis des années. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 3 moutons à 30 000 FCFA l'unité et avec le reste de l'argent, elle va acheter de l'aliment de bétail et supporter les frais de vétérinaires. Elle revend les moutons après élevage à 45 000 FCFA l'unité.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte acheter du mil, du niébé qu'elle va revendre dans la capitale.
texts.en:
This group of 27 members is part of a Banc Villageois inaugurated in June of 2011. Its members are women from the same village and surrounding areas who are very dynamic and share a bond of solidarity. Their activities are commerce and animal fattening.

RAMATA is the member standing on the right and raising her left hand. She is the group's featured borrower. She is 57 years old and married with one boy and seven daughters. She has been fattening animals for many years and has extensive experience in this activity.

She will use this loan to buy 3 sheep at 30,000 FCFA each. The remainder of her credit will allow her to buy animal feed and to cover veterinary fees. After raising the sheep, she will sell them for 45,000 FCFA each.

Ramata plans to use her profits to buy millet and niebe to sell in the capital.

loans.use: to buy 3 sheep.

loans.name: Andrea Carolain

texts.es: Andrea es una humilde joven de 19 años de edad que vive en compañía de sus padres en un barrio de Bogotá y en su afán de salir adelante emprendió su propio negocio al vincularse con una empresa multinivel que comercializa un mix de productos de cuidado personal y alimentos. Ella se encuentra cursando una carrera técnica que se costea con las utilidades de su actividad comercial, ya que sus padres no cuentan con los recursos disponibles para pagar sus estudios. Andrea desea aprovechar la época de navidad para ofrecer a sus clientes nuevo surtido de productos, para ello requiere de un capital adicional y para ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual invertirá en perfumes, cremas, colonias, talcos, cosméticos y demás.  Andrea a futuro se proyecta laborando en una empresa y alternamente comercializando productos por catálogo un ingreso adicional que utilizará para ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en: Andrea, 19, is a humble young woman who lives with her parents in Bogota. In her desire to be successful, she started up her own business, joining a multilevel firm that sells a variety of personal care products and foods. She is studying for a technical degree, which she pays for with her business activity, since her parents do not have the financial resources to pay her tuition. Andrea would like to take advantage of the holiday season to offer her customers a new selection of products. In order to do this she needs a new infusion of capital, so she is applying for a kiva loan, which is an opportunity to get involved with the financial world through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use the loan to invest in perfumes, creams, colognes, powders, cosmetics and more. In the future, Andrea sees herself working for a company and selling products through catalogs on the side, generating extra income which she will use to help out her parents.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, colognes, powders, cosmetics and more.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra es una confeccionista reconocida en un barrio de Bogotá que cuenta con una amplia experiencia de 20 años, actividad con la que ha logrado sostener su hogar al ser madre cabeza de familia y no contar con un cónyuge que le apoye.  Su único hijo tiene 9 años de edad y se encuentra cursando sus estudios académicos, es su motor y su inspiración, es por ello que diariamente trabaja con mucho compromiso en su taller de confección de ropa.  Este arte lo aprendió en el SENA, una institución del estado que forma en cursos y carreras técnicas, formación que le permitió ubicarse laboralmente y trabajar con distintas empresas, sin embargo su plan de vida era tener su propio negocio, el cual logró con mucho esfuerzo, y poco a poco adquirió máquinas de coser e insumos que le permitieron abrir al público.  Actualmente necesita capital para responder a unos pedidos de prendas sobre medidas que le solicitó un cliente y para ello realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar telas, hilos, pellones, botones y cremalleras. A futuro se proyecta con un taller con mayor capacidad instalada y ofreciendo un mejor bienestar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sandra is a well known seamstress in a neighborhood of Bogotá who has an extensive 20 years of experience. Through this business she has managed to support her household being a mother and head of family, having no spouse to help her. Her only son is 9 years old and is studying at school. He is her driving force and inspiration and the reason she works each day with such commitment in her sewing workshop.

She learned this art at Sena, a state institute that educates through courses and technical degrees, training that allowed her to find employment and work in different companies. However her life plan was to have her own business which she managed to do with great effort. Little by little she acquired sewing machines and supplies that allowed her to open to the public.

She currently needs capital to respond to some requests for made to measure clothing that a client has requested. So she is making a request for a loan, a loan from Kiva, an opportunity to enter the financial world through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy fabric, thread, interfacing, buttons and zippers. In the future she plans to have a workshop with greater installed capacity to offer better well-being for her son.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, interfacing, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 42-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a small gas station in which he sells liquified petroleum gas (LPG) to the rickshaw drivers. In their area many people drive auto rickshaws and there is much demand for fuel, so her husband decided to open a gas station so he can earn a maximum profit.

This strategy caused the establishment of his gas station in no time. Rubina's husband started this business with very low capital, however, he currently does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy more LPG cylinders to fulfill customer demand. With the rapid increase in demand for LPG, Rubina has requested a loan in order to help her husband buy more gas cylinders so he can meet this demand.

Rubina wants her husband to be able to establish his business so that she can make some savings to ensure the secure future of her children. She is very pleased with this cooperation. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy LPG gasoline cylinders for her husband's CNG Station.

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en:
Yeremiah is married with 3 children. He has been operating a retail shop for 5 years now and he is doing well. He is able to cater to his family's needs such as paying his children's school fees.

However, due to the ongoing challenges of inadequate capital and inflation, Yeremiah is not able to pay this term's school fees on time. Therefore, he is seeking a Kiva loan through Hofokam Ltd. to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be faithful.

Beatrice operates a farm where she grows bananas. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rain shortage.

Beatrice will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is that she will have a large-scale farm within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kawendo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Esther. She is a widow and a mother of eight children. She is a member of Kawendo Self Help Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in 2014. Esther has undergone training on enterprise and financial management.

Esther operates a green grocer store and does small-scale farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her grocery store by buying more vegetables and fruits. She hopes her income will increase and she will be able to provide better food and clothing to her children. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promise to pay well.

loans.use: to buy fruits & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nestor Eliseo

texts.es:
El socio Nestor tiene 58 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos. El es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora.  El  se dedica a brindar servicio de trasporte en el departamento del Cusco.
El socio solicito el préstamo porque  desea refaccionar sus casa, el necesita el dinero para comprar yeso, pintura y cemento. Así podrá tener un mejor lugar donde vivir y su familia también.
Nestor pertenece al banco "HUAYNA PICCHU" , y está muy  contento con el préstamo que le dieron los inversionistas de KIVA, el se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas del préstamo.
texts.en:
The borrower, Nestor, is 58 years old and has four children. He is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person, and he makes a living providing transport services in the department of Peru. 

Nestor is requesting a loan because he would like to renovate his home. He needs funds in order to purchase plaster, paint and cement. Thus, he would be able to have a better place for him and his family to live.  

He belongs to the “Huayna Picchu” bank and is very pleased with the loan that Kiva lenders gave him. He promises to make punctual loan payments.

loans.use: to buy plaster, paint and cement.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh is young man from Tajikistan. He likes his country much. Farrukh was born in 1996. He lives in a large family and his parents have been busy with animal husbandry.

Farrukh is a student of the 2nd course, thanks to his parents. He studies at the State University of Tajikistan. Farrukh learns tax deal. He studies well and he dreams to be a good specialist in the future.

Farrukh is asking for a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused.
