Annah operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Annah will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes that in the future she will have more cows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Colorful mats in Cebu are weaved in some towns like Badian. There is a high demand for these mats to be used for sleeping in many households, like a mattress. Anecita, 60 years old is engaged in buying and selling of this product at her place. This is the business that she had mastered for 24 years now.

Anecita is asking for a loan to buy more mats to sell, thus increasing her profits. Any earnings will be utilized for healthy meals for herself and her husband. She hope to continue her livelihood and to increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy mats to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has 9 children. He describes himself to be faithful.

Anthony operates a farm where he grows maize and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain shortage.

Anthony will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. His business goal is to have a larger farm within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha is a married woman from the municipality of Badian in Cebu. She lives with her husband in their home. To buy for their needs, she is dependent on her hog raising and sari-sari store businesses for an income.

Bernaditha is asking for a loan so she can manage her businesses well. She will use it to buy more piglets to raise and sacks of feed to make them grow healthy and attractive to buyers.

Bernaditha's profit will be spent on food and reinvestment in this type of business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 45-years old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a small crockery store, in which she sells utensils and crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldron and buckets.

Zareena is a mother of eight children and is singly responsible to feed them. She has only one source of income. She has to pay for the expenses of utility bills and household expenses alone. The condition of her house is not up to the mark according to the living standard.

Zareena wants buy more inventories to sell because most of her female customers purchase utensils in large quantity for making dowry. For this purpose more inventories are required to cope with the sudden increase in the demand.

Zareena requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy utensils and crockery items to generate more income. Zareena is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy utensils & crockery items to resell

loans.name: Nakham Group

texts.en: Seemoum’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Seemoum and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Seemoum and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Seemoum’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma’s age is 35. She is married and living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her financial condition is neither good nor bad, her husband earns just enough to contribute to household expenses.

Salma's husband is a furniture maker and makes very fine furniture such as wooden beds, chairs, tables, cots, etc. He has been doing this work for 15 years and has a lot of experience.

Recently her husband became sick and most of the savings were spent on his medical treatment. Now he is healed and hearty but does not have enough money to buy raw materials for making furniture. Therefore, Salma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy raw materials such as wooden planks, nails, glue, chip boards, etc. to continue his business.

Salma thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and is feeling happy after this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Omar Andres

texts.es: Andrés tiene 26 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero, es una persona responsable pues trabaja muy duro para ayudarle a su madre con los gastos de su humilde hogar. Se dedica hace 5 años a la producción de leche, ya que esta actividad le ha dado  muy buenos resultados económicos, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca de leche y así obtener mayores ganancias para seguir cumpliendo con su responsabilidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Andrés is 26 years old and single. He is a responsible person that works hard in order to help his mother with the household expenses of their humble home. 

For the past five years, he has made a living through milk production – as this business has done well financially. He is requesting a loan to purchase a milking cow in order to earn more profits and to continue fulfilling his responsibility at home.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel and her family live a simple life in the city of Baybay, Leyte. Hazel is the mother of a two-year-old son and she has raised him by selling rice. For this purpose, she is asking for a loan to buy rice in the community and then sell it to a merchandiser. In this way, she hopes to be more profitable in order to improve her livelihood. Hazel is a woman in her thirties and dreams of providing a good life for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en: Samphors is a 40-year-old widowed mother of a dependent child in her care. She lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She sells vegetables at a market and she has been in this business since 2010, earning approximately $12 a day Now Samphors would like to buy more vegetables to resell. This loan will help her family have an additional incomes to improve the family’s finances. In the future, she is going to expand her business, build a new proper house and support her child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be faithful.

She operates a farm, where she grows maize and beans. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of rain.

She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy farm supplies. She hopes that in the future, she will be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Two years ago, Alicia, a 58-year-old woman who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte, successfully started her own business. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business while her husband sells wood. They have six children, five adult-aged and one school-aged child.

Alicia is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as powdered chocolate drink, powdered juice, coffee, sugar, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, eggs, spices, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, and liquor.

In the future, Alicia is determined to enhance her livelihood so she can have enough earnings to not only cover their daily expenses but also be sustainabile.

loans.use: to buy powdered chocolate drink, powdered juice, coffee, sugar, chips, biscuits, bread, candies, toiletries, eggs, spices, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, and liquor.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sheila works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from barber shop. Sheila is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, and other materials needed in her business for her bicycle transport business.

Sheila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 59 years old and married with two children. Zenaida works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be committed.

Walter operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Walter will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes for resale. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to open a big boutique.

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a timber business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years. Cecilia also earns income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional timber to sell.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 45-year-old widow and the mother of 4 children. She is a hard-working woman who supports her family by providing tailoring services to her community. She has been doing this for many years. She is a skilled seamstress. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough money to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy stitching material, such as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers, and buttons, etc., to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her revenue to pay for personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material, such as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers, and buttons, etc., to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena, age 45, is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, and this is the only source of income for the family.

Zareena's husband needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of materials for the shop, including thread, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Zareena, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the things he needs with the help of the loan.

Zareena is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with a loan. Zareena is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and materials, such as thread, needles and clothing, for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en:
ULFAT is 48 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband owns a small firm in which he operates a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic bottles; he employs laborers to work the molding machines for daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic bottles, he needs different categories and qualities of raw materials. This time he has taken a huge contract, but does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw materials to continue his manufacturing. Therefore, ULFAT has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy plastic raw materials for the molding machines.

She has to look after a huge family; she takes care of each child, their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes she needs a huge income and her husband is the only person who is responsible to bear their household expenses. She is very happy about taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic raw materials for the molding machines in her husband's bottle manufacturing business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Like many women, it was financial constraints that encouraged Farzana to approach Kashf Foundation to apply for a loan. Farzana is a 43-year-old widow and the mother of 5 children. In order to support her family, she started a business selling buffalo milk. In her town, she is known for providing good-quality milk. She happily supports her family with the income generated by her business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to grow her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to help grow her sales and cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her husband, who owns a small embroidery company in partnership with his uncle. He has been running this business for many years, and has become an expert in his profession, knitting very fine embroidery through a machine over clothing.

There are many skills her husband has working at the company; he prepares embroidered dresses on a large scale. He wants to buy cloth to fulfill the needs of a large-scale business. Therefore, Shamshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy cloth to do embroidery over it.

Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been knitting embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband remains sick most of the time and unable to work. 

For the sake of her children, and to meet household expenses, Abida started an embroidery business at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her all the raw materials for knitting embroidery. She completes her tasks with her daughter over a wooden frame. 

She wants to sell knitted embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profits for her family. She has become an expert in her art and wants to buy raw material of her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown. Therefore, she requested a loan to buy raw material so she can knit more embroidery dresses to sell and generate maximum income. 

She is a mother of four sons and a daughter. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials of her own so she can directly sell embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Kiungu

texts.en: Kiungu is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to increase farm yield. His business goal is to have a bigger farm within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he can educate his children. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to increase farm yield.

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.en:
Haitgul is 43 years old. She is married and has two children.

Haitgul, like many local people in Tajikistan, has an animal husbandry business. She mainly feeds cows. Haitgul buys cows, feeds them for some months and then sells them in a local market.

Haitgul needs financial support because her sister is ill and she must buy medicine for her treatment. Haitgul is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy medicine for her sister's medical treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her sister.

loans.name: Sunar

texts.en: Financial constraints along with the desire for a better life and good-quality education for her 7 children are only a few of the important reasons that Sunar took a loan from Kashf Foundation to start a business selling animals. Sunar is 51 years old and married. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more animals to help grow her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and help grow her sales.

loans.name: Dalmalyn

texts.en:
Dalmalyn works hard to support her family. Dalmalyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

Dalmalyn has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Dalmalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre de 49 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 5 y 19 años de edad, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Tomas para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de arena de rio, con esta actividad el lleva 15 años de realizarlo, con la ayuda de este negocio a su familia ha sacado adelante.
Tomas gracias a la dedicación que le pone a su negocio ha logrado conseguir mucha clientela, por esa razón solicita un préstamo de diez mil quetzales para utilizarlo en la compra de más arena de rio y poder sí abastecer las necesidades de los clientes. Con esta inversión espera conseguir más clientes, fortalecer su negocio  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 49 year old man. He is married and has a nice family with six children aged 5 to 19. The family lives in the community of Sololá.

In order to earn his income, Tomas purchases and sells river sand. He has been carrying out this profession for 15 years and through it has gotten his family ahead. Thanks to his dedication to the business, Tomas has managed to attract many customers. For this reason, he is applying for a loan of ten thousand quetzales to buy more river sand so meet the needs of customers. With this investment, he hopes to get more customers, strengthen his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy river sand.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Sreymao is 38 years old and a mother of three children. Growing rice has been the main source of her family’s income for 20 years. Sreymao earns additional income by working as a construction worker to help provide for her family’s needs.

Her crop has not been growing well since it was threatened by insects; she may earn lower income than before.

This is the first loan for Sreymao with VisionFund, and she will use it to buy organic fertilizer, which is expected to increase crop productivity. She hopes her rice-paddy field will be improved and yield higher returns, as well as increase income to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, which is expected to increase crop productivity.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 29 years old and is the mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She sews bags, along with her son and daughter, at home, to feed her family. She has two sewing machines for sewing school bags and handbags, which are operated by her daughter. Her sons deal with outside customers, taking orders from them and sewing the bags on order.

Naseem wants to buy an additional sewing machine for sewing bags, but does not have enough cash in hand. Therefore, Naseem has requested a Kiva loan through field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy a sewing machine and additional raw materials such as rexine, zippers, buckles, etc., for sewing bags.

Her desire is to sell her sewed bags directly in the market, so that she can get a maximum reward against mutual effort. Naseem thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine, rexine, zippers and buckles so she can sew more bags for sale.

loans.name: Voahirana Hary Lalao

texts.fr:
Voahirana Hary Lalao vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Avec lequel, elle a pu acheter des matières premières supplémentaires (raphia, paniers, cuir) pour augmenter la production afin d'améliorer le revenu. Elle vient de conclure un contrat avec un nouveau client donc, elle a besoin de renforcer son fonds pour honorer la commande. Elle espère que vous allez encore être d'accord pour lui ré-accorder un autre prêt.
Le rêve de construire une autre maison n'est pas encore réaliser donc elle s'efforce en ce moment de faire son maximum d'épargner et d'améliorer son revenu.
texts.en:
Voahirana Hary Lalao sends sincere thanks for the loan. It has enabled her to buy additional raw material (raffia, baskets, leather) to increase her production and hence her income. She has just signed a contract with a new client, so she needs to reinforce her capital to fulfill the order. She hopes that you will agree to accord her a new loan.
Her dream of building another house has not yet become reality, so she is doing her best to save up as much as possible and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy raffia, baskets and leather.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 54-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband alone does not earn enough to support his family well. Razia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of four children.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to gain more profits so she can fulfill her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 39-year-old married woman. She is in the business of selling dried fruits in her community to earn income. In this way, she is better able to handle her family's needs and requirements effectively. She is contentedly operating her business for the sake of her family, who appreciates and shows respect for her efforts.

Due to lack of availability of funds, Shamim is currently unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase stock of peanuts, chilgoza (pine nuts) and almonds. This investment will help her to increase her sales.

Shamim dreams of providing a good lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of peanuts, chilgoza (pine nuts) and almonds to increase her sales.

loans.name: Zhanylai

texts.ru: Жанылай успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Жанылай на сегодняшний день есть 3 коровы, 15 овец. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). Жанылай обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Жанылай планирует направлять доходы от кредита в развитие ее деятельности.
texts.en:
Zhanylai successfully repaid her loan, using the funds for the intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone who helped her with financing. On her homestead, Zhanylai currently has three cows and 15 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to 19,000 som (KGS).

Zhanylai applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow to increase her livestock count. Zhanylai plans direct income from the loan in developing her activities.

loans.use: to buy one cow  in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru:
Жылдыз, 31 год, она замужем. У нее высшее образование, несколько лет работала в университете на факультете мировых языков преподавателем английского языка. Сейчас Жылдыз в отпуске по уходу за ребенком, всего у Жылдыз 4 детей. Она очень доброжелательная, трудолюбивая, целеустремленная женщина. Супруг Жылдыз работает на Авто заправочной станции. У Жылдыз в собственности есть двухэтажное здание в центре города, которое она сдает в аренду под офисы. С лета 2 этаж здания пустует и Жылдыз решила сама заняться предпринимательской деятельностью и открыть магазин по реализации одежды турецкого производства. Поставку товаров будет осуществлять сестра которая ездит в Турцию за товаром. 
Жылдыз узнала, что в Банке "Бай-Тушум" есть возможность получить льготный кредит на Стартовый бизнес. Она прослушала курс по финансовой грамотности, произвела расчеты и оценку своего будущего бизнеса. Из-за того, что помещение собственное и не нужно тратить средства на аренду, прибыль от бизнеса будет хорошая - около 78,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Первыми клиентами будут знакомые и родственники, Жылдыз уже поговорила с ними и они были заинтересованы, первую партию одежды привезет под заказ, и будет постепенно расширяться. Сделав расчеты, Жылдыз пришла к выводу, что ей необходим кредит в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), на запрошенную сумму она и  приобретет первую партию одежды. Будущая прибыль от бизнеса и увеличение активов, позволят Жылдыз дать ее детям достойное воспитание и образование.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 31 years old and married. She has higher education. She has worked at the university for some year, as an English teacher at the faculty of international languages. Curently she is on maternity leave. Zhyldyz has four children.

Zhyldyz is a very good, hardworking and purposeful woman. Her husband works at a petrol station. Zhyldyz owns a two storey building in the center of the city, which she rents out as office space. The first floor has been empty since the summer, and Zhyldyz deicded to go into business herself and open a store for selling Turkish produced clothing.

Zhyldyz learned that there is an opportunity to get a preferential loan for starting a business at the bank "Bai Tushum". She took a course on "financial literacy", made calculations and assessed her future business. Since the premises are hers and she doesn't need to spend money on rent, the income from the business will be good - around 78,000 som (KGS) per month. Her first customers will be acquaintances and relatives. Zhyldyz already talked to them and they were interested.

Zhyldyz will order the first batch of clothing, and will gradually expand. After making calculations, she concluded that she needs a loan of 150,000 som (KGS). For the requested amount she will purchase the first batch of clothing. The future income from the business and an increase in assets will allow Zhyldyz to give her children a worthy upbringing and education.

loans.use: to start her own clothing business, by purchasing clothes for selling

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 44 года, замужем, мать 4 сыновей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 11 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день у Гулнары есть 4 коровы, продает молоко, на 1,10 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает люцерну, чеснок и ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль около 25,000 сом (KGS). Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от бизнеса Гулнара и дальше планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 44 years old, married and the mother of four sons. She has secondary education. She has worked with agriculture for a period of 11 years. Currently she has four cows from which she sells the milk. She grows alfalfa, garlic and barley for selling on 1.1 hectares of own land and 1.0 hectares of rented land. The monthly income is around 25,000 som (KGS).

Gulnara turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow for increasing the volume of ecological milk for selling. She plans to invest the income from the business in further developing it and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of ecological milk for sale

loans.name: Paridahon

texts.ru: Паридахон, 51 год, в разводе, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Она очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве Паридахон на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 7 овец, на 0,70 Га земли выращивает кукурузу, ячмень. Ежемесячный доход Паридахон - около 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Паридахон решила развивать ее бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Паридахон хочет вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Paridahon is 51 years old, divorced and has two children. She has secondary education. She has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for 20 years already. She is very responsible and hardworking. On her farm she currently has three cows and seven sheep. She grows sweet corn and barley on 0.70 hectares of land. Her monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS). This money is not enough for a worthy life.

Paridahon decided to develop her business. She turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 110,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows. She plans to invest the incoem from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. This will allow her to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase her family income.

loans.name: Bebi's Group

texts.en:
Bebi, standing to the extreme left, is a 42-year-old married woman from Manmad of Maharashtra state. There are three members in her family. She, along with her group members, seeks a loan of 45,000 INR. Bebi will use her portion of the loan amount to construct a hygienic toilet in her home.

Bebi lives in a home with no access to a closed toilet, which is forcing the family members to use the outdoors for defecation and to relieve themselves. They are forced to travel long distances at odd hours of the night sometimes. Building a private toilet in the house will help prevent diseases that are caused from open defecation and promote a healthier lifestyle.

Plus, having a toilet will save them a certain amount every month that they are spending on diseases caused by open defecation. This loan will facilitate access to a better, safer, healthier quality of life.

loans.use: to construct a hygienic toilet in her home.

loans.name: Aida Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 46 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la siembra de arveja, a pesar de que es un trabajo muy duro, lo realiza a diario, esta actividad  le permite obtener gconanancias para ayudarle a su esposo los gastos de su hogar, solicita de este crédito para la compra de  abono, para que sus cultivos sean de buena calidad, y así podrá vender a un buen precio
texts.en:
Noemí is 46 years old.  She is married.  She lives with her husband and her daughter.  She works planting peas.  Even though it is a very tough job, she does it daily.  This job allows her to obtain earnings to help her husband with the household costs.

She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers so that her crop can be of good quality and thus be able to sell at a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her crop of peas.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 40-year-old lady; she is living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

In the beginning, her son was a not much skillful person for working a lathe. He has been learning the techniques of working a lathe from professionals. Now, he came to know how to operate a lathe, so that he can carry on his newly started business. Due to his lack of experience, the lathe got damaged and needs maintenance.

Therefore, Irshad has requested a loan for her son so that he can fulfill the deficiencies of the lathe and can buy additional tools, dies, spare parts, etc. Irshad is tension-free now because she hopes that her son will be an expert soon and generate reasonable income as an expert turner.

Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix the lathe and purchase tools, dies, and spare parts for her son, so he can operate the lathe in a good manner and can generate constant income.

loans.name: Gulsinmoh

texts.ru: Это Гулсинмох. Ей 49 лет. Она жительница района Шахритус. Гулсинмох замужем и мать троих детей. У нее 23, 22 и 20 летные взрослые дети. Ее муж занимается ремонтом электрических оборудований (холодильник, печки, утюг, телевизор и другие). Ее дочка на рынке продает продукты. Сама Гулсинмох занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она занимается выращиванием скота. Ей в работе помогает сыновья. Гулсинмох уже более 6 лет продвигает свой деятельность. Сейчас она хочет купить несколько скота и корм для скота, чтобы развиваться дальше и не потерять источник дохода. Доход от животноводства обеспечить ее семью. Гулсинмох очень нужна поддержка с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
This is Gulsinmoh. She is 49 years old and a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is married and the mother of three children. They are 23, 22 and 20 years old. Her husband works with repairing electrical equipment (refrigerators, ovens, irons, TVs and similar). Her daughter sells food at the market.

Gulsinmoh works with farming. She breeds livestock. Her sons help her with the work. She has worked with this for more than six years. Currently she would like to purchase some livestock and fodder for them, in order to develop her business further and not lose her source of income. The income from the livestock provides for her family. Gulsinmoh needs you help very much.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Roxana Maribel

texts.es: A sus 31 años de edad Roxana ya cuenta con vivienda propia en la que vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y tenaz que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante, por lo que desde hace un tiempo se dedica a la elaboración de carteras y pantalones cortos, actividad que le permite ganarse la vida y estar al pendiente de sus hijos. Roxana desea mejorar su vivienda y para ello ha decidido encementar las paredes de su vivienda, además desea terminar de cambiar el techo de su vivienda, al no contar con la liquidez económica necesaria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada y clavos para encementar las paredes y cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible. Con el crédito anterior ella inicio con el cambio del techo pero aun le falto una parte.
texts.en:
At 31 years of age, Roxana already has her own house. She lives with her husband and two children at the ages of 7 and 3. She is entrepreneurial and tenacious. She strives every day to get ahead. For some time now, she has been making bags and shorts. This allows her to earn a living and attend to her children.

Roxana want to improve her home for her children and decided to cement the walls. She also wants to finish changing the roof of the house. She does not have the necessary financial means and requests a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, galvanized sheet and nails to cement the walls and change the roof as soon as possible. She started changing the roof with her previous loan but she is still missing a part.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, galvanized sheet and nails to cement the walls and change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Urkuya

texts.ru: Уркуя, 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Уркуи- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Уркуи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, а также имеет 3,60 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает лук, фасоль, клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уркуя обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков и 10 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Уркуя планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Urkuya is 34 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. She has vocational education. As a main income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. Thanks to Urkuya's persistent work, her farm currently has three cows. She also has 3.60 hectares of land, on which she grows onion, haricots and clover every year. The monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Urkuya turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase three bull-calves and ten sheep for fattening and reselling. Urkuya plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase three bull-calves and ten sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 45 лет, замужем, многодетная мама 7 детей. У Аиды среднее образование, по характеру очень трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. Аида в качестве основного дохода для ее семьи, с 2009 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Аиды, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 4 коровы, 11 овец и 3 лошади. На 0,15 Га земли она выращивает чеснок. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 породистых телят для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Аида планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aida is 45 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has secondary education. She is a hardworking and responsible woman by character. As a main income for her family, Aida has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 2009, after having started this business with 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aida's persistent work, she currently has four cows, eleven sheep and three horses. She also grows garlic on 0.15 hectares of land. The monthly income is around 19,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Aida turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two purebred calves for increasing her herd. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase two purebred calves in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Shehzadi

texts.en:
Shehzadi, 30 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base.

In order to avoid shortages, Shehzadi needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Aina

texts.ru: Айна, 55 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей, все дети взрослые и самостоятельные, живут отдельно. Айна и ее супруг на пенсии, но Айна продолжает трудиться, она работает фельдшером. Также около 34 лет назад Айна начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айны на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы, 26 овец и 1 лошадь. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 2,31 ГА она выращивает клевер для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айна обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов продаж экологически чистого, вкусного домашнего молока. Айна планирует и дальше расширять ее бизнес так как она хочет подготовить приданное для ее дочери.
texts.en:
Aina is 55 years old, married, and has five children. All the children are grown and independent, living separately. Aina and her husband are retired, but Aina continues to work. She works as a paramedic. Also, about 34 years ago, Aina began to raise livestock and crops, starting with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Aina currently has four cows, 26 sheep and one horse. On her own plot of land measuring 2.31 hectares, she grows clover to sell. Her overall monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS) per month.

With the aim of further developing her business, Aina applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow to increase her sales of organic, delicious, homemade milk.

Aina plans to expand her business even further since she wants to prepare a dowry for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales.

loans.name: Gulruh

texts.ru: Гулрух 47-летняя жительница района Шахритус. Шахритус находится на юго-западной части Таджикистана и имеет хорошие погодные условия для ведения сельского хозяйства. Гулрух проживает здесь давно. Она замужем и имеет детей. У нее только дочери. Ее муж работает в коммунальном хозяйстве села. Гулрух сама занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота в течение 4 лет. Она покупает молодых телят, откармливают их несколько месяцев, и потом вывозит на продажу. Ей в этом помогают ее дочери. Еще. Целью данного кредита является приобретения скота. Гулрух планирует увеличить поголовье скота и тем самым улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она надеется на Вашу помощь. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас.
texts.en:
Gulruh is a 47 years old resident of the Shahrituz region. Shahritus is in the south western part of Tajikistan and has good weather conditions for farming. Gulruh has lived here for a long time. She is married and has children. She only has daughters. Her husband works in the village's municipal services.

Gulruh has worked with breeding cattle for a period of four years. She purchases young calves, breeds them for some months and then sells them. Her daughters help her with this. The aim of this loan is to purchase cattle. Gulruh plans to increase her herd and this way improve the family's living conditions. She hopes for your help. You can support her now.

loans.use: to purchase cattle
